Forum Post: 
Post title: Downloader - Would this be a resource?
Post description: I am going to be developing a downloader for Moodle for a client. I am wondering what is the best way to develop it. I have made an Activity module before, the Map Module . I have looked here to figure out what would be the best way to develop the module. Basically the downloader would be available for teachers. It would download resources for a course and allow the teacher to choose which groups/students and/or which assignments they want to include. I want the downloader to available to all courses by default. I have looked at other downloader modules but the client has resources stored in non-standard methods on various servers. The easiest way I could think to make it would be a resource. But these are the reasons I think it wouldn't work. The resource would have to be manualy created for each course The link to the resource would show to students(unless it was manually hidden) The creator of the resource would have fill out the configuration form when there is really need to create a separate instance for each course. I thought about making it a block but I really need a form that would be in the main portion of the page so that the user could select the needed resources. I looks like I could make the main page file in the block folder but then it seems I would have to duplicate a lot of programming for creating the other parts of the page. Any ideas? Thanks

Forum Post: 
Post title: Teachers can't select Resources or Activities that are Plugins
Post description: I've got a headscratcher here. Teachers on my site are not able to add new activities from our plugins (Checklist, BigBlueButton, Lightbox Gallery); nothing added to our site shows up in the activity chooser menu, nor in the dropdown menus. They show up for administrators (for some reason Lightbox Gallery shows up for Manager role). I checked the site permissions and teachers are set to Allow for create new instances. All of these plugins are enabled on the site, they are all the most recent versions and teachers have no other role than editing teacher. They worked fine in 2.2. When I made the update to 2.3 everything seemed to check out and all of them work when I try to add them as an Admin. I looked in each plugin to make certain they include the addinstance permission in the mod/db/access.php file. They do. Courses added/restored after the upgrade to 2.3 are working properly and teachers can view the plugin activity resources and activities. The downside is that it does not work if I backup/restore one of the courses in which it is not already working. When I create a blank course and restore a course backup (from one that was not working) Merging the contents into the existing course, then I'm back in business. As a last resort I'll do this if I have to for all of the courses but I really don't want to. I've tried deleting them from the installation and reinstalling, I've tried prohibiting the teacher permissions and then allowing to see if that would fix it. I'm not sure what else to try at this point. Are those courses just broken?

Forum Post: 
Post title: A navigation aid in learning networks
Post description: We would like to invite comments and feedback on a module we created that advises users on which (Moodle) course to take next. The Learning Technology Development Programme of the Educational Technology Expertise Centre (Open Universiteit Nederlands) is aimed at innovative learning technologies to create, promote and use learning networks. A major theme is 'navigation' through a learning network. The Road Mapping (ROMA) project focuses on exploiting collective learner progress as a feedback mechanism to aid successful learner navigation and improve educational yield. One of the ROMA projects determined whether feedback influences the track followed by the learner. An experiment was set up, where the activity nodes of the learning network were modelled as Moodle courses. A new module was developed to advise the learner which course to take next. The module relies on the completion of courses, which in our case was designed by using a quiz. The experiment also changed the standard Moodle navigational aids, such as the breadcrumbs, and therefore can not run with one of the standard themes. In addition to the new module, some of the existing Moodle code needed to be changed (detailed information is available in the attachment). The experiment is no longer available, but some further information can be found at our DSpace server , e.g. http://hdl.handle.net/1820/245 , http://hdl.handle.net/1820/353 , http://hdl.handle.net/1820/436 . We would welcome any thoughts on the approach we have taken or any advice for improvements.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Training Theme for Moodle
Post description: Hi Moodle Community! TNG Consulting Inc. is pleased to announce the first public ALPHA release of a new Training theme for Moodle , developed by Michael Milette (that's me!). Available on Moodle.org for Moodle 3.1 or later, Training theme for Moodle is a simple and easy clean looking theme uncluttered by lots of options which is great for beginners or when you just need to get something that looks great out the door quickly. Training includes modern features such as: Large and small size logo or banner; Navbar /custom menu can be placed above or below the logo / banner; The colour of the Navbar /custom menu can be dark on light or light on dark; Built-in support for Moodle filter tags in the custom menu means compatibility with FilterCodes; Course listings can be displayed in enhanced traditional or Masonry (grid or sometimes also called panel view); Site pages and links in the navigation block can be hidden on the front page . They will re-appear when in edit mode. This enables you to create publicly accessible pages on your website without having to enable guest user access; Customizable favicon; Customizable CSS ; More to come. Please feel free to report issues and make suggestions in the Bug Tracker. You are also invited to post questions and suggestions by replying to this post. Best regards, Michael Milette

Post description: I just installed Moodle on Bluehost.com through their SimpleScripts. Everything set up fine. I added a few users and classes. Everything was fine. The Moodle version is 1.9.5. I wanted to install the Flashcard module, So I downloaded/uploaded it and unzipped it to the mod folder. A subfolder named flashcard was created. I then tried to go the Admin folder, and got a blank page. After a little hunting around, I ended up deleting the folder. Everything came back to normal. I then got a file for of the flashcard from the latest build. (I think its the latest). There was one on the web that had a different version (with bulk upload ), buth that sent me back to Moodle's latest build. I again uploaded the file, and expanded it this time directly to the mod folder. The mod folder has a "flashcard". Under the flashcard folder are a number of files, a dbfolder with a couple of files, a lang folder, and a pix folder. The admin page worked this time, but now the Notification page is blank when I try to access it. So I turned on debugging from the Site Administration> Server >Debugging menu and selected both "Show all reasonable PHP debug messages" and checked Display Debug messages. When I again clicked on the Notification link, the following message appeared: Fatal error: Call to a member function get_manager() on a non-object in /home8/letsrea1/public_html/moodle/mod/flashcard/lib.php on line 25 Looking at lib.php line 25 is $dbman = $DB->get_manager();

Forum Post: 
Post title: Flashcard - New maintenance track
Post description: Hi guys, here come some news of the "from now" generation of flashcard. As for some projects that were highly demanding of flashcards, i started reviewing the upgraded version of Tomasz and redrew a more "moodle way" handling of the media files for cards. In addition was a review of the card deck customisation setup. At the same moment, i was reworking Magtest and Tracker for a more complete handling of new Moodle 2 APIs. Thus the flashcard was completed with course completion implementation and more consistant course overview reports, to get it raised at a "state of the art" level. We then worked with Tomasz to check how a merge was possible. We concluded in shifting back to my worktrack for the future, as Tomasz is not available for the moment on Moodle contribution work and has no projects demanding for flashcards. The recent version published is a intensively tested and used version installed on 55 secondary schools and 40 higher education schools with active users. So it will be frequently addressed for bugfixes and will consolidate. Yet is this version stable enough for daily production. It should not evolve any more for a while, unless if we can finish integration of a video player to provide video handling on cards. We abandonned idea of a conversion script. Tomasz opted for handling media as embeds in a text card. I kept my original idea to have mediatyped card side, and use an explicit filearea for those medias. Possible is it a bit less flexible to build cards in any way the teacher wants, but gets simpler to use for people having no time to format content. This version is being tested from 2.3 to 2.5. 2.6 adventurers might report us compatibility issues to schedule work on for the future. Cheers Valery.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Etherpad-Lite: Experience and security
Post description: Hi I've been looking at the Etherpad-Lite addon and from a user perspective Etherpad-Lite much looks like what our teachers asked us for "collaborative editing". However I see the last version of the addon now dates back to mid 2012 - which doesn't seem very active although I can at least confirm it still runs on Moodle 2.5.x. In terms of security - I do know that Etherpad in its basic setup just cares about the pad ID - meaning that once you know the pad's ID you can edit it, simple as that. It isn't really intended to share documents online and keep them away from others inside the org (i.e. Teachers and Students) Now there seem to be LDAP user plugins (I haven't checked them out yet) for etherpad-lite but I'm a bit sceptic by the fact, that etherpad only uses the API key to authenticate Moodle (ahem: the user's browser as it seems, the user browser communicates with Etherpad, not the moodle server , right?) and the pad ID (which you can see in the page source code of an etherpad page inside Moodle. Maybe I'm looking at it from the wrong angle but even if it looks promising from a user's perspective, I'm not really at warm when looking a bit closer at the addon for Moodle - when you need at least some protection so classes can't overwrite pads they shouldn't get access to. What's your take - anyone using this addon in real-life? -- Mat

Forum Post: 
Post title: SynHi filter updated for Moodle 3.9 to 4.1
Post description: Hello, I have updated the SynHi filter as follows: Release 39.1.0 for Moodle 3.9 to 4.1: https://moodle.org/plugins/filter_synhi/39.1.0/28851 https://github.com/gjb2048/moodle-filter_synhi/releases/tag/V39.1.0 with: Changed to semantic versioning 2.0.0 ( https://semver.org/ ) for the release value, whereby the 'major' number is the minimum Moodle core branch number.  The 'version' property still needs to follow the Moodle way in order for the plugin to operate within the core API. Update EnlighterJS from 3.4.0 to 3.6.0. Minify Syntaxhighlighter with 'uglifyjs syntaxhighlighter.js -c -o syntaxhighlighter.min.js'. This release still could contain bugs and so I strongly recommend that you check on a test server first!  Not sure how to set one up?  Then look at the 'Installer packages' on https://download.moodle.org/releases/latest/ .  Ensure that you have multiple backups of all data before using.  Please report any issues. i.e. 'bugs' with this release ONLY here.  Before doing so please read 'Reporting issues' on the 'Information' tab on the filter 'Settings' under 'Site administration' -> 'Plugins' -> 'Filters' -> 'SynHi'. Note: The MathJax avoidance code has been removed as I believe the changes mean that it is not required.  If you find a conflict, then please let me know with screen shots / replication instructions. If you find this post useful, then please mark it so. Gareth

Forum Post: 
Post title: JPlayer(video player)
Post description: Hello everyone, I've been working on a little video player for Moodle 2.x, named JPlayer(this name might change). This player uses the latest free version of JW Player 6. I am looking for a second opinion about it, user feedback about this activity and some help testing it. So if someone has some time to try this out and send me some feedback, that would be helpful. This activity is still in development, so i dont recommend using it on a production server . I have tested this only on Moodle 2.3 and Moodle 2.4... This player is based on Matt Bury's MediaPlayer(Thank you!), but this is a lightweight version of that. It does not have the snapshots, bitstreaming, metaviewer, skins, logo, etc.. functionality(mostly because the free version of JW Player 6 does not support those). Although it enables you to use start image, multiple captions, playlists(from youtube or upload multiple mp4 files - HD Switch is supported too) and a little bit more. Currently only mp4, flv, webm video formats are supported. Captions support is the same as goes for JW Player 6(vtt for example). I have'nt done much documentation about it, but it should be relatively easy to understand it. You can download and try this out - https://github.com/t6nis/moodle-mod_jplayer Or you can go and view some examples here(login as guest) - http://moodle.t6nis.com/course/view.php?id=3 I have'nt figured out a decent way for streaming support... If you find any issues please report them here or better in github.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Resume Module
Post description: Hello All, I have recently install the resume module to a 1.6.2 moodle for demos and testing. This worked beautifully!!! and i was very happy. Now i have come to install the module on a live Moodle site. tables created fine everything seems ok. I selected add new activity in edit mode, typed in the name for the button label. - "Resume last studied lesson " click update and I get this error: Not Found The requested URL /mod/user/view.php was not found on this server . When i cannot go any further i returned to the main course page and see that the button had actually been added, great. So i click on the button and I get the same error message. I have tried this with admin and student accounts, same result. Obviously there is no user directory in the mod folder, so i assume the PHP is calling on the incorrect directory location. This should probably be /user/view.php without the mod in front?? perhaps im wrong? ----------------------------------------- OK Scrap that, i figured it out. The students and admins i used for testing had no record of which last viewed resources. I went into a preview of a lesson and back out, clicked the resume button, it now works ok. same with student account.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Etherpad Lite Error: Could not get api version
Post description: Until Version 2021073000 the Etherpad plugin worked for us. In all newer Versions we got the Error: Could not get api version Now I debugged a little bit and found out, that in the file etherpadlite\classes\client.php in the function get_version() the $url = $this->baseurl; ends with /api and not with /api/ what leads to an Etherpad instead of the JSON . After adding the missing slash with the following code it works for us: if(!(substr_compare($url, "/", -1) === 0)){ $url.="/"; }

Post title: Poll module
Post description: The university I'm working for wants to be able to allow students to choose which classes they might be interested in registering for - that is, if we have the ability to offer latin or greek next semester, but don't care which one is run, we want to leave it up to the potential students to decide in a democratic manner.  This would go for a wide variety of classes, as well, because we offer many classes that might interest people who only wish to take one or two courses with us. I was thinking that perhaps we could have it tied to the courses table so that an admin could simply drag "possible" classes for the next semester from one box to the next, much like you add teachers to courses or what-have-you.  Each student would get two votes, or, better yet, have some kind of instant-runoff setup, and be able to view what classes are getting the most votes.  If they want to change their vote so that they can shift the balance from one course to another (and they don't think the course they REALLY want will be taught that semester) up until a cutoff date. Is anyone else working on such an idea?

Forum Post: 
Post title: New contrib: Availability conditions: Restriction by language
Post description: About this plugin This is a availability condition plugin to make Moodle in multiple languages easier.  Instead of using the multilanguage filter, it is possible to provide for each language a different resource or activity. Why this plugin With a language filter one can do great things.  But this filter is not easy to implement and sometimes a resource has to show localised multimedia. So this plugin allows french users to see french subtitles, dutch users see dutch video and english users download english attachments. More info here: https://moodle.org/plugins/view.php?plugin=availability_language

Forum Post: 
Post title: Xamaleon (Alternative resource for pre-registration)
Post description: * Some of my work required to carry out some type of preregistration (search) for the entity (school / company) could select the right audience for your courses or events. When using systems like Joomla, you can perform this kind of task because there are many plugins for it. The fact is that once I came across a situation, unexpected for me, one of those "surveys" had a demand very high, it made the database of Joomla stay overwhelmed and consequently there was a fall of link several times. After that I started to evaluate the use of these tools and came to the conclusion that we were getting much "garbage" accumulated in our database; were the information that served only for research (preregistration). As a result, I decided to change the way we conduct these events ( preregistration / search ), using a feature that would free the database. It was once developed a tool for this purpose, it is a registration system (preregistration) based on the storage of information on XML files. For a while I used the feature and was very good to me and the companies I worked, we had no more problems with the database. However, this "tool", stood in my files (backups) for a few years. Some time ago, I remembered her and I decided to give a "polished" in the codes. The result of this work is the XAMALEON (Soordle.org part of the project). A system ( Open Source ) modular, multi-languages, all built in PHP and XML . It can work in parallel to any platform (Joomla, Moodle etc.) You have on your site. With this system it is possible to perform pre-registration online without any impairment in its other applications. Fully configurable and with possible expansion without major difficulties. Anyway, I could talk a lot about the system here, but I think that is not the case now. In the desire to contruibuir with the Moodle community, please know that the system is available for download at: www.eadgames.com.br If you want to see a video example of the system being up and running: I hope this "feature" will be useful somehow to distance learning professionals. * google translator

Forum Post: 
Post title: Google Apps integration: Google Apps/Moodle - Invalid Email error
Post description: Hello, Earlier this summer we successfully integrated Google Apps and our Moodle (1.9.3) installation with SSO. Things have been working pretty well, and the teachers LOVE it! However, we are running in to some problems with a few users (teachers and students). These users are able to log in to Moodle fine, but get an "Invalid email. Unable to process your request at this time, please try again later" message from Google. Their Google Apps user is never created then. I contacted Google support and they believe that the first time the user logged in and attempted to go to a Google App, their account creation failed for some reason, but that Moodle must have flagged it in some way as being successful so it doesn't attempt to create the account again. Does anyone know if this is truly how Moodle handles these accounts, and which table/column that setting would be held in so I could change it? Also, if this is the case, is there something we can change in Moodle so it doesn't flag the account unless it was truly successful? I'd appreciate any help or insight! Thanks, Jill

Post title: Flashcard module add-on: PNG images and Internet Explorer
Post description: Hi there. First up, thanks for the flashcards module. It is really great. We use it often. I came across a bad gotcha today. and I thought Ishould share it. If you use flashcards with images AND you use png images AND your students are using Internet Explorer (6 have not tested 7). Only the image on the first flashcard will show. Subsequent card images will not show. It seems to be to do with IE 's handling of the style.display css tag. So you will need to use jpg's

Post description: I've installed the integration on my 2.0.1 moodle server , and I've run into a couple of problems. First and foremost is that I can't get access to the sync block. I turned debugging on, and I get this: Warning: Parameter 1 to block_gdata::user_can_addto() expected to be a reference, value given in C:\inetpub\ wwwroot \lib\blocklib.php on line 1427 Can I assume that this is where the problem is? Any ideas how to fix it? I manually ran cron, and was able to get my moodle admin account synced to google apps. But the gmail block doesn't show anything, and if I try and access gmail externally after logging in to moodle, it wants me to log in again. I'd guess that means that SSO isn't working properly, but I'm not sure where to begin to troubleshoot it. Help?

Forum Post: 
Post title: FLAX language learning module
Post description: ```text
We are happy to announce a new contributed module for language learning,
called FLAX.

FLAX helps automate the production and delivery of practice exercises
for learning English. You, the teacher, can create exercises from the
textual content of digital libraries. You can also create your own
digital library collections, add them to the course as resources, and,
optionally, share them within your institution.

FLAX comprises two modules that are intended to be installed together:

1. The language learning activity module provides a way of designing
and delivering language learning exercises, based on the contents of
digital library collections.

2. The digital library resource module allows teachers to create their
own digital library collections and add them to their course.

See the 
FLAX module documentation
 and 
try it out
 for more details.

(Maintained by Dean Stringer, University of Waikato, New Zealand)
```

Post title: ELIS ETL issue
Post description: All I am using the community version of ELIS and have come across an issue that I am not sure how to resolve.  When I go to the ELIS Health Center it tells me that the ETL process is in progress and that 2439 records have been processed and 23622 are left. It has been this way for a few days.  When I check the cron logs I see this: Running s:22:"user_activity_etl_cron";() from eliscoreplugins_user_activity... Calculating user activity from Moodle log * processing records from time:0 to time:1327531662 * processing records from time:1327531662 to time:1327531662 * processing records from time:1327531662 to time:1327531662 * processing records from time:1327531662 to time:1327531662 * processing records from time:1327531662 to time:1327531662 It appears that the ETL process is stuck at this point because all subsequent cron runs show the same timestamp.  I looked at the mdl_log table and I have two records with that timestamp for the same user viewing two different courses. Has anyone else seen this and if so what did you do to get past it? Thanks, Scott

Post title: Flash module add-on: Moodle Flash Best Practise
Post description: Hi All, Our company (CLT) does a fair amount of screen casting which we output in flash. We also help business to use Moodle to build internal training on Moodle, so we do a lot of end user training on how to use Moodle and run courses, having said that I would like to start a discussion to bring some clarity to how we, as practioners, use Flash in Moodle. By way of starting this, I will list our current method, and hopefully may bring out some better "best practise" for all flash implementations. Using products like Camtasia, Captivate and of course flash. 1. Camtasia and Captivate: Camtasia and Captivate outputs have incorporated html, preloaders, flash file. Method: 1.1. navigate to the output directory, zip all the files in the directory. 1.2 upload and upzip the zip file into the course file area 1.3 In the Moodle course area, use the resource to create a link to an html file to hook to the html file produced by camtasia and captivate.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Adaptive Quiz - release 2.5.0 (so far Moodle 4.4 and 4.5 only)
Post description: Hello community! Just taking a chance to post a quick announcement here - a new version of the  'Adaptive Quiz' plugin, 2.5.0, has just been released! Check the release notes here - https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_adaptivequiz/2.5.0/38020 The main new feature is enabling Moodle's text editor for custom attempt feedback, the user manual can be found in the plugin's wiki here - https://github.com/vtos/moodle-mod_adaptivequiz/wiki/Custom-Attempt-Feedback This has been a demanded feature for quite a long time, I'm happy this has become available now. Also, check out the placeholders feature there 😉 The plugin still supports Moodle up to version 4.5 only, the plugin is still not compatible with Moodle 5.x due to the question bank changes. However, this is exactly what the next release will focus on. Another good news is that now the plugin supports MSSQL ! The support is experimental though, it's not covered by full manual testing. But from further releases, full MS SQL support will become a plugin's feature inevitably, without the word 'experimental'. This new version doesn't bring the new custom feedback feature to Moodle 4.1 and 4.0. Please, leave your requests under this post if you're still planning to use Moodle 4.0 or 4.1, but would like to have this new feature, and it will be considered for further releases. Thank you for using the plugin and helping to make it better, happy Moodle-ing!

Post title: New activity: Wavefront Renderer - a 3D model viewer
Post description: Hi everyone, I'm pleased to announce the release of a new 'Wavefront' 3D model viewer plugin. This allows teachers and students to upload .OBJ (Wavefront) 3D models to Moodle. Students can: manipulate the model on screen add comments The plugin is available to download from the Moodle plugins Directory here: https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_wavefront The plugin ships with two example models (a human skeleton and a Greek vase). Some teaching examples - view and comment on models before they are 3D-printed familiarisation with complex machinery exploring anatomy games development ... and I'm sure there are many others I haven't thought of. Please feel free to let me know of any bugs/issues/improvements - preferably via the bug tracker here: https://github.com/iandavidwild/moodle-mod_wavefront/issues Thanks, Ian.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Plenary meeting activity
Post description: I have been working on a new Moodle activity module to facilitate meetings in person and online. The activity is meant to encourage the use of parliamentary procedure to provide an organized meeting experience and to facilitate record keeping. Users can submit motions and vote on them with actions recorded. After the meeting, the records can be used to generate minutes or be assessed for grades or other feedback provided. For online meeting, that activity may be used with included optional conferencing integrations using either Jitsi meet or the system in Deft response block or with an external conferencing system alongside the activity.  The activity can be configured to adjust for different types of meetings. The code is now available at https://GitHub.com/dthies/moodle-mod_plenum . If you want to try the activity, you can create a free user account and a sample course and have a meeting with a small group at https://deftly.us .

Forum Post: 
Post title: CMS integrations: Integrations: Mambo-Moodle vs Moodle4Xoops vs pnMoodle
Post description: For forming collaborative learning communities, Moodle is it. But looking down the road a bit I'll probably want to move into content that isn't really the focus of an online learning environment: product reviews, "personals" variation, News (I mean not just announcements kind of news but a whole news section) and a few other things. Anyone have some experience using the different types of MOODLE-CMS integrations like Mambo-Moodle, Moodle4Xoops and pnMoodle? I've experimented with postnuke quite a bit and here's what I see: 1) A lot of powerful tools. Unfortunately my favorites are "dead" projects. 2) A powerful but byzantive templating system called Xanthia.  Sometimes doing the simplest thing is so complicated and involved 10 steps.  But it is very configurable ... 3) My biggest complaint is when you make a site all your menus are organized according to database and program structure rather than according to topics, so if I want to organize my links according to topics both for users and search engines I have to do everything manually anyway.  So if I want my "Basketweaving 101" course to have a basketweaving-topical menu (like basketweaving-books, basektweaving-news, basketweaving-product reviews, basketweaving matchmakers)  This is very difficult to do in pn (pnmoodle). How about Mambo-Moodle and Moodle4Xoops? How well do they they integrate with Moodle and a topic-oriented or group-oriented site? How easy is it to customize their templates assuming you know just html and css ?

Forum Post: 
Post title: New enrolment plugin: enrol_openlml
Post description: Hallo, I'm a teacher at Gymnasium Himmelsthür in Germany and we use the in Germany famous Open Linux Musterlösung ( http://www.linuxmuster.net ) school server . The module enrol_openlml provides some usage enhancements in conjunction with this server and Moodle from 2.0 on upwards. Classes and projects from the server become global groups in Moodle. For each teacher a course category is autocreated / autoremoved. The teacher is course creator in this category. Courses can be enrolled automatically by providing their global group names, e.g. 7a in field course->idnumber. I hope this plugin to be useful. Frank Schütte

Post title: Assign users with the admin role for custom made system context type plugin
Post description: Dear All, we have introduced a specific custom made plugin with a system context type capability - the admin role is assignable at the System context. Post title: Hide Available Courses
Post description: With Moodle you can have the system show only enrolled courses for a user, but only if the user is enrolled in a courses.  Otherwise it shows all available courses.  Our institution does not want to show all available courses and instead wants to display something like "You are not enrolled in any courses". So, with a few hacks to the theme CSS and some of the PHP in Moodle I was able to accomplish that.  I don't like the idea of it just being a hack and something that I will have to do again in each upgrade.  I'm still new to Moodle so I need some time to catch up to the structure and code setup in the project so I have submitted the idea, with code snippets of what I did, to the tracker.  If you are interested in having an option like this as an administration option please vote for it, comment, or offer some code help.  Thanks https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-43692

Post title: Moodle based e-commerce platform
Post description: I’m really excited to have a public demo of my Moodle based e-commerce platform: https://examplesite.opensourcelearning.co.uk/local/commerce/browseproducts.php The test credit card details are: Card number: 4242 4242 4242 4242 All other fields you can set to anything and it should work. There are a bunch of products on the site showing all the capabilities: quiz attempts seminar registration (with spaces held during transactions and released on time out etc.) course enrolments premium topic/activity access Buying vouchers for team members to redeem (click buy for others on the catalog page, then look in ‘vouchers’ for the codes to share with your team) The only one not set up is the whole site subscription as this would get in the way of people meeting the platform. I’m hoping you can see how this goes a long way beyond any other LMS integrated commerce platform (certainly any that I’ve seen to date). I’ve got clients using various bits of this but it’s the first time I’ve brought it together as a coherent product so I’m really keen to get feedback from as many people as possible.

Post title: Google Apps integration: getting gdata cron.php to add new users...
Post description: I have successfully got moodle to use our ldap server for authentication and also integrated google apps block without issue. Here is my problem. I need to populate all of our student accounts into google apps. We need to provision certain users access to only parts of google apps platform (the elementary principal wants to control grade level email access). I found today that I could populate all accounts from ldap to moodle with the auth_ldap_sync_users.php which worked like a charm. Combined with the enrol sync I was able to get all users in moodle and enrolled in their appropriate classes (both really cool and will be looking to work into my site cron job list to keep users and course enrollments current). From here though I run into a problem. I run the gdata/cron.php and no new accounts are created. Just a long list of Authentication errors. Upon looking into the user database ( mysql ) I see that there are no stored passwords. Only after a user logs in, does moodle store a password from ldap. Is there a way to get auth_ldap_sync_users.php to also bring in the user passwords. I believe this might then allow the gdata/cron.php to all creation of new user accounts. Any help, Thanks, bk Brian Kray Technology Integration Specialist

Post title: [Plugin search]: multiple questions with precomputed answers
Post description: Hello, I would like to create a large database of questions with datas and precomputed answers that are always presented on the same template. All calculations will be performed by example with Matlab. A certain amount of tolerance will be accepted on each numerical answer. I don't want to compute answers with Moodle because formulaes are too much complicated. Despite my research, I didn't find a plugin to achieve this. To clarify, I would provide the input data: a = [1; 3.4; 5.6] b = [2.7; 5.9; 4.8] c = [1; 2; 3] I would provide a text like this: Either the transfer function $ H (s) = \ frac {{a}} {{b} s {c}} $, calculate its rise time. H (s) = \ frac {{a}} {{b} {c}} s "Moodle" will randomly choose an index, such as index 2 . The variables a, b, c would be then equal to 3.4; 5.9; 2 . {a}, {b} and {c} would be automatically replaced in my text and my Latex expressions. I also would supply the answer vector: rise_time = [9.8; 3.4; 7; 8] and a tolerance, ie 1% The student should answer: 3.4 +/- 1% (index vector 2). Ideally, It would be great if I could ask multiple questions (so I would have an answer vector for each question), ie response time, peak time, etc. The data would be provided via a csv file. My Searches (unsuccessful): https://moodle.org/plugins/view/qtype_combined https://moodle.org/plugins/view/qtype_formulas https://moodle.org/plugins/view/qtype_stack https://moodle.org/plugins/view/qtype_varnumericset Thank you in advance!

Forum Post: Post title: Page Breaks in Configurable Reports? Post description: Is it possible to have page breaks in your reports from the Configurable Reports plugin? I'd like my report to be able to print one page per user with the all of the quizzes and their scores in the currently selected course. So far what I have is the following Query (which may need some fine tuning yet to be perfectly honest): ```text SELECT c.shortname, u.id, u.firstname AS 'Firstname' , u.lastname AS 'Lastname', cc.name AS 'Category', ROUND(AVG(ROUND(gg.finalgrade / gg.rawgrademax * 100 ,2)), 2) AS Average, GROUP_CONCAT("
  • ",  gi.itemname, ": ", ROUND(gg.finalgrade / gg.rawgrademax * 100 ,2), "
    • " SEPARATOR "") AS Grades FROM prefix_course AS c JOIN prefix_context AS ctx ON c.id = ctx.instanceid JOIN prefix_role_assignments AS ra ON ra.contextid = ctx.id ``` and also I added the following custom CSS to add page breaks to the report: ```text @media all { .page-break { display : none ; } } @media print { .page-break { display : block ; page-break-before : always ; } } ``` And the following HTML at the bottom of each "page" to add the page break:
    If I click the reports tab and use the Adobe PDF printer, I'm able to generate a pdf that is pretty close to what I need for paper copies except that it does not contain the page breaks!!!  And if I try to print it out it also does not contain the page breaks. Thank you, Andrew J. Leer Label:

Forum Post: 
Post title: Filter user list
Post description: Hello, We have our custom plugin which groups users. Each group has 1 or 2 group leaders. These group leaders are also administrator so they can access user list ( Dashboard > Site Administration > Users > Accounts > Browse list of users) What we want is if a group leader accesses Moodle's user list, he can only see the users in his group. I have looked for a way to do this. As I've found out, Moodle has "user_filtering" property in session, it is used in user list, please see user/filters/lib.php. I want to modify this property to add an extra SQL query to filter users. What I need to do now is modifying "user_filtering" before admin/user.php is called, this is where user_filtering is initialized and user list is rendered. However, I can't find any plugin type which can do this. I really appreciate if you have any suggestions to achieve this. In the worst case, we will need to hide Moodle's user list from administrators and create our own one.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Exercise module add-on: grade average and maximum
Post description: Hallo, this is a dev question: I'm trying to add some sum functionality to exercise module grading scheme. I've managed to create and option to use not only average and maximum, in case multiple submissions are made, but also one that makes a sum of the marks given. However, there's a bit of a problem: instead of summing the grades, there is still something (a function or a hardcoded value) that makes an average of the submitted grades. These are the conditions and functions that seemed to be responsible for using the max. score (and it's similar to those for counting an average): In lib.php: if ($exercisemod->usemaximum) {} and the rest (had to be changed to: if ($exercisemod->usemaximum == 1) {} because the option I've added is called is option no. 2, and is written to the db as such) function exercisemod_get_mean_submission_grades($exercisemod) I've modified the loop in order to accept option 2 (elseif ($exercisemod->usemaximum == 2) ... ) and made a function that does exactly what function exercisemod_get_mean_submission_grades($exercisemod) does, but it's called function exercisemod_get_add_submission_grades($exercisemod) and it should sum grades (via the SUM() fuction) instead of counting an average of them. Now the point of the post: even when option no. 2 is selected when setting up the exercise, instead of a sum being made, there's still something that makes an average of the marks. The Question: Does anyone know if there's another function like this one that counts the average? The only one I have found is in locallib.php, however, it doesn't seem it is used anywhere (I couldn't see it being called in any of the other scripts). Pointing me to a php file that uses it would be useful as well.

Post title: Dialogue update for Moodle v1.9
Post description: Greetings all. The University of Waikato in New Zealand recently contracted Catalyst to do some work on the Dialogue module which we'd like to contribute back to the community. I've attached an outline of the changes we've had made to the module to bring it in line with v1.9, highlighting some changes we've made to it to suit our particular use of it. Have a look at the attached document and please provide any feedback in this forum. We're particularly interested in whether the changes we've made are different enough that the community feels this should be a separate module. Many of the changes are around roles/capability-support, and general v1.9 conformance so it shouldn't be a problem hopefully. Please contact me directly if you'd like a copy of the code to test in your own environment. We are currently using the changes on our production Moodle platform but would encourage you to test it locally first. After some testing and approval from the community then I guess If the next step will be for us (or someone with CVS commit access) to add this to the main Contrib CVS repository for the Dialogue module. look FWD to hearing from you,

Post title: Piwik (aka Matomo) analytics VS Intelliboard
Post description: Hi everyone, We are hesitating between using the open source Piwik Analytics * plugin VS the proprietary Intelliboard one. Of course, our preference goes toward Piwik since it is open source. But we don't know what we might loose (if any) if we prefer this solution over Intelliboard. The only things I found on the web are this 5 Reasons to use Piwik with Moodle blog post, and this Moodle forum post stating: I have tried "Intelliboard", "piwik" and some other which are no good. Piwik can't track historical data it only gives you the present and Intelliboard is not free and free version isn't helping. Not enough to make up my mind. Any other hints ? In-depth comparison ? Best, Olivier. *: for information, Piwik project has just been renamed into Matomo: https://matomo.org/

Post title: Manually Modifying Certificate Issue Dates
Post description: Hello, We have a use case where we are migrating users with existing course progress in a separate LMS into our new Moodle system, and our course includes multiple certificates which are rewarded upon passing quizzes. We will be marking older users as complete for those items in our new system so they may continue where they left off, and we want their Moodle certificates to display the original issue dates they had in the older system. For example, if we were to mark a user complete for our course today (Jan 7, 2025) which unlocks their certificate, we'd like to be able to manually change the issue date to their older completion date. We've explored the mod_coursecertificate and tool_certificate plugins from Moodle Workplace as well as mod_customcert but haven't found such a feature. Can someone recommend a certificate plugin which can do this? Thank you in advance.

Forum Post: 
Post title: NBC Learn Plugin and Privacy... or Lack thereof
Post description: It appears that NBC Learn has created a plugin to allow students and faculty to embed content from the NBC Universal archives within a moodle course. I believe this is possible without the plugin via copy and paste, but the Moodle plugin obviously places the NBC archive in front of a larger audience. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NBCUniversal_Archives My question is whether or not anyone has implemented the nbclearn plugin and if so, how well has it been received and have concern's over user privacy been addressed? http://nbclearn.com/tools/ From a look at the code it appears that the plugin is mainly an extension for TinyMCE, the built-in text editor. The extension creates an icon within the text editor, that when clicked makes a call to NBC urls to retrieve content. I help run a Moodle instance at a Large North American Public University. And, given that NBC is owned by Comcast,  connecting our most highly utilized web application to this large commercial interest is inherently alarming. A trip through the plugin's code gives me the impression that anyone who clicks on the NBC logo within Moodle's TinyMCE text editor will have his or her Personal Information sent to NBC.

Post title: New module Alternative
Post description: The Alternative activity allow students to register to one or several choices, among a given list. You can download it or read additional documentation on https://moodle.org/plugins/view.php?plugin=mod_alternative Alternative can fulfill several purposes: registration for a conference, choice of a date for an examination, of an internship, etc. Alternative is similar to the official "Choice" module, but has many settings to adapt to various needs: individual or team registration (with a team leader) possible quota on each option single choice, or limited/unlimited number of choices manual input for the options, or import of a csv file statistics csv export of the registrations All feedbacks are welcome.

Post title: Add-On That Keeps Cumulative Sums
Post description: Hello-- I'm using the Moodle platform in a class in which the students have to keep track of their hours performing certain required activities in order to graduate. I'm looking for a plug-in that would allow students to check-off activities and put in the number of hours they spent on that activity and the plug-in would keep a cumulative total of their hours that the teachers could access. For example: On Monday, Suzy enters something like: Home Visit: 2 hours Book Chapter: 1 hour The plug in would tell her (and the teachers) that she has a total of 3 hours completed. Then on Tuesday, she enters: Clinic Rotation: 1 hour The plug-in would keep a cumulative total and tell her (and the teachers) that she now has a total of three hours. In other words, I need to be able to see 1.  What activities she completed  2. How long they took her  3.  Her cumulative number of hours. Checklist is a great plug in for half of this, but it won't tally hours. Can anyone help? Thanks-TJM

Post description: Hey I googled and could not find if anyone had considered using Moodle with a WordPress or WordPress Multi User type setup for schools. I have a bridge I built for a test project that takes registrations from the WordPress and adds them to Moodle but does not carry sessions as of yet. I also have it to where you can drop in a simple code snippet into a moodle template and display posts, categories and even links all managed from within WordPress with my WP Menu Creator plugin (which is free) Does anyone here know of similar efforts? Jared Ritchey

Post title: Offline Moodle: Upload course content via database connection
Post description: Hello Our institution requires us to prepare all courses in word documents and then upload them to moodle format. However this is daunting, since first writing everything in Word and then manually uploading chapters amounts to a terrible loss of time. Is there a way to access the moodle database from *outside moodle* and issue SQL commands to it in order to auto-publish course content? I know enough scripting languages and more in order to pull the course content e.g. from an excel sheet and push it into a database connection, but I would need some starting point where to insert it. Or is it feasible at all to do this? Another way would be Internet Explorer automation, but that seems even more daunting still. Thank you very much for your help - Sincerely, Wolfgang v. Ungern-Sternberg

Post title: Upgrade to Kineo's 360 Appraisal Module
Post description: We're a small graduate school in Vancouver, BC, Canada. We’ve been using e-learning company Kineo’s 360 appraisal module for Moodle 1.9 ( http://www.kineo.com/moodle/overview-of-360-appraisal-module.html ) for evaluations of our student project over a number of semesters. It’s actually become a critical module for conducting student project reviews. Now we’re upgrading our Moodle software to version 2.2, and we’re very interested in continuing to use this module. We're therefore very interested in having a 2.x version developed, as we haven’t been able to locate one online. I've contacted Kineo, who have no intentions of upgrading the module. And their estimate to develop it is outside our budget. Ideally, the cost could be shared among other interested schools and institutions. Is anyone aware of plans to develop a Moodle 2.x version of the 360 appraisal module? Is anyone interested in having this module upgraded?

Post title: Sending answers to a test question via Moodle REST API
Post description: In a Moodle installed in a "locale", I can assign a token and an external service to a user account via REST API and I can also connect to a pre-created test and the true-false type question in it. The attached test_data_store.php file: - Establishes the Rest API connection. - Successfully identifies the test. - Successfully queries the question data. - Successfully closes the attempt. However, what it does not set: - The statically generated answer data is not sent back to the test, in other words the test question is closed empty. Why? I suspect that something is wrong in the attached code at the following place, but I do not know what: // 3. Submit answers $data = []; foreach ($questions as $question) { if (isset($question['slot'])) { // Check the question type if ($question['type'] == 'truefalse') { // The true answer (can be changed to 0 if you give a False answer) $data[] = [ What I ruled out by testing: - I also tested with an external Moodle system installed in production, the same phenomenon. - I also tested with a user with "admin" privileges, the same phenomenon. Based on the attached code, does anyone have any experience of what could be the error? Why is the answer data not being returned to Moodle?

Post title: Glossary sorting according to the current language collation rules?
Post description: In Moodle 1.5.2+, i.e. before the general introduction of UTF-8, I wanted to have the glossary entries sorted according to the collation rules of the current language (we have various language departments using Moodle and they like their students to use Moodle in the language they study). So I tried to introduce a little hack into the code of the Glossary module that made it possible. Trying out Moodle 1.6(.1+) I come to the conclusion that I will either have to retain that hack, or throw it into the public space and hope some of the true PHP coders will pick it up and develop further—if other people are interested. What I did was this: in mod/glossary/ sql .php at the very start I inserted // ELFF-mx: start -- determining language for collation $elffcurrlang = ''; $elffcollate = ''; if ($elffcurrlang = current_language()) { switch ($elffcurrlang) { case 'cs_utf': $elffcollate = 'utf8_czech_ci'; break; case 'sv_utf':

```text
[Sat Dec 06 01:06:04 2014] [notice] child pid 6517 exit signal Segmentation fault (11)
```

Post title: issue on installing benchmarking suite (GSB block & report)
Post description: Hi, I've had an issue when trying to install these items on our moodle. Essentially, it looks like all has gone well, but when you then try to log in/out, you get redirected to a page saying object moved. if you then manually change your url to go back to the front page , you are taken there to find that you have been logged in/out as you were trying to do. Also, files within moodle stop working and give the same error. Purging all caches doesn't change anything, and on its own, uninstalling the reports and block doesn't But if you uninstall both report and block, and then purge all caches, voila, moodle works correctly again. we are running Moodle 2.6.2+ (Build: 20140508) on a windows 2012 server with PHP 5.6.0. the database is on MSSQL on a seperate server. we have a seperate moodle on a box that is a clone from a few weeks ago that we used to upgrade php on which the problem hasn't occured (both boxes now are on php 5.6 with identical settings) Can anybody shed any light on possible causes? Thanks, Graham

Forum Post: 
Post title: Electronic Laboratory Notebook Activity and related plugins
Post description: Inspired by Mark Muyskens (Calvin College) talk at BCCE on Electronic Laboratory Notebook
(ELN) in which he used a Moodle Wiki as an ELN, I've developed a ELN module based on the ouwiki. Students can work either separately or
as groups on ELN pages.  Instructors can grade the ELN pages, provide
templates of experiment pages and much more.  I've also developed three
Atto plugins and and two filters to be used with the ELN that allow students to
insert chemical structures, timestamps, spectra and spreadsheets. Some changes to the ouwiki include; * extensive language file string changes * Add "New Experiment" tab to navigation tabs for easily creating new experiment pages. * Changed start page to My ELN Index. * Add ability to "Clone experiments" sections into new pages. * Migrated to new events API * Integrated index searching * Added "Search" tab to Details page. Plugins I developed that go well with the ELN activity include; Structure Plugin (moodle-atto_structure) - Allows students to draw
chemical structures and easily insert into ELN or any other pages. 
Requires MarvinJS.

Post title: Listing all plugins and versions(and possibly other tips)
Post description: Hello! We are running a site with alot of plugins in moodle 3.6 in different enviorments (dev,qa,prod) . Currently we are trying to, as much as possible, automate mangement of these enviroments. In this process ofcourse comes management of plugins and I am trying to easily access all versions of plugins. It should be apperently but both my short attention spam and google-fu is failing me. :\ - I have tried to use moosh to list all plugins but, as I do it, I dont get the version of the plugin. The idea is to hold a static file with all plugins and versions that should correspond from dev => qa => prod. Then ansible goes into the enviorment and validates all these versions. if the version is correct it ignores it, but if it is wrong we install it using: moosh plugin-install -d <plugin> <version>, purging cache and so on... f.e. moosh plugin-install -d someplugin 2019100100 This version is stored in the plugins version.php but I find the plugin structure a bit tricky. But are there some other way of obtaining this version number in an easy fashion, preferably from moosh. An alternative is to try to ape after the php script that list them in the WUI or even just parse it out from the version.php files? As we have multiple nodes per enviroment I might not get around synchronizing the entire webdir from one node to all others(but simply making sure to run moosh plugin-install -d someplugin should solve this on all nodes ) Any tips or tricks would be greatly appreciated. And I am so sorry if the question is stupid. edit: Sorry, quick on the question. I can ofcourse use the database and get mdl_config to get the value where name = 'version' and plugin is the plugin but still. Any other ideas? Cheers'

This however, doesn't always update the database for some reason, even though I know for sure that the if statement below is triggering with a true statement. $courseid = $search->course; $grading_info = grade_get_grades($courseid, 'mod', 'quiz', $quizid, $user); $gradepass = $grading_info->items[0]->gradepass; $grade = $grading_info->items[0]->grades[$user]->grade; //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- if ($grade == $gradepass) { //-------------------------- SQL QUERY---------------------------------------------------------------------------- //Finds the 'id' of the user relative to the table 'user_info_data' - requirement for update_record feature $params = ['userid' => $user]; $return = 'id'; $select = 'userid = :userid AND fieldid = 1'; $table = 'user_info_data'; $id = $DB->get_field_select($table, $return, $select, $params, $strictness=IGNORE_MISSING); //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //Defining variables for updating record of user to "approved" $dataobject = (object)[]; $dataobject->id = $id; $dataobject->data = "approved"; //Updating database $table = 'user_info_data'; $DB->update_record($table, $dataobject, $bulk=false); I believe there may be an issue with updating the table 'user_info_data', not too sure why, because it does update the required value sometimes but not all the time. Any help is appreciated!

Post title: Scheduler module-Gustav?
Post description: I just installed the scheduler module. I had a couple questions/suggestions about it. It is a bit peculiar that the teacher's short profile appears at the top of the page. I presume this is probably there because the student is being reminded they are making an appointment with the teacher but since the teacher might want to use the scheduler for some other purpose and because the student should already know who the teacher is this seems a bit obnoxious. The reminder and invitation use external email programs. If the teacher does not use an external email program, these functions are useless. It would be better if the email was sent directly from Moodle The reminder and invitation should have customizable texts, and not just through the language pack, as a teacher might want to send a different message for different appointments. A nice addition would be a note field for the student when they make their appointment. This could be used for the student to include the topic they wish to discuss or somesuch. For me, I would like to use this module to schedule online voice chats with students, and I would like them to be able to tell me which voice chat software they will be using and/or their username in advance so that I can "meet" them in the proper place, rather than require they use a specific program because I don't know what they are using. It would be nice if the module would email the teacher to tell them when a student had made an appointment so they don't have to keep checking to see if slots are filled.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Updated release of Marginalia annotation for Moodle forums
Post description: I have updated the Marginalia annotation feature for Moodle. It adds the capability for users of forums to highlight passages of text and create associate annotations in a margin beside each post. The annotations can be searched and shared with others. Code and installation instructions are available at www.geof.net/code/annotation/ . Since I previously announced the feature on the Moodle forums, I have made a number of improvements: Marginalia now supports Internet Explorer in addition to Firefox users can view each others' highlights and annotations directly on forum pages, not just in the searchable summary the search capability has been enhanced numerous bug fixes, optimizations, and better documentation support for Moodle 1.6 The system is currently in use at Malaspina University College and Simon Fraser University in BC, Canada. I would like to thank BC Campus for funding this effort, and for allowing its release under the GNU General Public License, and to Simon Fraser University for their support of the project through Dr. Andrew Feenberg's Applied Communication and Technology Lab in the School of Communication and through the Learning and Instructional Development Centre.

Post title: Downloader - Would this be a resource?
Post description: I am going to be developing a downloader for Moodle for a client. I am wondering what is the best way to develop it. I have made an Activity module before, the Map Module . I have looked here to figure out what would be the best way to develop the module. Basically the downloader would be available for teachers. It would download resources for a course and allow the teacher to choose which groups/students and/or which assignments they want to include. I want the downloader to available to all courses by default. I have looked at other downloader modules but the client has resources stored in non-standard methods on various servers. The easiest way I could think to make it would be a resource. But these are the reasons I think it wouldn't work. The resource would have to be manualy created for each course The link to the resource would show to students(unless it was manually hidden) The creator of the resource would have fill out the configuration form when there is really need to create a separate instance for each course. I thought about making it a block but I really need a form that would be in the main portion of the page so that the user could select the needed resources. I looks like I could make the main page file in the block folder but then it seems I would have to duplicate a lot of programming for creating the other parts of the page. Any ideas? Thanks

Post title: Exercise module add-on: Fatal error: Call to undefined function: exercise
Post description: Can anyone help with this Exercise problem? I uploaded an Exercise Description but discovered that there was a
mistake in the the description, so deleted it and uploaded a correct
version. Students have been uploading their work to this exercise without any
problems, and I have been able to grade their work. However, when I
click on 'Administration' in the Exercise, I do not see the students'
work and grades, but the following message: exercise_list_submissions_for_admin: Submission record not found! However, students are able to see the grade that I have given them.
Also, I am able to see the list of final grades when I click on 'Display of Final Grades'. Finally, when I click on 'Grades..' I see the following fatal error: Fatal error : Call to undefined function: exercise_get_best_submission_grades() in /home/petesweb/public_html/moodle/mod/exercise/lib.php on line 274
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: This problem seems to be caused by 1) a non-existant variable $bestgrades and a non-existant function "exercise_get_best_submission_grades()". I've gotten it to work by substituting the "new" for the "old" below in mod/exercise/lib.php. Note that this isn't a fully satisfactory patch since it causes not the best grade to be reported but rather the mean of multiple attempts, should they exist. Since in my case there was only one student with a multiple attempt I have little motiviation to improve the code any further! *****Old***** if ($exercise->usemaximum) { // first get the teacher's grade for the best submission if ($bestgrades = exercise_get_best_submission_grades($exercise)) { foreach ($bestgrades as $grade) { $usergrade[$grade->userid] = $grade->grade * $exercise->grade / 100.0; } } } *****Revised**** if ($exercise->usemaximum) { // first get the teacher's grade for the best submission //fixed by Trobb June26 if ($meangrades = exercise_get_mean_submission_grades($exercise)) { foreach ($meangrades as $grade) { $usergrade[$grade->userid] = $grade->grade * $exercise->grade / 100.0; } } }
Comment 2: Thomas Thanks for your reply. I have discovered that the above reported error message only occurs when I select 'Use Maximum' in 'Handling of Multiple Submissions', one of the choices within the Exercise setup. When I select 'Use Mean' everything works fine. You wrote about your solution; "Note that this isn't a fully satisfactory patch since it
causes not the best grade to be reported but rather the mean of
multiple attempts, ..." How does this differ from the present
choices in 'Handling of Multiple Submissions' which includes 'Use Mean'? In other words, choosing 'Use Mean' in the 'Handling of Multiple Submissions', causes the mean of multiple attempts to be reported.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Certificate 4.2 FAT printing issue
Post description: Hello, One of our students is attempting to print out their certificate, but is getting a strange result: The border and signatures apparently print out fine, but they're getting this error: ERROR: syntaxerror OFFENDING COMMAND: STACK : / - " 9 [ (XKLAAA+FreeSerifBold) ] / Identity-H
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: This has now happened to a second student, from a different location and institution. I've not had this problem reported until upgrading to Certificate 4.2. Has anything changed between 4.1 and 4.2 that would cause something like this?
Comment 2: Changes includ only ‘ problem and general debug. Try to run certificate over debug level 4 and send results.
Comment 3: I'll run the debug and see if that turns up any errors. It doesn't seem that generating the certificate itself is an issue, but I guess these students are seeing this error when they actually try to print the PDF. As such, I'm guessing that this problem is occurring during the actual PDF creation process maybe? They're getting 1 page of the certificate printed with borders and signature (the images), but blank spots where text should be and that error message above printed on a 2nd page. From what I gather, they can view it fine, though. Extra information: In both of these cases, neither the students' names nor the class names have an apostrophe in them. I don't know enough about how the PDF creation process executes, but is it possible the new code somehow breaks functions in the PDF creation (tcpdf?) when it's reading data back in now in a different format?
Comment 4: Check if database is ok and if certificates are registered in databases. Empty fields happens when data isn’t in database. PDF creation is the same since Version 3.3+.
Comment 5: Everything regarding the database seems fine, including all of the data. I can, however, confirm that there is definitely something wrong with the PDFs that are being generated. They somehow seem to be "corrupt." The problem isn't that there are any empty fields in the PDF. If I open the PDF up on my computer and just view it on my monitor, everything is fine. All of the information (course name, instructor, hours, student name, etc.) is properly displayed. The problem comes when I try to print them and these PDFs are not printing out correctly. To test this again, since my work computer was not having any issues viewing or printing, I tried to open these same PDFs on my home computer. Sure enough, I could not print them. Using Adobe Acrobat 8.1, I get an error message that just says 'could not draw the object' and it completely refuses to print anything. When I use Foxit Reader 2, it prints the certificate, but without any of the text - only the images (border, signature, seal) print out. This is not too terribly surprising, given the error message listed above that one student sent me includes font names in the message. I can also confirm this is not limited to 4.2, as I went back and tried to view older certificates generated under 4.1 and had the same issues when attempting to print them on my home computer. There is definitely something wrong with the way the PDFs themselves are created. I can't figure out what that could be, though. Given that there is a font name in the error message, and text is not being printed out on the paper (but viewed fine) confuses me. I don't know a lot of technical details about PDFs, but the only thing that I can think of is perhaps when printing it's having issues with the fonts in the PDF. Perhaps it can compensate on my work computer as it has a lot of fonts installed on it. However, my home computer does not have any additional fonts installed and it can't print. This is a totally wild guess, though.
Comment 6: I have same problem!
Comment 7: Try to update TCPDF files. This problem sounds like acrobat problem; in my Acrobat 7.0 all runs perfect. I don’t have other versions of acrobat here to test, but change TCPDF can be a good idea, try this and if these changes solve this problem let me know. Get this patch here: http://www.sendspace.com/file/sh8k8p
Comment 8: No luck on my end with the TCPDF upgrade. When I try to print, I get 2 error messages. The first error message from Adobe Reader says: "The document could not be printed." The second error message from Adobe Reader says: "A drawing error occurred." Of the two students I talked to, one of them was using Adobe Reader 6 and the other was using Adobe Reader 8.1. On my test computer that is having the same problem and cannot print, I am using Adobe Reader 8.1. Everything still displays on the screen fine, though, and all information is there. It just won't print.
Comment 9: I can confirm we have seen the same issue. The PDFs are printing out fine here at the office with all our test desktop machines, but we've had printing complaints from several of the end users. We're trying to collect information on the users' computer configurations and are going to start troubleshooting it this week.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Event Reminders Not Working moodle 2.8
Post description: We've just upgraded to Moodle 2.8.7 (Build: 20150706) And have installed Event Reminders version 2015031201 Having setup the reminder scheduling for course activities and created assignments in a visible course, no reminders have been emailed. Our default recipients are set to teachers and students. Maybe we've missed something really simple. Does anyone else have the latest reminders plugin working on moodle 2.8 Cheers Peter
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Guys, For the benefit of those reaching this thread in the future: The moodle we were using had been progressively upgraded from a version well before moodle v2.5 It seems that from moodle 2.6 onwards all the cron tasks can be managed from within the moodle and when the server runs the cron job, previously, where a task failed, it would stop all remaining cron tasks from being performed, whereas now that isn't the case. Trouble is that the server logs say that cron has been completed successfully, but it doesn't report if any of the individual tasks failed to run. When we looked at the cron task in moodle, the legacy cron task wasn't running, and this seems to have been the key issue. We also found that the table local_reminders, required by the 'Event_Reminders' plugin wasn't present. I'm not convinced that was the case though as I had checked the tables the day before. Anyhow, we got 'event reminders' running so I can confirm that it does in fact work in moodle version 2.8 Peter
Comment 2: How you resolve this?

Post title: Modules for Dummies?
Post description: I would like to try my hand at making a module. However, I am stuck at the beginning. I have downloaded the newmodule.zip file and read the instructions here . However, I am having trouble setting up the database . I have cut and paste the code exactly from the instructions for the "minimum" database, but still I am getting nowhere. Is it possible for someone to provide a "minimum" version of the files mysql .php and my sql .sql, as well as the newmodule.php language file, with all of the code filled in, so all one needs to do is change the NEWMODULE everywhere to the name of the new module? For new programmers like me, it would be really helpful to have a model that works, and then modify it from there, rather than have to guess how to set these things up from scratch.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: By the way: that newmodule template needs to be updated. It is missing group awareness, event awareness, XHTML compliance, .... I am also not sure if the empty HTML editor bug has been fixed in the template. If some experienced module developer has a few minutes to dedicate to the newmodule template then that would be very useful.
Comment 2: Hi N! Thanks for making a request thatI was eventually going to make.  I think an example module is a good idea.  One could then compare the "module" instructions and the "real" module.  That, would provide a good jumping off point for constructive based discussion. WP1
Comment 3: bump... anyone? or anyone want to show me, and I'll write a modules for dummies section? Something like this is absolutely necessary to get valuable contributions.
Comment 4: Please do write such a section, that would be a very good resource. If you want a clean, easily inderstood, but usable module , I suggest looking at Eduardo Monteiro's Solution module It checks if a student is not a guest and then displays a resource (as such I really think it belongs inside the resource module ) But the code is very readable and uses a lot of Moodle's functions. It is a nice module to experiment with and it is working out-of-the-box. Best way to start, I think, would be to change the file view.php inside the module and make it display something, even if it is only "Hello, world". Then check if it is possible to add instances of your new module to a course. If you got this module running, experiment with some of the functions in moodle's library. Try reading something from a database table, using get_records() and displaying it. A quick way to browse all of moodle's code and see how variables / functions are connected is this crossreference . Hope you can get this 'modules for dummies' section started.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Teachers can't select Resources or Activities that are Plugins
Post description: I've got a headscratcher here. Teachers on my site are not able to add new activities from our plugins (Checklist, BigBlueButton, Lightbox Gallery); nothing added to our site shows up in the activity chooser menu, nor in the dropdown menus. They show up for administrators (for some reason Lightbox Gallery shows up for Manager role). I checked the site permissions and teachers are set to Allow for create new instances. All of these plugins are enabled on the site, they are all the most recent versions and teachers have no other role than editing teacher. They worked fine in 2.2. When I made the update to 2.3 everything seemed to check out and all of them work when I try to add them as an Admin. I looked in each plugin to make certain they include the addinstance permission in the mod/db/access.php file. They do. Courses added/restored after the upgrade to 2.3 are working properly and teachers can view the plugin activity resources and activities. The downside is that it does not work if I backup/restore one of the courses in which it is not already working. When I create a blank course and restore a course backup (from one that was not working) Merging the contents into the existing course, then I'm back in business. As a last resort I'll do this if I have to for all of the courses but I really don't want to. I've tried deleting them from the installation and reinstalling, I've tried prohibiting the teacher permissions and then allowing to see if that would fix it. I'm not sure what else to try at this point. Are those courses just broken?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Of course after posting I just had to keep digging. I've been having this issue for months but I might finally be on to something. While looking at the database mdl_role_capabilities it would appear that most of the permissions are set to 1 but for the plugin permissions it is -1 I'm guessing this is the problem. Somehow I need to find out how to make this change via a command.
Comment 2: This sounds just like the problem I have encountered after upgrading from moodle 2.2.4 to 2.3.3 All courses that were present prior to the 2.3.3 upgrade have no roles allocated to the 'addinstance' permission for each type of resource (folder/chat/feedback/page etc) We need a way to change every course on our moodle site so that the Teacher role is allowed to add an instance of all of the affected resources. I'm still thinking of ideas to fix this so will let you know if we come up with anything that works.

Post description: Hi All! I'm a moodle newbiee. I've tried to install Wiris 2.1 plugin in my moodle 2.2 core, but it goes wrong. Is possible to add moodle 2.0 or 2.1 plugins in a moodle 2.2 core? If not is there any easy option to migrate the 2.x plugins? Thanks in advance!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Generally, unless a plugin makes modifications to core files (which is very strongly discouraged), Moodle 2.1 plugins work in 2.2. Forum Post: 
Post title: Problems using Generico  and Atto Generico Icon Plug-Ins
Post description: Hi, I and running Moodle 3.8 and have spent hours trying to get the Generico filter plug-in to work.  I have repeated uninstalled, installed and enabled.  And it is definitely enabled.  But even the simplest templates shown in the examples fail e.g. {Generico:type=welcomeuser}.  The template {Generico: type= ... etc.} is entirely ignored and just repeated as ordinary text on the page.  Also, the Atto icon which is shown as installed in the plug-in list does not appear in the Atto toolbar.  I can only assume I have overlooked an obvious issue.  Any thoughts would be greatly appreciated.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: If its not enabled it will behave as you describe, ignoring any Generico tags. If its enabled then any recognized generico template would be processed. An unrecognized template would just show a blank, but the tags would disappear. So I think its not enabled, or broken in some way that prevents it from ever getting started. Just to check the basics: i) installation is all complete. Visit: site administration -> notifications . An incomplete install will show an installation wizard screen here. ii) you have enabled it at : site administration -> plugins -> filters -> manage filters iii) you have added the string "generico" to the csv list of icons that should show at the bottom of the atto toolbar settings page at: site administration -> plugins -> text editors - atto-= >atto toolbar settings Once we're sure all that is ok, then type longhand (do not copy and paste): {GENERICO:type=welcomeuser} Copying and pasting is fine, but it can bring invisible html characters which mess up the parsing, so for now do it longhand. NB Generico is all upper case in the Generico tags.
Comment 2: Thanks for your quick response.  I reinstalled Moodle and the problem has disappeared.  However, no Generico button is appearing on the Atto editor.  Presumably this is a known problem. Many thanks
Comment 3: Thanks again, sorted the Generico button by adding the name against one of the other groupings in the Atto toolbar config.
