Forum Post: 
Post title: custom API endpoint, should I put it to local plugin ?
Post description: Hello, I am developing moodle block, it will GET data from my custom API every time javascript event is occurred. The code bellow is my API with. // file: /var/www/html/MOODLE/custom_api.php <?php $ sql = "SELECT  * FROM mdl_*******"; return $DB->get_records_sql($sql); .............................. I know it is not moodle best practice approchment, any suggestion to make it better ? Should I create my local plugin or create lib.php to my block folder ? Thanks in advance
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: The very first thing you should do is fix the SQL statement. Using "mdl_" in an SQL statement will completely break on any site that uses any other prefix (which includes and sites set up to run PHPUnit or Behat tests) - for Moodle SQL statements, always wrap the table name in { and } - e.g. "SELECT * FROM {user}" (NEVER write "SELECT * FROM mdl_user"). But, even better, in this case, just write $DB->get_records("tablename", []) - where tablename is the name of the table without the 'mdl_' prefix. Have a good read through of the Moodle data manipulation API documentation. After you've got the DB query sorted out, the next step would be to move everything into a local plugin , turn your handler into a webservice then rewrite your javascript code to call this via the AJAX api . All of this is quite a bit of work (especially for someone new to Moodle development), but will, in the end, give a good solid base for further development.

Forum Post: 
Post title: A navigation aid in learning networks
Post description: We would like to invite comments and feedback on a module we created that advises users on which (Moodle) course to take next. The Learning Technology Development Programme of the Educational Technology Expertise Centre (Open Universiteit Nederlands) is aimed at innovative learning technologies to create, promote and use learning networks. A major theme is 'navigation' through a learning network. The Road Mapping (ROMA) project focuses on exploiting collective learner progress as a feedback mechanism to aid successful learner navigation and improve educational yield. One of the ROMA projects determined whether feedback influences the track followed by the learner. An experiment was set up, where the activity nodes of the learning network were modelled as Moodle courses. A new module was developed to advise the learner which course to take next. The module relies on the completion of courses, which in our case was designed by using a quiz. The experiment also changed the standard Moodle navigational aids, such as the breadcrumbs, and therefore can not run with one of the standard themes. In addition to the new module, some of the existing Moodle code needed to be changed (detailed information is available in the attachment). The experiment is no longer available, but some further information can be found at our DSpace server , e.g. http://hdl.handle.net/1820/245 , http://hdl.handle.net/1820/353 , http://hdl.handle.net/1820/436 . We would welcome any thoughts on the approach we have taken or any advice for improvements.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Francis, Thanks (to you and everyone else involved) for your two recent contributions. They are both very interesting. They are however raising some (at least to me) big and advanced issues. I think
Comment 2: Hi Anders, this might not have been the most suitable forum to place it in. You are right. It has many connection with IMS LD. Because activity in the LDBookStudy course seemed to have halted, I did not place it there. I'll place them there as well. Francis
Comment 3: Hi Francis, Do you have a test site where we could test your navigation aid? Most people cannot simply install it in their production servers and give it a run. Josep M.
Comment 4: Hi Josep, not at this moment, but I'll see whether we can arrange something. Francis
Comment 5: Let us know. I think this would be a good way to get way more people to have a look at it. Josep M.
Comment 6: Hello, just to let you know I haven't forgotten about it. It should be possible to set up a site on a test server. At the moment we are considering what content to put on. The course used for the experiment can not be made available (at the moment). The module we made only functions when there are Moodle courses which include a quiz, for which students have to score at least 60% (although that grade is configurable). Lack of time keeps me from creating new content. I'll keep you posted. Francis

Comment 13: A fault exists in the file block_heritage.php The code should read in who is currently logged into Moodle. It reads $readername = idfield_nulc(); // NULC specific This means that it will blank out the variable that has just been set. Delete the idfield_nulc() line of code and it should work for you. Kind regards Richard Taylor VLE Coordinator North Warwickshire & Hinckley College

Post title: Flash module add-on: Playback for MP3 through Multimedia-Plugin
Post description: Hi, I have tried to use an MP3 file within a lesson which I wanted to embed via the Multimedia Plugin. The Plugin is being called, but it does not playback any sound. When I click the start button, either the symbol simply changes to the pause symbol and nothing else happens, or the progress bar indicates that the mp3 file is downloaded but then nothing happens. We run Moodle 1.5.3, and on the computers in the office and at home there is the Flash Player 8 installed. I am not sure whether the problem is because of Flash 8 or something else. Hope somebody can give me an idea about what to do! Thank you in advance!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Timo, Just wondering whether you have uploaded the MP3 file to your course files? If you have linked to the MP3 file on another server then perhaps the problem is due to Flash security settings. Please see MoodleDocs MP3 player for further details.
Comment 2: I have uploaded it to the course files. Yesterday, I was helping a colleague with something similar. This time, the mp3 player worked, but I found out that it did not work with a low bandwidth version (56kb/s) of the file correctly, as the playback was set to double speed, while the "original" version of the file (128kb/s) worked perfectly. The mp3 files because of which I was posting originally are also converted with a low bandwidth. Could that be an issue?
Comment 3: Hi Timo If I understand you correctly, the issue you encountered with the low bandwidth version was that it played twice as fast as it should. If so, this is a known issue: "The Macromedia Flash player has a problem playing files that are
encoded at a rate that is not a multiple of 11.025 kHz. This effect is
sometimes called the chipmunk effect: the file is played at double
speed. To avoid this, encode MP3 s at 11.025 kHz 22.050 kHz or 44.100 kHz." Hope that helps with one problem. Harry
Comment 4: Yes, that explains one problem. The sample rate was 24kH indeed, while the "big" version is 44kH. I think, I also have to check on the other files. Thnx for the advice! Timo

Forum Post: 
Post title: Training Theme for Moodle
Post description: Hi Moodle Community! TNG Consulting Inc. is pleased to announce the first public ALPHA release of a new Training theme for Moodle , developed by Michael Milette (that's me!). Available on Moodle.org for Moodle 3.1 or later, Training theme for Moodle is a simple and easy clean looking theme uncluttered by lots of options which is great for beginners or when you just need to get something that looks great out the door quickly. Training includes modern features such as: Large and small size logo or banner; Navbar /custom menu can be placed above or below the logo / banner; The colour of the Navbar /custom menu can be dark on light or light on dark; Built-in support for Moodle filter tags in the custom menu means compatibility with FilterCodes; Course listings can be displayed in enhanced traditional or Masonry (grid or sometimes also called panel view); Site pages and links in the navigation block can be hidden on the front page . They will re-appear when in edit mode. This enables you to create publicly accessible pages on your website without having to enable guest user access; Customizable favicon; Customizable CSS ; More to come. Please feel free to report issues and make suggestions in the Bug Tracker. You are also invited to post questions and suggestions by replying to this post. Best regards, Michael Milette

Forum Post: 
Post title: Feedback module: can it be made compulsory?
Post description: Hi, I've setup the feedback module to use a sort of extended registration form with fields like address, telephone number etc. Is there a way I can make this mandatory for new users? Thanks Jared
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Jared, I think there is now way to do this inside the feedback-modul. Andreas
Comment 2: As far as I know there is no way to make any moodle activity compulsory, without using the Activitiy Linking code. Why not change the profile page to include the new information? Tim
Comment 3: Tim, My desire is to have new people fill in these "extra" fields when they register and have it show up in the profile page. I couldn't find directions about how this could be done so I took the feedback module as a second option. Can you tell where I can find directions about adding new fields to the registration page? I only want to add a few extra fields. I took a look for the activity linking module and it seems like the activity locking code which I'm running for the quizes but didn't think about using for the feedback module too. Thanks Jared
Comment 4: Jared, Adding extra fields to the profile page (user/edit.php) is non-trivial because you have to create space for the fields in the database . I guess it is not that difficult, but I have not done it. First please consider *renaming* one or more of the fields that are already there in the profile by changing the language file moodle/lang/yourlang/moodle.php, and or (if you need to change the order) moodle/user/edit.html E.g. there are fields refering to country, town, or instant messenger. Do you need all these? I have only hacked edit.php to remove fields because there are so many.
Comment 5: Thanks for that Tim, I didn't even think to just rename the fields already there. How can I remove/hide some of the fields (like msn, aol ID that I don't need? Also I would like to change the country selector on the registration page because its not too relevant. How/where can I change the field type? I changed the descriptions in the moodle.php file and it seems to work is there any other file I need to make these changes? Jared
Comment 6: Dear Jared > How can I remove/hide some of the fields (like msn, aol ID that I don't need? Comment them out. For some (the compulsary ones) you will have to pass a hidden value. E.g. for the self-description you will need to use <INPUT TYPE=hidden NAME=description VALUE="I am human"> Passing a space (VALUE=" ") used to work but that is no longer possible. This may be indicative of the extent to which the removal of the self-description is against the basic social-constructivist philosophy of Moodle. For examples of the hacked file please see... This thread is pretty out of date http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=11783&parent=58107 Ah, this is more recent http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=4023&parent=148442 > Also I would like to change the country selector on the registration page because its not too relevant. How/where can I change the field type? I change the countries too. Just change the language files. moodle/lang/youglang/moodle.php (for words like "your country" and "you have not specified a country" and moodle/lang/yourlang/countries.php for the list of "countries" (I use them for departments) I think that moodle.php is the only one you need to change for profile. There is more to change than there seems at first because there is the lables, the you haven't entered the details and the "now that you have joined go enter a self-description" email. I change all of the following (note the last) but my lang is not English (and I have not been bothered to change the English). I just put the new definitions at the end of moodle.php because it does not hurt to define them twice. One can also use the GUI to change language strings from admin > language settings. $string['firstname'] = $string['lastname'] = $string['email'] = $string['enrolmentkey'] = $string['webpage'] = $string['missingcity'] = $string['city'] = $string['preferredlanguage'] = $string['newpicture'] = $string['returningtosite'] = $string['firsttime'] = $string['someallowguest'] = $string['selectacountry'] = $string['country'] = $string['updatemyprofile'] = $string['location'] = $string['configcountry'] = $string['missingcountry'] = $string['welcometocoursetext'] = Edit.html is the one to remove fields. Tim

Comment 1: If the plugin is written as a 'local' plugin and designed to be installed there, then it should be fine. If, however, the plugin is an activity, block, etc. then it needs to be installed in the 'mod', 'blocks', etc. folder, otherwise it will not work. The 'local' folder is really designed for plugins that do not sensibly fit into any of the other categories of plugins, but still need to make some changes to the database .

Post title: Flashcard module add-on: Installation of Flashcard on 1.9.5
Post description: I just installed Moodle on Bluehost.com through their SimpleScripts. Everything set up fine. I added a few users and classes. Everything was fine. The Moodle version is 1.9.5. I wanted to install the Flashcard module, So I downloaded/uploaded it and unzipped it to the mod folder. A subfolder named flashcard was created. I then tried to go the Admin folder, and got a blank page. After a little hunting around, I ended up deleting the folder. Everything came back to normal. I then got a file for of the flashcard from the latest build. (I think its the latest). There was one on the web that had a different version (with bulk upload ), buth that sent me back to Moodle's latest build. I again uploaded the file, and expanded it this time directly to the mod folder. The mod folder has a "flashcard". Under the flashcard folder are a number of files, a dbfolder with a couple of files, a lang folder, and a pix folder. The admin page worked this time, but now the Notification page is blank when I try to access it. So I turned on debugging from the Site Administration> Server >Debugging menu and selected both "Show all reasonable PHP debug messages" and checked Display Debug messages. When I again clicked on the Notification link, the following message appeared: Fatal error: Call to a member function get_manager() on a non-object in /home8/letsrea1/public_html/moodle/mod/flashcard/lib.php on line 25 Looking at lib.php line 25 is $dbman = $DB->get_manager();
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I unloaded the Moodle Flashcard module and installed a version 1.9 release 2. This time I got the following error messages: Function modify_database() is deprecated. Replace it with the new XMLDB stuff. line 203 of lib/dmllib.php: call to debugging() line 392 of lib/adminlib.php: call to modify_database() line 433 of admin/index.php: call to upgrade_activity_modules() Tried to modify database , but "/home8/letsrea1/public_html/moodle/mod/flashcard/db/ mysql . sql " doesn't exist! flashcard tables could NOT be set up successfully! Stack trace: line 1664 of lib/deprecatedlib.php: call to debugging() line 423 of lib/adminlib.php: call to error() line 433 of admin/index.php: call to upgrade_activity_modules()
Comment 2: The content of this forum post has been removed and can no longer be accessed.
Comment 3: It seems to be a problem with not pointing to the correct database. I installed another moodle installation (I am just starting to use Moodle.) The first and second install instances were new. All were version 1.9 something, not the developing 2.0 version. I then installed the module called flashcard_19_release2.zip. (Unzipped it and placed the folder it unzips into in the "Mod" folder. Logged in as administrator. I then went to the Site Administration area, selected Server >> Debugging and then under the drop-down box "Debug Messages" selected Developer: extra Moodle messages for developers. This is so you get rich error messages. You may want to turn this off after you solve the installation problems. I then selected Miscellaneous > XMLDbEditor. The main frame contains a list of all the database tables. I clicked on Test or one of the other queries. After I closed this, I went to the notification tab and found the message about the flashcard module. The module seems to work -- but I still am having problems having it show the pictures. I have not spent a lot of time on it this week, but will do so this next week. I'll let you know what I find. I don't know if the first two Flashcard installs were from the Flashcard.zip or flashcars1.9wBulk.zip file. I think the Flashcard.zip one from the latest build is a 2.0 based. So I'm not sure if the problem was a versioning issue or because clicking on Test and querying the database made a difference. Like I said, there are still a few problems with implementation on my site. Louis
Comment 4: I can confirm the problem with the version linked to from the module page ( http://docs.moodle.org/en/Flashcard_module ). When you install it in version 1.9.5 it blanks out the administration/notification page and doesn't install. I then tried the versions found here: http://www.ethnoinformatique.fr/course/view.php?id=123 The nightly CVS build did not work when I moved it into the administration folder. Both release 1 and release 2 seemed to install when I unzipped them (as sudo user) and moved them into the mod directory. But with release two, I was unable to import questions from a matching set or add them using the on-screen form. With release 1, I was able to add questions using the onscreen form. I haven't tried importing matching questions yet.

Post title: Enhanced Messaging Block 1.9.7
Post description: The enhanced messaging block now works with 1.9.7. I take no credit for the original code, please see the links in the block description. However a need for this service on my 1.9.7. site led to an amalgamation of two existing plugins and the resulting plugin. Hopefully others will find this useful.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I have tried to upload the files for this using the 'how to install' notes my  moodle root directory already contains 'lang' and 'admin' folders and some of the files in them what will happen if the originals are over written ? I don't want to do any dammage to the rest of my moodle site
Comment 2: Sorry for the slow reply. This block does work with 1.9.7 and was working fine on 1.9.6 but not tested on other versions yet. However I need to update the lang files with the most recent releases so as to avoid lot's of text being encased in parentheses . Also I have noticed that with this intstalled it seems to mean that users cannot be deleted. When I get the opportunity I will have a look. If anybody has any suggestions then they are gratefully received as usual. Colin
Comment 3: I have now fixed the gremlin which was preventing the deletion of users when this block was installed. The fix as usual was found via the Moodle community see http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=134516#p588222 for the details of how to patch the lib/moodlelib.php file see http://moodle.org/file.php/5/moddata/forum/32/588362/patch.lib.php . There are new instructions inside the zip file of how to install the plugin. This has only been tested on 1.9.7 any feedback from users of other versions is gratefully received. I have used this on 1.9.6 and 1.9.5 but without the moodlelib.php patch. If in doubt please back up all files that you replace first as you can then re-install them if something misfunctions.
Comment 4: Hi! I tried installing this on 1.9.11 and had some issues with it. Any updates / word on how to fix for the most recent version of Moodle? It would be super helpful!
Comment 5: hi I all sounds great, but does it work with 1.9.5+ and you haven't responded to Martin Jowett who asked "I have tried to upload the files for this using the 'how to install' notes my  moodle root directory already contains 'lang' and 'admin' folders and some of the files in them what will happen if the originals are over written ? I don't want to do any damage to the rest of my moodle site" Can you clarify - I want to install it but lack of information are making me think twice.

Post title: CMS integrations: MRBS issue
Post description: Good Afternoon Moodlers... I have just updated our MRBS install and I seem to be getting some errors... To update the install, I actually deleted it from Moodle (Admin > Modules > Blocks) then deleted the MRBS folder, made sure the MySQL tables had gone and then put the new MRBS folder in place... ran the notifications process and it all seemed to install... I have just gone to put in some of the rooms and do some setting up etc. but I keep coming accross the following - does anyone have any ideas? Deprecated : Function eregi_replace() is deprecated in D:\ wwwroot \Online\newmoodle\197\lib\moodlelib.php on line 421 Deprecated : Function eregi_replace() is deprecated in D:\wwwroot\Online\newmoodle\197\lib\weblib.php on line 2040 Deprecated : Function eregi_replace() is deprecated in D:\wwwroot\Online\newmoodle\197\lib\weblib.php on line 2041
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I seem to have solved the problem In Admin > Server > Debugging - there is a setting which mentions that it can break HTTP headers etc. The default is for this setting to be Yes (ticked) but if you untick it - MRBS works fine...
Comment 2: Wish I found this a day ago. This same error caused me an hour of serious head scratching. Did you find a solution to prevent in the case you actually wanted debugging on?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Flashcard - New maintenance track
Post description: Hi guys, here come some news of the "from now" generation of flashcard. As for some projects that were highly demanding of flashcards, i started reviewing the upgraded version of Tomasz and redrew a more "moodle way" handling of the media files for cards. In addition was a review of the card deck customisation setup. At the same moment, i was reworking Magtest and Tracker for a more complete handling of new Moodle 2 APIs. Thus the flashcard was completed with course completion implementation and more consistant course overview reports, to get it raised at a "state of the art" level. We then worked with Tomasz to check how a merge was possible. We concluded in shifting back to my worktrack for the future, as Tomasz is not available for the moment on Moodle contribution work and has no projects demanding for flashcards. The recent version published is a intensively tested and used version installed on 55 secondary schools and 40 higher education schools with active users. So it will be frequently addressed for bugfixes and will consolidate. Yet is this version stable enough for daily production. It should not evolve any more for a while, unless if we can finish integration of a video player to provide video handling on cards. We abandonned idea of a conversion script. Tomasz opted for handling media as embeds in a text card. I kept my original idea to have mediatyped card side, and use an explicit filearea for those medias. Possible is it a bit less flexible to build cards in any way the teacher wants, but gets simpler to use for people having no time to format content. This version is being tested from 2.3 to 2.5. 2.6 adventurers might report us compatibility issues to schedule work on for the future. Cheers Valery.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Etherpad-Lite: Experience and security
Post description: Hi I've been looking at the Etherpad-Lite addon and from a user perspective Etherpad-Lite much looks like what our teachers asked us for "collaborative editing". However I see the last version of the addon now dates back to mid 2012 - which doesn't seem very active although I can at least confirm it still runs on Moodle 2.5.x. In terms of security - I do know that Etherpad in its basic setup just cares about the pad ID - meaning that once you know the pad's ID you can edit it, simple as that. It isn't really intended to share documents online and keep them away from others inside the org (i.e. Teachers and Students) Now there seem to be LDAP user plugins (I haven't checked them out yet) for etherpad-lite but I'm a bit sceptic by the fact, that etherpad only uses the API key to authenticate Moodle (ahem: the user's browser as it seems, the user browser communicates with Etherpad, not the moodle server , right?) and the pad ID (which you can see in the page source code of an etherpad page inside Moodle. Maybe I'm looking at it from the wrong angle but even if it looks promising from a user's perspective, I'm not really at warm when looking a bit closer at the addon for Moodle - when you need at least some protection so classes can't overwrite pads they shouldn't get access to. What's your take - anyone using this addon in real-life? -- Mat
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I am also curious about user experiences. It might be just what I need, see my wishes . I took a try-out Pro-acount on PrimaryPad to see how it works. They offer support for the Moodle plugi n. Is it any good and worth the investment? @Mat you can secure pads with a password. Users could share this password only in their team.
Comment 2: Hi as an institution we proudly own a primaryPad pro account since a few weeks now. It seemed to be an affordable choice to avoid the stress of installing, configuring and updating this service on our own server. Although they had a few minor problems the primaryPad team is very kind and they are reacting fast. After the integration into moodle with the available PlugIn we ran some tests where everything worked as we expected. Since a few days it is not working anymore. On our side there were no changes so this is still an unsolved problem. The Plugin seems to be a few years old and has only minimum options for configuring. Another thing that could become a problem for us is that the service can be used from everywhere and can not be restricted to a course level. A Pad created in a course can be published anywhere and can even be accessed by people outside the course with usernames of their own choice. I totally understand that the primaryPad team must be charged to avoid this issue, but a practical solution for this is not part of the package and might not be an easy task. Maybe someone knows a solution for this? We also miss an option to export the content so that it can be opened in a locally installed editor like OpenOffice or LibreOffice. The HTML-Export seems to be the only standard option available. Regards Peter

Post title: QType Drag and drop onto image does not work well with IE7
Post description: Hi, I am very happy with this question type. It works fine with alle browsers, except with IE7. The draggable items are spread out horizintally and disappear under the side of the screen. Also the backgroung image gets placed too far to the right. I know IE7 is Stone Age but is still used widely in big organizations. Can it be tested and fixed in IE7? In IE8 it works fine. Bye, Isabelle
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: The OU still has a significant number of students using IE7, and I have not heard any complaints about it being broken from them. Of course, that is using the OU's theme. The only think I can think of is that IE has two rendering modes. I can't remember exactly what they are called, but something like "standards based" and "legacy". We made sure that the OU theme triggered "standards based" mode, in order to fix a lot of issues. Sorry, that is pretty incoherent. Here is a better explanation: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7155156/how-many-ie-rendering-modes-are-out-there . Basically, check which "document mode" your theme is triggering.
Comment 2: Thanks Tim, I'll pass it on to the technicals.

Forum Post: 
Post title: SynHi filter updated for Moodle 3.9 to 4.1
Post description: Hello, I have updated the SynHi filter as follows: Release 39.1.0 for Moodle 3.9 to 4.1: https://moodle.org/plugins/filter_synhi/39.1.0/28851 https://github.com/gjb2048/moodle-filter_synhi/releases/tag/V39.1.0 with: Changed to semantic versioning 2.0.0 ( https://semver.org/ ) for the release value, whereby the 'major' number is the minimum Moodle core branch number.  The 'version' property still needs to follow the Moodle way in order for the plugin to operate within the core API. Update EnlighterJS from 3.4.0 to 3.6.0. Minify Syntaxhighlighter with 'uglifyjs syntaxhighlighter.js -c -o syntaxhighlighter.min.js'. This release still could contain bugs and so I strongly recommend that you check on a test server first!  Not sure how to set one up?  Then look at the 'Installer packages' on https://download.moodle.org/releases/latest/ .  Ensure that you have multiple backups of all data before using.  Please report any issues. i.e. 'bugs' with this release ONLY here.  Before doing so please read 'Reporting issues' on the 'Information' tab on the filter 'Settings' under 'Site administration' -> 'Plugins' -> 'Filters' -> 'SynHi'. Note: The MathJax avoidance code has been removed as I believe the changes mean that it is not required.  If you find a conflict, then please let me know with screen shots / replication instructions. If you find this post useful, then please mark it so. Gareth
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello, I have updated the SynHi 39.1.0 filter as follows: Release 39.1.1 for Moodle 3.9 to 4.1: https://moodle.org/plugins/filter_synhi/39.1.1/28905 https://github.com/gjb2048/moodle-filter_synhi/releases/tag/V39.1.1 with: Fix 'non latin characters before the code block break highlighting' - #12. Fix 'Less than and greater than symbols not rendering correctly'. This release still could contain bugs and so I strongly recommend that you check on a test server first!  Not sure how to set one up?  Then look at the 'Installer packages' on https://download.moodle.org/releases/latest/ .  Ensure that you have multiple backups of all data before using.  Please report any issues. i.e. 'bugs' with this release ONLY here.  Before doing so please read 'Reporting issues' on the 'Information' tab on the filter 'Settings' under 'Site administration' -> 'Plugins' -> 'Filters' -> 'SynHi'. Note: The MathJax avoidance code has been removed as I believe the changes mean that it is not required.  If you find a conflict, then please let me know with screen shots / replication instructions. If you find this post useful, then please mark it so. Gareth

Forum Post: 
Post title: How to use the filter plugin after installation?
Post description: I have installed the following plugin to draw flowcharts in moodle, but I'm unable to understand how to use the plugin after installation. Where exactly do I go to access the plugin? I'm entirely new to PHP development; please help me understand the plugin's usage. Apologies if this is not the place to ask. plugin: https://moodle.org/plugins/filter_flowchart
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: My first suggestion would be to avoid using a plugin that has not been updated in 7 years - there is a good chance it will not work properly with recent releases of Moodle (although, to be fair, with a filter you might have a better chance of it working). I'm not sure what PHP development you want to do - installing a plugin shouldn't require any modification of the PHP code. To use the filter, you just need to enable it on your system: https://docs.moodle.org/en/Managing_filters Then, according to the plugin documentation, you just need to add some text onto your Moodle site (e.g. in a forum post, or in 'page' resource), that looks like the example in the plugin description, e.g. 
```text
\flowChart[inline, yes-text:yup, line-width: 2]{st=>start: start
in=>inputoutput: x,y
op=>operation: z=x+y
ou=>inputoutput: z
en=>end: end
st->in->op->ou->en}
```
 If everything is working correctly, then the filter will spot that specific text in the what you have written and replace it with the flowchart described by that text.
Comment 2: Thanks. Your advice helped me solve my problem.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Cannot find HTTPS Conversion Tool in the Moodle directory
Post description: This seems strange to me. I've been able to find other plugins in the Moodle directory and install them without issue, but I cannot seem to find: https://docs.moodle.org/35/en/HTTPS_conversion_tool Is it still available? Is there a zip file available for it anywhere? I'm on Moodle 3.5 Thanks!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You do have a valid Certificate from a CA (they issue certs) ... and it's installed ... correct? Site can respond to https:// ... and the lock in the URL line of the browser shows green or a broken icon? Check your config.php file for the variable wwwroot ... which is a url.   Does it have http://site or https://site? The two ... what's in DB and what's in config.php .., need to match. That tool is supposed to be part of core now ... not an addon. There may not be a link in the admin menus for it so .... Go to: http://yoursite/admin/tool/httpsreplace/ If it is there, strongly suggest making a backup of your DB before using. If it's not there, how was the Moodle installed? 'spirit of sharing', Ken
Comment 2: It's standard in Moodle so  you won't find it in the Plugins directory. I realised when looking at the docs HTTPS conversion tool that it wasn't clear where to find it, so I updated the docs; thanks for the heads up. You'll find it linked to from the HTTP security page, or else by typing admin/tool/httpsreplace/index.php after the URL of your Moodle site.
Comment 3: Thanks so much for your help. The problem really was that I was looking for a plugin that is now integrated. Thanks for updating the documentation. Hopefully that will save someone else from getting confused.

Forum Post: 
Post title: JPlayer(video player)
Post description: Hello everyone, I've been working on a little video player for Moodle 2.x, named JPlayer(this name might change). This player uses the latest free version of JW Player 6. I am looking for a second opinion about it, user feedback about this activity and some help testing it. So if someone has some time to try this out and send me some feedback, that would be helpful. This activity is still in development, so i dont recommend using it on a production server . I have tested this only on Moodle 2.3 and Moodle 2.4... This player is based on Matt Bury's MediaPlayer(Thank you!), but this is a lightweight version of that. It does not have the snapshots, bitstreaming, metaviewer, skins, logo, etc.. functionality(mostly because the free version of JW Player 6 does not support those). Although it enables you to use start image, multiple captions, playlists(from youtube or upload multiple mp4 files - HD Switch is supported too) and a little bit more. Currently only mp4, flv, webm video formats are supported. Captions support is the same as goes for JW Player 6(vtt for example). I have'nt done much documentation about it, but it should be relatively easy to understand it. You can download and try this out - https://github.com/t6nis/moodle-mod_jplayer Or you can go and view some examples here(login as guest) - http://moodle.t6nis.com/course/view.php?id=3 I have'nt figured out a decent way for streaming support... If you find any issues please report them here or better in github.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Tonis, I just went and took a quick look as guest and will give this a try later on tomorrow on my dev servers. I think the playlist capability is something I could REALLY learn to like as I have years and years of portfolio videos that I would like to make available for my students without having to make a scroll-of-death page for them. (Big Buck Bunny sure gets around a lot.) AL
Comment 2: Hi Tõnis, Great, looking forward to seeing it in action. I'd be happy to help out with testing, etc. If you're into developing in Actionscript and want a truly open source media player with all the bells and whistles, this is worth checking out: http://www.osmf.org/ Basically, all the really intensive development and testing work has been done for you and you can just put together a modular media player to your specific requirements. Post title: Resume Module
Post description: Hello All, I have recently install the resume module to a 1.6.2 moodle for demos and testing. This worked beautifully!!! and i was very happy. Now i have come to install the module on a live Moodle site. tables created fine everything seems ok. I selected add new activity in edit mode, typed in the name for the button label. - "Resume last studied lesson " click update and I get this error: Not Found The requested URL /mod/user/view.php was not found on this server . When i cannot go any further i returned to the main course page and see that the button had actually been added, great. So i click on the button and I get the same error message. I have tried this with admin and student accounts, same result. Obviously there is no user directory in the mod folder, so i assume the PHP is calling on the incorrect directory location. This should probably be /user/view.php without the mod in front?? perhaps im wrong? ----------------------------------------- OK Scrap that, i figured it out. The students and admins i used for testing had no record of which last viewed resources. I went into a preview of a lesson and back out, clicked the resume button, it now works ok. same with student account.

Comment 3: Hi Cathy, I just noticed one thing - you do not seem to be passing any values to Moodle. The lines: theAnswer = "This is working"; theScore = 100; should come before the line: answers = theAnswer; score = theScore;
Comment 4: Hi again Cathy, I would change the Frame 1 actionscript as below, just for testing: //fake results to test this _root.answer = "This is working"; _root.score = 100; _root.startTime = getTimer(); //button ends timer and sends result through moodle _root.finishButton.onRelease = function() { endTime = getTimer()-_root.startTime; moodleService.send_response(_root.answer, endTime, _root.score); moodleService.cleanUp(); }; moodleService.init(); This assumes that you have a button in your movie named finishButton. Note the use of the prefix _root to make the variables accessible from the onRelease function. Also, note that the event is called onRelease not XonRelease . I think the 'X' was a typographic error in Jamie's tuturial. Having said all this, I don't think this will help you solve your "Invalid Credentials" problem, as I doesn't for me either. The ldap stuff you get when searching in Google for "Invalid credentials" has got nothing to do this with problem. I am not even using ldap for authentication and I assume you are neither. For some reason, the session that is created in moodleService.init() and stored in _$SESSION, can not be accessed when moodleService.send_response is called. Where did it go? What happened to it? Did it NOT get created in moodleService.init()? These are questions I am trying to answer. The whole thing is complicated by the fact that "most of the time" it works fine (for me). Let me know if you get any further with the changed actionscript. Rene.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Etherpad Lite Error: Could not get api version
Post description: Until Version 2021073000 the Etherpad plugin worked for us. In all newer Versions we got the Error: Could not get api version Now I debugged a little bit and found out, that in the file etherpadlite\classes\client.php in the function get_version() the $url = $this->baseurl; ends with /api and not with /api/ what leads to an Etherpad instead of the JSON . After adding the missing slash with the following code it works for us: if(!(substr_compare($url, "/", -1) === 0)){ $url.="/"; }
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello Peter Unfortunately im having the same problem. My IT knowledge is not too good. Any chance you can guide me through this fix? Best regards from germany ^^
Comment 2: Hi Salem, please do not modify the code! Which version of Moodle do you use? In newer versions of Moodle the setting "curlsecurityblockedhosts" is prefilled with private ip adresses. So if you use an internal connection to your etherpad server , which often is the case, the internal connection is blocked by Moodles curl. You can disable this block just for your etherpad connection by activating "etherpadlite | ignoresecurity" in your etherpad settings. Best regards Andreas
Comment 3: Hi Peter, perhaps your Etherpad server has an incorrect configuration. The url " https://your-etherpad-server.example.com/api " called from your Moodle server should return the json content, whether it has a trailing slash or not. Best regards Andreas
Comment 4: Hi Andreas, we used a nginx configuration from this site: https://www.atlantic.net/dedicated-server-hosting/how-to-install-the-etherpad-collaborative-web-editor-on-rocky-linux-8/ A look in the rewrite rules showed the problem. With the last rewrite rule rewrite /(.*) /p/$1; /api was rewrited into /p/api I add the following line before that last line to fix this problem: rewrite ^/api$ /api/ break; Thanks Peter
Comment 5: Hello, I tried with Moodle version 4.1 to include the Etherpad installation https://pad.igmetall-moodle.de/ and get the error message "Could not get api version". Do you have any tips what the error could be: Server URL in the plugin settings says: https://pad.igmetall-moodle.de Best regards Guido
Comment 6: I was able to get rid of the error message "Could not get api version". so now I can create a pad in Moodle, however I cannot access it within Moodle. The error message I get is "pad.igmetall-moodle.de has refused the connection." Best regards Guido

Forum Post: 
Post title: Poll module
Post description: The university I'm working for wants to be able to allow students to choose which classes they might be interested in registering for - that is, if we have the ability to offer latin or greek next semester, but don't care which one is run, we want to leave it up to the potential students to decide in a democratic manner.  This would go for a wide variety of classes, as well, because we offer many classes that might interest people who only wish to take one or two courses with us. I was thinking that perhaps we could have it tied to the courses table so that an admin could simply drag "possible" classes for the next semester from one box to the next, much like you add teachers to courses or what-have-you.  Each student would get two votes, or, better yet, have some kind of instant-runoff setup, and be able to view what classes are getting the most votes.  If they want to change their vote so that they can shift the balance from one course to another (and they don't think the course they REALLY want will be taught that semester) up until a cutoff date. Is anyone else working on such an idea?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi, I think that there are forms to perform this with existing tools. At my University all students are enroled in a "course" called "Meeting Zone". It that course there are forums for social interaction, lost&found and that kind of stuff. You can add a "Choice" instance asking for preferences in a handful of courses. Choice module is designed for not too many options (4-6). But may be enough for latin vs. greek. And other Choices would ask about science or engineering courses. Perhaps you may have a look to the "Form" module by Teemu Sumi. When finished (few days) it will allow asking and consolidating data from students in a database .

Post title: ELIS reports
Post description: Hello, I'm a relative newcomer to the world of Moodle and ELIS and would dearly love it if someone could provide some advice on this issue for me. I am wondering how difficult it would be for a person with basic programming skills (aka me or my company's server technician) to change an ELIS report so that it shows more information. To be precise, I want to change the course completion gas gauge report so that it also shows the city/town profile field (I'm using that field to store our office locations and want to be able to group our staff into their offices in my reports).  I am using Moodle 2.5 and the site is being managed by our server technician so he has access to make code changes. Is this something that I (or my tech guy) could change easily or would I be better not to meddle with existing reports? I would be keen to hear from others who have tried/achieved this. Many thanks, John
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi John - I think if you can work your way through the code, you should be able to figure out how to do that. Ideally, if you change the report, it would be great if you could change it in a way that other ELIS users could use it as well - then submit it back through Github. For that situation, I'd recommend making the fields that are displayed configurable with the report, so users could decide which ones they want displayed. mike
Comment 2: Hi Mike, Thanks for your response. Ideally we would like to have have a list of configurable fields on the report (something similar to what's offered on the user class completion report) but i'm not sure if we'll have the skills or know how in-house to do so. From what I can see, there are several reports in ELIS that provide almost all of the information we would need, but none that provide all of it in one report. Any advice from others who have already worked with ELIS reports would be most helpful. Either way, I'll certainly keep this post updated with our progress. John

Forum Post: 
Post title: Course Dedication Plug-in
Post description: I've given a try to the plugin "Course Dedication", and found that on the first cron task it took 20 hours, and the following about 8minutes (they rune once a day as far as I can see). Sayd that my moodle has many thousands of courses and users. I'm asking which data does the plugin collect? 20 hours and 8 minutes reveal a huge amount of data, I suspect that it doesn't collect only data from the single one course on which I have activated the block, but maybe on all site's courses and users. Is there a way to limit the data collection only to relevant courses where the plugin's block is added?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello, Duccio! 👋 The Course Dedication collects detailed information about user interaction with courses, tracking the dedication time in each user session. What happens, as you rightly observed, is that it typically collects data across the entire platform, not just the course where the block is added. This is why the first cron run can take quite a while, especially in Moodles with thousands of courses and users. Unfortunately, this plugin was designed to analyze all site courses and users, and it doesn't limit the data collection to the specific course where the block is inserted. This large-scale analysis configuration creates an enormous amount of processing. Eduardo Kraus Teacher and programmer

Forum Post: 
Post title: OU Blog - no guest access?
Post description: We're trying to create a blog that allows people to comment on posts. As far as we can see OU Blog should be a solution, but the user has to be logged in to access it. We've created html page resources which the anonymous user can access but for OU Blog it seems this is not possible. Does anyone have any hints on this? I've set bloglevel to world and outologinguests to yes. Thanks, Brent
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You need to look at the permissions that are defined for your guest user role. If you don't know where that is: Site admin menu -> Users -> Permissions -> Define defualt roles. Then click on the guest role. Scroll down the screen and find the section for OUBlog. There are permissions to switch on commenting, but the default installation is that only logged in people can do this kind of thing. So, yes I think it should be possible. But I wouldn't recommend it. As some-one who looks after a big open-access site we have enough trouble controlling spam posts from users who are logged in, let alone worrying about what would happen if you let any-one post. You're opening yourself up to a large moderation task to police the comments and ensure that they're valid input on your site.
Comment 2: We are looking at the possibility of enabling public comments (with no login of any kind) in a future version. If this goes ahead, it would probably be on a user-moderated basis: each user making the post ('author') would have to choose to allow public comments - ie the existing option 'Comments? yes/no' would become 'yes/yes and moderated public comments/no'. If they do choose that, then public comments will not actually appear in the blog straight away; the author will get an email and will then have to approve or reject the comment. Supposing they get spam as a result of this, it only goes to them, and they can always edit the post to turn off the public-comment option...
Comment 3: Well I need to clarify with my client whether they want to allow anonymous users to leave comments. However, I would like to allow anonymous users to view the blog. At this point I can't seem to figure out how to do that. I'll look at the previous poster's suggestion a little later today to see if there's something I can come up with. Thanks everyone for the quick response. Brent

Forum Post: 
Post title: Xamaleon (Alternative resource for pre-registration)
Post description: * Some of my work required to carry out some type of preregistration (search) for the entity (school / company) could select the right audience for your courses or events. When using systems like Joomla, you can perform this kind of task because there are many plugins for it. The fact is that once I came across a situation, unexpected for me, one of those "surveys" had a demand very high, it made the database of Joomla stay overwhelmed and consequently there was a fall of link several times. After that I started to evaluate the use of these tools and came to the conclusion that we were getting much "garbage" accumulated in our database; were the information that served only for research (preregistration). As a result, I decided to change the way we conduct these events ( preregistration / search ), using a feature that would free the database. It was once developed a tool for this purpose, it is a registration system (preregistration) based on the storage of information on XML files. For a while I used the feature and was very good to me and the companies I worked, we had no more problems with the database. However, this "tool", stood in my files (backups) for a few years. Some time ago, I remembered her and I decided to give a "polished" in the codes. The result of this work is the XAMALEON (Soordle.org part of the project). A system ( Open Source ) modular, multi-languages, all built in PHP and XML . It can work in parallel to any platform (Joomla, Moodle etc.) You have on your site. With this system it is possible to perform pre-registration online without any impairment in its other applications. Fully configurable and with possible expansion without major difficulties. Anyway, I could talk a lot about the system here, but I think that is not the case now. In the desire to contruibuir with the Moodle community, please know that the system is available for download at: www.eadgames.com.br If you want to see a video example of the system being up and running: I hope this "feature" will be useful somehow to distance learning professionals. * google translator

Forum Post: 
Post title: Google Apps integration: Google Apps/Moodle - Invalid Email error
Post description: Hello, Earlier this summer we successfully integrated Google Apps and our Moodle (1.9.3) installation with SSO. Things have been working pretty well, and the teachers LOVE it! However, we are running in to some problems with a few users (teachers and students). These users are able to log in to Moodle fine, but get an "Invalid email. Unable to process your request at this time, please try again later" message from Google. Their Google Apps user is never created then. I contacted Google support and they believe that the first time the user logged in and attempted to go to a Google App, their account creation failed for some reason, but that Moodle must have flagged it in some way as being successful so it doesn't attempt to create the account again. Does anyone know if this is truly how Moodle handles these accounts, and which table/column that setting would be held in so I could change it? Also, if this is the case, is there something we can change in Moodle so it doesn't flag the account unless it was truly successful? I'd appreciate any help or insight! Thanks, Jill
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I think we've fixed our issue! With help from Melissa Benson, we changed the Users -> Authentication -> LDAP server -> Bind Settings -> "Hide password" option to NO, so Moodle caches the users password to the database . I then deleted all failed account creation attempts out of mdl_blocks_gdata_gapps table, and all users have been able to successfully sync and access Google Apps so far, including ones that had always received the "invalid email" error previously. I'll reply if this doesn't work long term, or if I have any more information, but for right now this appears to be fixed! Thanks, Melissa!
Comment 2: Another reason I believe may contribute to this invalid email problem, if you change your users by deleting them from Moodle thus removing them from Google due to the connection, Google doesn't let you rebuild the user for 5 days. If I cannot rebuild a user in 5 days, I'll write back that this is not true... Till then I wait.

The short version of my need is that we want the Google Apps usernames to include either the student or teacher domain , as appropriate (i.e. teacher@ school.com or student@ schoolstu.org ) . A few specifics for our situation: Moodle 2.4 Google Apps for Education account in place Two domains verified - all certs and keys in place (as far as I can tell) Primary domain (teachers/admin) - school .com Secondary domain (students) - schoolstu .org I have mainly used the instructions from: http://docs.moodle.org/24/en/Google_Apps_Integration and https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=202476 but have read everything else that I could find. I was under the impression that a student logged into Moodle and could then click one of the links in the Google Apps block and immediately be logged into his Google Apps account (and that that account would be created at that point if it did't already exist). That hasn't been the case, but we do get the following: Using the Google User Sync Block - I add a user to the list of users being synced Run the moodlename/blocks/gdata/cron.php Student is created as a google user and can then follow the Google apps link into his shiny new Google account. (It appears that the student needs to have logged into Moodle between steps 1 and 2 for step 3 to work) This is all well and good and would suffice - except that the Google user name is generated as username@ school.com for both teachers and students, where we would like for the student accounts to be created using the student domain (username@ schoolstu.org , in this instance). In Piers Harding's documentation at https://github.com/piersharding/moodle-google/blob/master/auth/gauth/README.txt , I read this: Multiple Domains: If you want to allow multiple domains access in, then set domainname to a comma delimited list of the valid domains. This will not work with the Enable GAPPS domain specific login option. Which sounds pretty close to what we want, but I may be reading too much into it. Our problem has not been allowing the two domains' users into Google, but rather assigning their usernames in Google based on their domain - using their email addresses, basically. The last post in the discussion: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=158882 Sounded promising, but did not work for me. Any ideas? I can supply whatever more information would help. Thanks in advance! David

Post title: Flashcard module add-on: PNG images and Internet Explorer
Post description: Hi there. First up, thanks for the flashcards module. It is really great. We use it often. I came across a bad gotcha today. and I thought Ishould share it. If you use flashcards with images AND you use png images AND your students are using Internet Explorer (6 have not tested 7). Only the image on the first flashcard will show. Subsequent card images will not show. It seems to be to do with IE 's handling of the style.display css tag. So you will need to use jpg's
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Justin, thanks for reporting, it may help other users and save some headake tablets !! I would be very likely to have experience feedback on the Leitner system results in teaching, specially would I be glad to receive some effective conclusion about efficiency in memorizing things. cheers.
Comment 2: HI Valerie Well it may surprise you but I do not use the flashcards module in the usual way. I use it in the classroom as a drillwork activity in pairs. One student reads the question on their card to another student. That student then answers. The first student checks their answer and then they swap roles. On the question side I have perhaps: a) an answer to a question in English - and the student must make a question b) a phrase in Japanese - and the student must say it in English c) a sentence in English - and the tense or some other grammatical aspect needs to be changed. It works surprisingly well, my students are used to doing it and enjoy it. Also if I have a few minutes extra in a class, or as a warm up, I can ask the students to use an old set of flashcards for review. So we don't use the leitner feature, and I don't have any stats, but I am very happy with it.

Post title: FLAX language learning module
Post description: ```text
We are happy to announce a new contributed module for language learning,
called FLAX.

FLAX helps automate the production and delivery of practice exercises
for learning English. You, the teacher, can create exercises from the
textual content of digital libraries. You can also create your own
digital library collections, add them to the course as resources, and,
optionally, share them within your institution.

FLAX comprises two modules that are intended to be installed together:

1. The language learning activity module provides a way of designing
and delivering language learning exercises, based on the contents of
digital library collections.

2. The digital library resource module allows teachers to create their
own digital library collections and add them to their course.

See the 
FLAX module documentation
 and 
try it out
 for more details.

(Maintained by Dean Stringer, University of Waikato, New Zealand)
```

Comment 12: Hi! Shaoqun Wu , Thanks for your wonderful module. I wonder we can use FLAX for other language teaching such as German, Spanish, Korean, etc. If we make digital library with Korean, do you expect it will work? Thanks. Jong-Dae Park
Comment 13: Hi Jong-Dae, Thanks for trying out the FLAX module. Ms Shaoqun Wu is on maternity leave. I'll be answering questions in the forum. To use FLAX for teaching a particular language, you can 1) use texts in the language to build collections; 2) create language activities out of the texts in the collection. FLAX collections can be built using texts of many languages (including the three languages mentioned in your post). But, for FLAX activities to be practiced in languages other than English, a parser of the language is needed to successfully identify certain parts of the text of the language. For example, verbs, nouns, etc.. As to your question, you CAN build collections using texts in Korean. You will then be able to search and browse documents in the collection. To use FLAX language activities in teaching Korean, however, you'll need a Korean parser. As it for now, you could still go ahead and build a collection using texts in languages other than English. The texts in the collection will be parsed by the English parser (the only available parser in FLAX at the moment). The English parser relies on white space to segment words and full stop to identify sentences. If the language does not possess similar nature, the activities in the collection won't even be doing the basics, let alone identifying word/sentence types of the language. To better understand this, go to a collection that we built using texts of a New Zealand native Maori language called Te Wharekura . Activities in this collection are created using the English parser, hence they are much simpler and don't have the options like word types, sentence types etc., compared our standard Password collection which is in English. The activities in the collection Te Wharekura are only basically functional because the language also has white space between words and a full stop character at the end of each sentence like English. It doesn't hurt to build a collection yourself using texts in whatever language you are interested in. Then you'd understand what I've said even better. Hope that's answered your question. cheers, Xiaofeng

Comment 15: Hi Panyarak, Thanks for trying out FLAX. To answer your first question, I need more information in order to figure out what went wrong when you tried to build a collection. I've just tried building a collection myself in the FLAX Sandbox course on our demo site. It works all fine for me. Please elaborate at which step, the actions you took, and how the program reacted to your actions. As to your second question, I must say that we have only tested the server installation on Ubuntu 8.10 and no higher. You wrote: > But tomcat6 and ImagMagik are not install as expected. Could you please check in /usr/local/Greenstone3/packages directory and see whether this contains a folder called tomcat and a zip file called apache-tomcat-6.0.*.zip? (Where * can be anything.). That'll tell you whether tomcat has been installed or not. Ant 1.7.1 and tomcat 6 are supposed to be installed for you when you installed the server. You wrote that you were trying to run: > sudo sh gs3-server.sh Did you install FLAX in a special location that it required you to run it with "sudo"? Is there a location that you can install it in that will allow you to run the command directly with: > ./gs3-server.sh This is the way we have been testing it on Ubuntu 8.10 here. Instead of running the gs3-server.sh program, could you try running the following from a terminal (from the top level installation folder, in your case it'd be /usr/local/Greenstone3): > source gs3-setup.sh (this command sets up environment) > ant start (this starts the tomcat server) (the command to stop the server is: ant stop) This should start tomcat directly and also give you messages as to whether tomcat failed to start and why. If it worked, you would be able to open a browser and go to the http://[ host -name-you-specified]:[port-number]/ to see whether tomcat works. (The host-name value might be localhost for instance, and the default port is 8080 unless you specifically changed these settings in build.properties.) If that works, the next step is to point your browser to http://[host-name-you-specified]:[port-number]/greenstone3/flax and see whether the flax home page works as well. Hope that helps cheers, Xiaofeng

Its value is >'/usr/local/Greenstone3/packages/jre'. But when I >ran 'sudo ant start', the same error came up This is because you ran the 'ant start' as root user. Forum Post: 
Post title: Ad-Hoc Reports: Find total messages sent by user?
Post description: Using Moodle 2.7.1, I would like to create a query that gives me the total read and unread messages sent by each user on a given date.  I have just enough SQL skills to give me either the read or the unread messages, but not both.  Can anyone help out with a query that will return a table like this: lastname firstname messages sent Mouse Mickey 5 Duck Donald 13 Pan Peter 2 where "messages sent" would be something like COUNT(mdl_messages.fullmessage) + COUNT(mdl_messages_read.fullmessage) Any help would be appreciated.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: As so often happens, a good night's sleep solved the problem.  Here is a query that will find all messages sent by a user (both read and unread) between two dates (Moodle 2.7.1, Ad-Hoc Reports plugin): SELECT COUNT(tblmessage.fullmessage) AS Total_Messages, CONCAT_WS(" ",{user}.firstname,{user}.lastname), tblmessage.useridfrom AS UserID FROM (SELECT fullmessage, useridfrom FROM {message} WHERE timecreated BETWEEN :start1_date AND :end1_date UNION ALL SELECT fullmessage, useridfrom FROM {message_read} WHERE timecreated BETWEEN :start2_date AND :end2_date) AS tblmessage JOIN {user} ON tblmessage.useridfrom = {user}.id GROUP BY tblmessage.useridfrom ORDER BY {user}.lastname ASC, {user}.firstname The "ORDER BY" statement could easily be changed to order by greatest number of messages instead of alphabetically by name.  A "WHERE" statement could also be added to filter by userid. Ad-Hoc Reports won't let you use the same parameter twice, so you have to enter four dates when you run the query.  The two end dates and the two start dates should be the same.
Comment 2: Here is a version that shows a count of all messages sent today, broken down by user.  I set this to run automatically at 23:00 and send the results to me in an email.  Very convenient. SELECT COUNT(tblmessage.fullmessage) AS Total_Messages, CONCAT_WS(" ",{user}.firstname,{user}.lastname), tblmessage.useridfrom AS UserID SELECT COUNT(tblmessage.fullmessage) AS Total_Messages, CONCAT_WS(" ",{user}.firstname,{user}.lastname) AS Name, tblmessage.useridfrom AS UserID
FROM (SELECT fullmessage, useridfrom FROM {message} WHERE DATE(FROM_UNIXTIME(timecreated)) = DATE(NOW()) UNION ALL SELECT fullmessage, useridfrom FROM {message_read} WHERE DATE(FROM_UNIXTIME(timecreated)) = DATE(NOW())) AS tblmessage
JOIN {user} ON tblmessage.useridfrom = {user}.id
GROUP BY tblmessage.useridfrom
ORDER BY {user}.lastname ASC, {user}.firstname

Forum Post: 
Post title: Feature Bounty / Commercial Plug-In Developmement
Post description: First off, let me preface that I new to the Moodle community, I've been a lurker for awhile and familiar with the system, but only recently been able to join and am looking forward to getting involved. The reason I'm posting: I'm interested in what the rules are for commercial work. I have ideas and needs for a couple of plug-ins that I am interested in developing and I've seen posts in the forums where other users are looking for the same thing I am. I'm willing to code it, but would prefer to defray my costs some. I've seen other open source communities support things like a bounty, or allow for commercial plug-ins to be sold. What is the Moodle community take/rules on this? Thanks, Chet
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: My understanding is that plugins can be developed commercially for a client (e.g. themes are often created to demand for a client as a paid for service, or made available through an online purchasing method) but these are not posted through the moodle.org plugins database where all the contributed plugins have to follow the same licence as moodle itself. There are restrictions in using the moodle name to advertise/sell services though Richard
Comment 2: To clarify, all plugins developed for Moodle must be licensed under the GPL (v3) as they are written to integrate into Moodle itself (and in most cases, will used bits of standard code copied from Moodle anyway). It does not matter whether you are developing the plugin for a client or for the general public. However, the GPL does not require you to distribute your plugin publicly, it only requires that you include the source code whenever, and to whoever, you supply the program to (in the case of Moodle plugins , the source code is the program, so this isn't an issue) and that the recpipient can freely modify and distribute the code (if they wish - a paying client may decide to keep the code to themselves, but that is up to them). To get back to the original question - the Moodle jobs database (see link above) was orignally a place to ask for people to do specific jobs and a place to advertise availabilty for work. However, as only Moodle Partners are allowed to use the Moodle trademark to advertise for work ("I'd like to develop this Moodle plugin, who will pay me?" would probably fall foul of this restriction), the second part of the functionality was removed (at last check you could still enter your availability, but it is not displayed).
Comment 3: Thank you both for the response and clarification of the terms. Much appreciated!

Comment 1: Hello Meir First I must say that I never have installed or used VB.net as you request, but seems that the "mono proyect" can solve your problem http://www.mono-project.com/docs/about-mono/languages/visualbasic/ Steps to get code in VB.net runs in VPL 1) Install mono visual basic compiler in your(s) jail server (s) Command in Ubuntu sudo apt-get install mono-vbnc 2) Create a VPL activity with your own "vpl_run.sh" to run VB.Net code.Take the default VPL C# script and adapt it to use vbnc https://github.com/jcrodriguez-dis/moodle-mod_vpl/blob/master/jail/default_scripts/csharp_run.sh 3) Use the previous activity as "based on" (VPL feature) in the other activities that use VB.Net Best regards

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle import an existing TurnItIn activity
Post description: Hi In Moodle I understand that we should not duplicate a TurnItIn activity as this doesn't create a new class/record/ID for the duplicated one. However do we get the same results if we import a TurnItIn activity from a previous module? I'm trying to decrease the development time so ideal situation is to import a whole module including TurnItIn and just amend the dates. Kind regards Usman
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: A Turnitin assignment on Moodle is only a pointer to the activity on the Turnitin servers. Whatever you do on Moodle (e.g. duplicate a Turnitin assignment, or restore from backup), will only make sense if the matching information exists on the Turniting servers.
Comment 2: You should always create your TII assignments from scratch in each course. I know it's a pain but that's just best practice. You can cause some collisions and unwanted issues if you import or copy the assignments between courses. I've also heard anecdotally from our sales rep that there is an upper limit for total submissions and number of students enrolled in a course. I would connect with your contact at iParadigms for more information or try the helpdesk at Turnitin.com (though be ready to wait a while for a response if you go the latter route).
Comment 3: Hi, As Joseph says you can cause duplication of data, this occurs in v1 of the plugin. In v2 you can elect to not include user data in backup/restore which will create a new instance in Turnitin. Import doesn't include user data so this will create new instances regardless. John
Comment 4: Hi John Just for confirmation - with v2 if we import it should be fine and have its own new instance?
Comment 5: Hi John, Does that mean with V2 restoring a backup to a new course without data will create a new matching instance on the turnitin servers?
Comment 6: Usman, did you ever get an answer to this question? BTW how are you? Jacqui
Comment 7: I have just tested and can confirm that importing a Turnitin activity without users does does not create a new classid on Turnitin.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle Activity Completion
Post description: I want to make the student complete the page activity after watching all the video I don't want the student to mark the activity as complete or just view it I want to control the completion there is any ideas to reach this?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: i want to add custom activity completion conditions to all activity and the custom here dependent on the time of the student spends watching the video
Comment 2: Depending upon your version of Moodle and if your version has the h5p plugin part of core, you might want to check out H5P's Interactive Video: https://h5p.org/interactive-video Basically, student begins playing video, but you can insert questions about what was just viewed ... example ... first 2 minutes of video has 2 things you would like students to retain (learn?) from watching that segment of the video.  @ the 2 minute mark, H5P presents student with some questions about what they just viewed.   And you can branch according to their responses ... get a question in-correct, back to first frame of video.   Get them all correct, video continues ... to the set of questions at the end of the video where again branching could exist ... all questions answered correctly, done with video.  A question answered incorrectly to send them back to the beginning of that segment of the video. Student cannot start the video and then walk away because of the (as in Zig Zigler's books of old) 'check ups from the neck up'. 'SoS', Ken
Comment 3: Yes, students can & sometimes do start a video & then switch tabs or leave their computers/devices to go & do something else. Many students believe that they can multitask (attending to two or more things at the same time, e.g. checking social media while watching a video). As instructors/instructional designers, it's our responsibility to show them that this is a poor way to study & leads to lower learning outcomes. So yes, something like H5P's interactive video can prompt students to demonstrate their understanding of what they're watching to ensure they're paying full attention.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Flash module add-on: Disabling screen recording
Post description: Hi All, I am creating study material in SWF format. Students uses streaming to view the files. But how do avoid students recording the material which they view on the screen?. ANy idea or suggestions??. Thank You
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Short answer - You can't. Slightly longer answer - this question gets asked in some form *very* regularly. Others will point out that there are things you can do to make it more difficult but data coming over the web can *always* be captured if somebody really wants to. It usually isn't that hard either. Next question - why do you want to stop them?
Comment 2: There are some things you can do to control access to your material. It is possible of course to only allow access of your materials to students who have been enrolled in your course. It is also possible for the Flash file to check if the user is currently logged in and is viewing your material as part of your course or perform other checks before allowing itself to be played. Unfortunately a expert user could decompile your Flash file and remove this protection, using special software. There are ways to make it more difficult or maybe even impossible to decompile a Flash movie, using special software. Of course you can't stop someone doing a screen capture and recording animation etc from your Flash content.
