Forum Post: 
Post title: Flash module add-on: Moodle Flash Best Practise
Post description: Hi All, Our company (CLT) does a fair amount of screen casting which we output in flash. We also help business to use Moodle to build internal training on Moodle, so we do a lot of end user training on how to use Moodle and run courses, having said that I would like to start a discussion to bring some clarity to how we, as practioners, use Flash in Moodle. By way of starting this, I will list our current method, and hopefully may bring out some better "best practise" for all flash implementations. Using products like Camtasia, Captivate and of course flash. 1. Camtasia and Captivate: Camtasia and Captivate outputs have incorporated html, preloaders, flash file. Method: 1.1. navigate to the output directory, zip all the files in the directory. 1.2 upload and upzip the zip file into the course file area 1.3 In the Moodle course area, use the resource to create a link to an html file to hook to the html file produced by camtasia and captivate.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Thanks for starting this discussion Patrick. About 2 : 2. Using only the SWF file 2.1 if only a swf file is available, then upload to files area. 2.2 Ensuring that the multimedia plugin is activated (search flash forum for howto on this) 2.3 Use the resource >> link element to hook to the swf file. Use the ?w=800&h=600 code at the end of the link to control the size. (I still don't see this as the swf always is fitted to the size window opened - what is that?) 2.4 Select if you want to open in new window or show as a framed window. The way to control the size is actually ?d=800x600. This would give a size of width 800 times height 600. The default in 1.7 and 1.8 if the d parameter is not used is width 400 times height 300. I think this was introduced in 1.6?
Comment 2: I should mention that there are fairly serious security implications of enabling the multimedia plug in. A malicious student who is tech savvy could do nasty things with the plug in on.
Comment 3: and it is worse to allow the object tag. If you're running a big site with many users you have to be careful about how you allow users to embed Flash. The Trusttext code is one solution to this problem. According to the wiki it is only working in the Forum and Glossary module so far but the plan is to roll this out across Moodle.
Comment 4: Thanks Jamie, I was wondering why it was not working! I saw a number of permeatations of this so was not sure. In terms of security, do you suggest turning off the multimedia plugin? Will I still be able to "link" my flash files using the "link to html or file" option in the resource area of the course. What would be the best way to embed a flash movie that doesn't require communication with moodle in any way? Regards, Patrick
Comment 5: As you say Camtasia / Flash / most applications that generate Flash will also generate an html file. Probably the easiest and secure way to get your Flash file into Moodle is to upload those files either individually or as a zip to your course files area and link to them as a resource. Unfortunately this means you'll be using frames or a popup window or the resource will open in the same window with no navigation. This linking as a resource does mean that if you link directly to the swf the parameters like the user first name and last name can be passed into the swf. And you can control the size of the popup window. So I think a popup window would be the best option available for many situations. Some users do find popups a little difficult to deal with but it would be easy to include a button in your movie 'close this window', to make things easier for them.
Comment 6: It might be a good idea to create a simple Flash resource, to have a resource that let's you pick a Flash file and then generate a page with the proper Moodle header and navigation at the top and the Flash file below. It would let you control how the Flash file was embedded in the page - width, height parameters etc. And you could pass simple parameters to the flash movie - Username, Course Name, etc, same as with the current resource. We could take advantage of the new UFO js library that is included in the Moodle header and used to embed Flash elsewhere. The advantage of using the UFO js library is that it will get rid of that annoying 'you have to click this resource first' before you can use it stuff that you see in IE .
Comment 7: I've just started using Moodle Version 1.7.1+(2006101010) and, using 'Add a Resource', 'link to a file or website', I am trying to link to some Camtasia flash files via the html file. This works without any problem in a separate 1.6 site, but when I go to play the video in 1.7, I get a message that says I need to either enable Javascript or need to upgrade Flashplayer, but I don't need to do either. Can anyone help please? Do I need to change some setting or code in 1.7 to enable this? Thanks
Comment 8: You have js on and the Flash player installed? If you are linking to the html file camtasia generates the problem would seem to be there in the html file and not be related to Moodle at all but you say that this used to work?
Comment 9: I have experienced this problem and it happened when I edited the html in FrontPage and saved the file from Design View instead of Code View.
Comment 10: Dear Sir/Madam, I am facing the same problem that you are facing i.e. when I go to play the video, I get a message that says I need to either enable Javascript or need to upgrade Flashplayer, but I don't need to do either. I am using moodle 1.8 on a shared hosting server . Did your problem was solved? If yes, then please let me know. Rgds Mahesh
Comment 11: I would recommend turning off the link to Flash file in the multimedia plugin if you think that you might have a user on your site who would be very tech savvy and have a good understanding of web technology and go to some considerable trouble to do damage to your web site. If you allow anyone to sign up to your web site or if your web site is for a college with a speciality in computer science you would have good reason to worry about having this option enabled.

Comment 15: HI All, MySelpf pawan, and i am very new to moodle. I am having similar type of problem, i want camtesia file to run moodle. please help me on this guys. Thanks in advance.
Comment 16: Forgive me for the quick response, but I think I know what the problem is. Camtasia will produce not just a single swf, but a series of swfs, one being a "container" with a srubber and preloader, and the others being avaialable to be loaded into the container. Data about the others swf's is contained in an xml file that is loaded into the container. The problem is that the url for the swf's are relative and moodle can't resolve relative links within a swf. There are two possible solutions: Camtasia can produce an older swf, which produces a single file. You can link to this fine. Publish your file as a SCORM and upload into moodle as a SCORM or IMS content package, then the links should resolve. I think there are other solutions, but they won't work with backup and restore.
Comment 17: Dear Sir, Please explain what do you mean by "publish your file as a Scorm" . What exactly i have to do? Rgds Mahesh
Comment 18: Sorry, I'm not looking at Camtasisa right now, but somewhere in the publish options (for 3.0 and above) is the option to publish as a SCORM. Have a look throught the help files or interface, it should be there.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Adaptive Quiz - release 2.5.0 (so far Moodle 4.4 and 4.5 only)
Post description: Hello community! Just taking a chance to post a quick announcement here - a new version of the  'Adaptive Quiz' plugin, 2.5.0, has just been released! Check the release notes here - https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_adaptivequiz/2.5.0/38020 The main new feature is enabling Moodle's text editor for custom attempt feedback, the user manual can be found in the plugin's wiki here - https://github.com/vtos/moodle-mod_adaptivequiz/wiki/Custom-Attempt-Feedback This has been a demanded feature for quite a long time, I'm happy this has become available now. Also, check out the placeholders feature there 😉 The plugin still supports Moodle up to version 4.5 only, the plugin is still not compatible with Moodle 5.x due to the question bank changes. However, this is exactly what the next release will focus on. Another good news is that now the plugin supports MSSQL ! The support is experimental though, it's not covered by full manual testing. But from further releases, full MS SQL support will become a plugin's feature inevitably, without the word 'experimental'. This new version doesn't bring the new custom feedback feature to Moodle 4.1 and 4.0. Please, leave your requests under this post if you're still planning to use Moodle 4.0 or 4.1, but would like to have this new feature, and it will be considered for further releases. Thank you for using the plugin and helping to make it better, happy Moodle-ing!

Post title: New activity: Wavefront Renderer - a 3D model viewer
Post description: Hi everyone, I'm pleased to announce the release of a new 'Wavefront' 3D model viewer plugin. This allows teachers and students to upload .OBJ (Wavefront) 3D models to Moodle. Students can: manipulate the model on screen add comments The plugin is available to download from the Moodle plugins Directory here: https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_wavefront The plugin ships with two example models (a human skeleton and a Greek vase). Some teaching examples - view and comment on models before they are 3D-printed familiarisation with complex machinery exploring anatomy games development ... and I'm sure there are many others I haven't thought of. Please feel free to let me know of any bugs/issues/improvements - preferably via the bug tracker here: https://github.com/iandavidwild/moodle-mod_wavefront/issues Thanks, Ian.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Plenary meeting activity
Post description: I have been working on a new Moodle activity module to facilitate meetings in person and online. The activity is meant to encourage the use of parliamentary procedure to provide an organized meeting experience and to facilitate record keeping. Users can submit motions and vote on them with actions recorded. After the meeting, the records can be used to generate minutes or be assessed for grades or other feedback provided. For online meeting, that activity may be used with included optional conferencing integrations using either Jitsi meet or the system in Deft response block or with an external conferencing system alongside the activity.  The activity can be configured to adjust for different types of meetings. The code is now available at https://GitHub.com/dthies/moodle-mod_plenum . If you want to try the activity, you can create a free user account and a sample course and have a meeting with a small group at https://deftly.us .
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: From your description, this would seem to be an extremely useful plugin activity module. I would be willing to be a group member for anyone wanting to try it out.
Comment 2: This plugin is now available in the plugin database . I am currently working on an improved Jitsi Meet integration that will handle queuing like the Deft integration from https://deftly.us . This allow sites to more fully use the plugin with self hosted Jitsi servers.
Comment 3: I just released a new version which includes ungraded Jitsi meet integration. The Jitsi server is now able to queue motions on the view page in real time. An option has also been added that behaves like the Deft integration using a Jitsi Meet server as a back end to allow more complex meetings to be fully self hosted.
Comment 4: To everyone, This is a really nice to have plugin. So far I have only tested with the Deft integration on my private development server, but will try the Jitsi stuff in the next day or two. I can grant access to anyone who wants to try it out, but doesn't want to install or set it up themselves. In fact, yesterday, I was setting up a, Plenary, activity in a course and was logged in with four accounts, when I received a message from Daniel. I invited him to join me, which he kindly did using another teacher account I already had available. He talked me through the final setup steps that I needed to get audio and video working. Next thing I knew, three and a half hours had gone by. The parliamentary procedure capabilities worked just like they were supposed to but to me the best part was the Deft block that provided the audio and video capabilities. In the past, I have struggled for days to get other video plugins to work with very little success. The, Plenary plugin with Deft, just worked! All I had to do was the usual plugin installs, set a couple of options, and enable audio and video and everything just worked for hours! One of the things I used to enjoy when I was going to a brick and mortar college, was showing up for class early and talking to everyone as they came in before the class started. If you have a scheduled online class time, with this setup you can even do that! It does help to have an, Online users, block set up so that you can see if anyone is there in the course. Once they've used this setup, they would just know to go ahead and click, Join, and do some chatting while waiting for everyone else to log in. There were some other possibilities that we discussed, but my eyes are doing their usual imitation of sandpaper from too much screen time already, today, so I better quit and go pamper them.

Post title: CMS integrations: Integrations: Mambo-Moodle vs Moodle4Xoops vs pnMoodle
Post description: For forming collaborative learning communities, Moodle is it. But looking down the road a bit I'll probably want to move into content that isn't really the focus of an online learning environment: product reviews, "personals" variation, News (I mean not just announcements kind of news but a whole news section) and a few other things. Anyone have some experience using the different types of MOODLE-CMS integrations like Mambo-Moodle, Moodle4Xoops and pnMoodle? I've experimented with postnuke quite a bit and here's what I see: 1) A lot of powerful tools. Unfortunately my favorites are "dead" projects. 2) A powerful but byzantive templating system called Xanthia.  Sometimes doing the simplest thing is so complicated and involved 10 steps.  But it is very configurable ... 3) My biggest complaint is when you make a site all your menus are organized according to database and program structure rather than according to topics, so if I want to organize my links according to topics both for users and search engines I have to do everything manually anyway.  So if I want my "Basketweaving 101" course to have a basketweaving-topical menu (like basketweaving-books, basektweaving-news, basketweaving-product reviews, basketweaving matchmakers)  This is very difficult to do in pn (pnmoodle). How about Mambo-Moodle and Moodle4Xoops? How well do they they integrate with Moodle and a topic-oriented or group-oriented site? How easy is it to customize their templates assuming you know just html and css ?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I've tried pnMoodle, Moodle4Xoops (which would be my preferred choice as Xoops is quite decent) and Mambo-Moodle, and all i can say is a big teachers "Must try harder!" Moodle4Xoops - Still using Moodle 1.4 to integrade into Xoops, with a continual promise for a 1.5 version, but well its not there today... Mambo-Moodle - Maybe its the way my brain works, but Mambo is the most about faced system to get working, and this integration oesn't integrate as when you link to the Mambo MySQL database it won't log you in.. pnMoodle - I've literally just downloaded postnuke, and this module but it won't work with v1.5 or 1.6 of Moodle ONLY 1.4 again.. If its that hard to integrade simply a php app like modle into a content management system, then sorry its the content management system which sucks and not the php app.. the way i see it, its wonderful that you have all these "wraps" and the like, and bespoke options, but the realworld would like to use and integrate thier existing setup and working apps into your CMS... Post title: New enrolment plugin: enrol_openlml
Post description: Hallo, I'm a teacher at Gymnasium Himmelsthür in Germany and we use the in Germany famous Open Linux Musterlösung ( http://www.linuxmuster.net ) school server . The module enrol_openlml provides some usage enhancements in conjunction with this server and Moodle from 2.0 on upwards. Classes and projects from the server become global groups in Moodle. For each teacher a course category is autocreated / autoremoved. The teacher is course creator in this category. Courses can be enrolled automatically by providing their global group names, e.g. 7a in field course->idnumber. I hope this plugin to be useful. Frank Schütte

Comment 1: Just found the answer by hunting: 1. Go to the course where you want the MRBS instance to occur (could be the Front page or not, as required). 2. Turn editing on. 3. From the  'Add a block' block, select ' Resource scheduling ' (note the unannounced name change from 'MRBS' to 'Resource scheduling' sic.) 4. A new block will appear from wherence MRBS (sorry, 'Resource scheduling'), can be accessed.

Post title: Custom menu using filter codes
Post description: Hi, I have installed filter_filtercodes plugin for custom menu.My moodle version is 8.3 and I am using adaptable theme v3.3. I have installed and enabled this plugin filer for content and heading. I tried to do custom menu using  {ifadmin}Menu Name{/ifadmin} ,menu is displaying with tags and visible to everyone not only for admin. So my filter code is not working. Kindly help where I went wrong here.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Aathithya, In order to make FilterCodes work in in the custom menu, you will either need to patch the theme or Moodle. Instructions for patching most themes based on Boost since Moodle 3.2 can be found at: https://github.com/michael-milette/moodle-filter_filtercodes/blob/master/README.md#for-themes-based-on-boost-moodle-32-and-later To patch Moodle 3.8, use Git to cherry-pick the following patch: https://github.com/michael-milette/moodle/tree/MDL-63219-M38 If you want to see support for filters like FilterCodes integrated into Moodle's custom menu, please show your support by voting for the following issue:
Comment 2: Hi Michael, Thankyou so much for your reply. After applying patch, plugin works like a charm. Thanks again for the wonderful plugin.
Comment 3: Hello Michael, We have just installed your filter as it was recommended by the developers for Monitoring of Learning Plans- "For the block, I think you could use a simple HTML block and the filter codes plugin ( https://moodle.org/plugins/filter_filtercodes ) ..." I created a HTML block and added the links to the two reports for the Monitoring of Learning plans - this only works for my role as admin. Now I need to add permissions for a custom role based on the Moodle - Manager role to allow this role permissions to view the reports. Adding the customer role in the permissions did not work as expected. I think the {ifcustomrole roleshortname}{/ifcustomrole} should be exactly what I need - but I am ensure how to add in the reports URLs to the filter statement? Should the statement placed in the HTML block be something like? [{ifcustomrole Grader}{/ifcustomrole} {http...... URL ] Kind Regards, Shirley
Comment 4: Shirley, You enclose or nest it inside like with html codes, so: {ifcustomrole Grader}You are a Grader!{/ifcustomrole}{ifnotcustomrole Grader}You are not a Grader{/ifnotcustomrole}.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Teach OOHOO to read Spanish text
Post description: I'm running Moodle 2.6 and using the OOHOO plugin v1.0.6 to provide a text-to-speech player on my lesson pages. We're adding a course that's in Spanish, but by default OOHOO pronounces everything as if it were English. It uses Google or Microsoft for its translation engine, so I'm pretty sure it's possible to have it read other languages, but I haven't been able to find any documentation. Does anyone know how to to proceed on this?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Michael, I would really like to know how you get OOHOO TTS to do anything but sit there with a spinning loading indicator for admin or teacher, and just not do anything for a student. Anyway, there is some documentation in, yourmoodle/blocks/tts/app/_scripts/documentation/,  - there are some files there that might help. I did not see anything of much use there, but if you look in, yourmoodle/blocks/tts/settings_base.php, there appears to be code there for a switch/case setup that is set for only English and French. Seems to me that if you add Spanish, or change the French to Spanish, you might get it to work the way you want it to.
Comment 2: Hey, that worked! It seems like forcing the language for a course somehow kills OOHOO, but setting a language on the user level does it. Thanks for the suggestion.

Post title: This forum post has been removed
Post description: The content of this forum post has been removed and can no longer be accessed.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Our school is researching lecture capture options and Tegrity came up.  If it couldn't integrate with Moodle, however, it would likely be a deal breaker.  The idea of cloud-based video is very appealing, but since it is essentially a part of the students' courses, it should be a part of Moodle to provide the msot seamless experience possible. Ideas???
Comment 2: Hi Lisa- Quick Note: Tegrity does integrate smoothly with Moodle. Using an overall integration technology called AAIRS ("Automatic Authorization, Integration and Real-Time Synchronization"), McGraw-Hill offers real-time integration between Tegrity and Moodle (and many other LMSes) at no cost. Through the use of a Moodle Block and a drag-and-drop configured connector within Tegrity, AAIRS enables single-sign on access to Tegrity for students and faculty. The real-time connection between Tegrity and Moodle ensures that user, role, course and enrollment data are always up to date, so there's no need to manually enter users or courses, or schedule recordings at the start of each semester. Let me know if I can answer any questions for you.
Comment 3: Where can I find more information about this block so we can test it?  I can't seem to find it in the plug ins database . Thanks
Comment 4: Hi Susan, This page might be helpful: https://help.tegrity.com/how-to-install-the-moodle-2-x-block-for-tegrity.html Best,

Post title: eMail block add-on: Email module
Post description: I have downloaded and installed email module in my moodle and it works just fine. However there is one problem, users are able to send mail internally to other users but when they tried to send it exernally say Hotmail, it seems Moodle doesn't allow that. Is there any way like tweaking of codes or installing another third party module that can solve this problem of mine?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: We installed the Email module and found it too clunky and restrictive (such as not being able to send to external addresses as you mention). Eventually we went for Google Apps which of course has a whole host of other functions as well as state of the art email. With SSO users don’t have to log in to email and there is a plug-in so the inbox shows at the side of the user's Moodle page. Also included is Postini that allows you (assuming you are in a school or similar institute) to quarantine mail with foul language etc. It is quite tricky to set-up, but on the other hand it is free and a very good piece of software. Have a look around the forum as a lot of installation information has been posted. Regards Dominic Bond
Comment 2: Hi, I'm just moving this discussion to the contributed code forum in Using Moodle...

Forum Post: 
Post title: Certificate Module
Post description: Hi, Does anybody know if it is possible to link a number of courses to a certificate. I have 12 courses, that contain SCORM packages and quizes. Ideally I would like a certificate to be made once all 12 courses have been completed. Is there any way of doing this?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Luke We use a rather low-tech but very effective method for issuing a Certificate after participants have completed our MoodleBites courses ( www.moodlebites.com ). There are 8 individual courses (weeks) and at the end of each week is a Quiz. If the Student scores 80% or higher the feedback they are given includes a 'secret character' (letter or number). The eight of these, when joined together, provide the enrolment key to a final course which has nothing in it but the Certificate (using the add-in Certificate module). You could do the same if using Moodle Quizzes, or potentially using SCORM objects - if they allow this feedback after reaching an appropriate score.
Comment 2: Thanks for the reply Stuart. This sounds like it could be a solution, I'll give it a go.

Post title: Checklist: how to make the boxes smaller
Post description: How can I make the green/grey boxes in the "View Progress" view smaller? Thanks, Boris
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You could try editing the '80px' on line 1765 of locallib.php, but that will mean that there isn't much space for the heading text (which is why the width is set as it is in the first place).
Comment 2: I see. Then, instead of changing locallib.php, I added:  .path-mod-checklist th {font-size:0.6em} to my theme, and everything squashes up nicely. I also tried to use {transform: rotate(-90deg)}, which would be work better for me, except that the header text remains 'wrapped' instead of appearing in a single line. Any ideas about how to 'unwrap' the header text? Just another question about the checklist - whenever I add a new activity it doesn't get picked up by the checklist block until I click on one of the participants in the block.  Is this meant to work that way? Thanks, Boris.
Comment 3: I've never used the 'transform: rotate' CSS style, so I can't help with that. The list of activities within the checklist is refreshed whenever anyone views the checklist activity. To update this whenever anyone views the course would add quite an overhead to the checklist, for something that only happens fairly infrequently. I could add an event handler to cope with this, but that's not something I'd thought about before. If you're interested, please add an issue to tracker.moodle.org and I will look at it when I get a chance (which may not be for a while).
Comment 4: Hi Davo, I didn't put an issue in moodle.tracker about the block getting auto-updated; it's pretty good as it is. However, I recently played around with the header size again and changed 80px in locallib.php as you suggested, but it doesn't seem to have any effect on the width of the header cells (I changed it to 60px, 120px, 200px... the size stays the same. And I purged the cache each time, just in case). I'm still wondering how is the header text wrapped?  I tried looking for something (like 'white-space:pre-wrap') in locallib.php and styles. css , but can't find anything.  Do you know how to 'unwrap' the text (sorry, I know I asked this already)? Thanks, Boris.
Comment 5: I'm afraid your best bet is to do exactly what I would have to do - open up the page in Chrome (or Firefox with ' Firebug ' installed), right-click on the heading and select 'Inspect element' (or 'Inspect element with firebug'). That way you can examine the styling that is being applied to each element and play around with the CSS until you get the effect you want. Once you've figured out what you need to change, you can then edit the code to generate that style for you.
Comment 6: I've done that already, but as I think I mentioned, I can't find what's causing the text to wrap.  So, that's why I'm asking you - didn't you write the code?
Comment 7: Yes, I did write the code. I wrote it several years ago and I've written many thousands of lines of code since then. I have no recollection of writing any specific code to enable text wrapping - I would assume that the wrapping is controlled by the browser's default approach to wrapping text (i.e. wrap the text in an attempt to get the entire table to fit onto the screen). However, if you want to check the CSS styles, you may find something different - I don't know, I can't remember.
Comment 8: Boris - I haven't looked at checklist at all or at its code, but if the heading is in a tbale, then my understanding is that table cells by default wrap text and there wouldn't be any code in checklist to do it - they just do The code you need is to STOP it acting as its default beahviour and you can find some hints for this with a simple websearch (Goolge: css table prevent wrapping) which brings up pages like this http://stackoverflow.com/questions/300220/how-to-prevent-text-in-a-table-cell-from-wrapping Hope that helps
Comment 9: Thanks Richard.  That helps me a lot. I was thinking that it might be something along those lines, but wasn't sure. Thanks very much for the help.
Comment 10: Davo, this question might be a little away from this forum's discussions, but I thought I would ask it here. Is it your utility, and which one, that is being used in the "Teaching with Moodle" course that is putting the progress checkboxes to the right of each item in the course? Right now, I am using your checklist utility in my moodle, and some students really like it.  But it is not as tightly integrated as I see in the "Teaching with Moodle" course.
Comment 11: No, that is the standard Moodle 'activity completion' feature: http://docs.moodle.org/en/Activity_completion

Post title: Flash module add-on: Using Camtasia (not as SCORM)
Post description: I am wondering how to upload Camtasia presentations to Moodle without creating external web pages or using ftp . I have read several threads that suggest outputing from Camtasia in SCORM format, but I am not looking for quizes, etc, just an Camtasia version of a Powerpoint lecture (especially the ExpressShow template in Camtasia). Since Camtasia requires a number of files to be uploaded for each presentation, what are my options with Moodle?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello there. I haven't used Camtasia but I suspect it is similar to other programs - put all the files into a folder, zip or compress that folder and then you can upload the zipped folder (directly into the course files of your course if you want) and, once uploaded, press the Unzip option. You then choose one file - possibly index.html or swf - I am not sure of the appropriate one with Camtasia to link to using "link to a file or website".
Comment 2: Hi Keith, You can produce video output in Camtasia that is a single MP4 file. You can play it with the Media Player plugin module: http://code.google.com/p/moodle-mplayer/ Here's a demo tutorial on my Moodle: http://matbury.com/moodle/mod/mplayer/view.php?id=636 (Login as a guest) Another option to consider is to use a screen recorder that outputs single Flash files, although there is a limit to how long they can be. Adobe Captivate 4 (high-end proprietary http://www.adobe.com/products/captivate/ ) does this but so does Camstudio (open source http://camstudio.org/ ).
Comment 3: Hello Matt, i followed all the instructions.  I added the Adobe software to make sure the MOOT was in the right place.  Yet, it looks like it will work but never does load...any suggestions. http://www.nashotahmoodle.org/mod/mplayer/view.php?id=906

Forum Post: 
Post title: Flash module add-on: Flash Animation vanishes in Moodle 2.0.2 after upgrading
Post description: After upgrading my Moodle to 2.0.2 all the embed flash animation files added via add a resources dropdown did not display at all in Firefox but produces sound. The animation displayed in other browsers but so small in size and not readable.  Can someone help pls, I need to do a demo to client. I have tried different installation on different computer, the problem is the same.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: * Check that the swf multimedia plugin is enabled. * Check that trusted content is enabled and that the role you used to add the content has trusted content permissions.
Comment 2: Hi Ademola, Where exactly are you embedding them? Is it as a link or on a course page? It sounds like the Flash files are being embedded but something's going wrong with the Flash Player window dimensions. Can you "View page source" in your browser, copy and paste it into a text editor and attach it here? That way everyone can have a look and see what Moodle's printing out. All the best, Matt
Comment 3: Hi Matt, Ademola, et al., I am experiencing the same issue: swf uploaded as a file resource produces sound output only. This occurs in Firefox; in other browsers there is no output at all. The upload was via a .zip file which was subsequently unpacked to several files (and a data directory), one of which, index.html, is set as the main file. I have not done any embedding at all. I'm not even sure if this is the correct method of displaying .swf content in Moddle 2.0 - if not, please advise. I verified that the swf multimedia plugin is enabled and that the user who uploaded had trusted content enabled. I've attached a zupped .txt file of the source of the page playing the sound only. Thanks in advance for your time, Dave
Comment 4: Hi again, I've figured this out for myself and am posting the fix for anyone else running into this problem. The process I described before is fine for grouped .swf content (eg. from Adobe Breeze: some .js files, an .swf viewer, a manifest . xml , and some data): Add Resource -> File -> Upload a zip file of the folder contents -> Unzip once uploaded -> Set index.html as 'Main file'. For this to display correctly, under Options, Display cannot be set to 'Automatic' or 'Embed'. If you specify 'Open' of 'In Pop-up', the content should display correctly. Regards, Dave
Comment 5: Thank you very much. I have this working embeded.  Not sure what I have different settings wise, but it is working. Thank you, Sean

Post title: Hide Available Courses
Post description: With Moodle you can have the system show only enrolled courses for a user, but only if the user is enrolled in a courses.  Otherwise it shows all available courses.  Our institution does not want to show all available courses and instead wants to display something like "You are not enrolled in any courses". So, with a few hacks to the theme CSS and some of the PHP in Moodle I was able to accomplish that.  I don't like the idea of it just being a hack and something that I will have to do again in each upgrade.  I'm still new to Moodle so I need some time to catch up to the structure and code setup in the project so I have submitted the idea, with code snippets of what I did, to the tracker.  If you are interested in having an option like this as an administration option please vote for it, comment, or offer some code help.  Thanks https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-43692

Forum Post: 
Post title: Flash module add-on: Link to media file without playing?
Post description: I have Multimedia filters enabled on our site but every now and then want to link to a media file for students to download as a file (not autoplay in Flash Player). Do I need to have these files in a directory which is displayed for students or is there another way? - e.g., so when students right-click a hyperlink they are given the option to "Save Target As". So far I have just been putting the files in a directory.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Tim, the usual way to handle downloadable resources is to put them in a zipped compressed folder. This will automatically trigger a download dialogue: #1 Highlight the file(s) you want to zip #2 Right mouse-click on the file(s) #3 Select "Send To" > Compressed (zipped) folder
Comment 2: Ah thanks - that makes lots of sense - and sounds pretty obvious too now I think about it!
Comment 3: I guess one thing worth considering is that most users will download a file and then view it immediately. Perhaps the best way to work out what the most desirable method of deployment is, is to offer both simultaneously, i.e. view on-line and download. Here's a good example: http://gotoandlearn.com An analysis if students' activity on the course, i.e. % downloaded vs. % viewed on-line, would give a pretty good idea of what's the most popular.
Comment 4: Yes that's what I want to do, although I don't expect mine will look as flash as that! I can only do what I can do within Moodle as if a basic user. I think I'll just expect more out of my students (and staff) and expect them to be able to uncompress a zip file. It should be a basic skill really. The files I would want to do this with are ones students may want to view or listen to many times, for example when analysing a short clip for multiple film techniques. If they need to answer 4 or 5 questions about it they will need to watch it a few times. I liked your Demo course too - might email you off-forum about it.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Utilisation of Simple Navigation Module
Post description: We are currently running Moodle 1.9 and we've installed the Simple Navigation module for use with one of our courses. Is there anyone who can tell me how to activate this module in a specific course as the navigation layout is still the same after the installation? I'm new to the Moodle environment, so I'm still learning how to implement and utilise the various modules so any help will be greatly appreciated.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: So long as the install was succesfull, you should be able to add the Simple Navigation block to a course as follows: Navigate to the course home page that you want to add the block to. Enter editing mode by clicking the 'Turn editing on' button . Look for the 'Blocks' menu at the bottom of the right hand column. Click on this menu and select 'Simple Navigation' from the list. The block will be added to the bottom of the right hand column by default. You can move it by clicking on the arrow icons under the header of the block. Hope this helps, Marty P.S. If you want to add this block to all courses by default you can add it as a 'sticky block' . On your main Moodle homepage, go to Site Administration > Modules > Blocks > Sticky blocks . Select 'Course page' from the drop down menu that appears. Add the Simple Navigation block to this page in the position you want it to appear on each course home page.
Comment 2: I've tried that, but I am not finding the "Simple Navigation" option on the menu. I'm guessing that either the install wasn't done correctly or the block isn't working properly on the 1.9 version? These are the steps that we took to install: Block installation To install a contributed block: 1. Download the zip file and unzip it to your moodle/block directory. Visit your admin page http://your_moodle_address/admin/index.php to complete the installation Any suggestions? Thanks for the hint on applying the block to all courses.
Comment 3: Ah, yeah it look like this block needs updating for Moodle 1.9. This is why you can't get it working. If a blcok isn't appearing on /admin/blocks.php then you know there's a problem. If I have time this weekend I'll try and fix it for you and post an updated version. Marty
Comment 4: I got it to work - there was a bit of an issue with the installation, but we managed to sort it out. Thanks!

Post title: Moodle based e-commerce platform
Post description: I’m really excited to have a public demo of my Moodle based e-commerce platform: https://examplesite.opensourcelearning.co.uk/local/commerce/browseproducts.php The test credit card details are: Card number: 4242 4242 4242 4242 All other fields you can set to anything and it should work. There are a bunch of products on the site showing all the capabilities: quiz attempts seminar registration (with spaces held during transactions and released on time out etc.) course enrolments premium topic/activity access Buying vouchers for team members to redeem (click buy for others on the catalog page, then look in ‘vouchers’ for the codes to share with your team) The only one not set up is the whole site subscription as this would get in the way of people meeting the platform. I’m hoping you can see how this goes a long way beyond any other LMS integrated commerce platform (certainly any that I’ve seen to date). I’ve got clients using various bits of this but it’s the first time I’ve brought it together as a coherent product so I’m really keen to get feedback from as many people as possible.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Hub or something else
Post description: Hello everyone, I have a question. I have a Moodle 3.4 version and I would like courses that I have there upload on some other web application which is actually something like some repo with all kind of school material. So let's say Moodle is "A" and that other web repo with education materials is "B". So some teacher wants that material from "A" is published on "B". Is it possible with HUB server ? I do have on development Moodle server installed hub, but it was installed by my college who was working on Moodle before me, and I can't find anywhere how to register that other site "B" which is not Moodle but some custom web application(repo), that should accept materials from "A" Moodle. And I see that Hub is not supported anymore after 3.4 version of Moodle. So please help, if anyone has a similar problem. Thank you.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: How about LTI ? See the documentation Publish as LTI tool Also, Moodle.net , our global sharing hub is still available if you wish to upload or share courses with the world. See
Comment 2: Well, I think we already have on Moodle.net sharing our materials. But now I need somehow on Moodle when I open some materials to have a button that will publish this material on another site which is not Moodle. Not sure if LTI is for that...
Comment 3: Hi Marijan I think you want LTI, it is a way of embedding activities and courses from one site into another. Moodle supports LTI. You probably need the non-Moodle site to also support LTI. https://docs.moodle.org/35/en/LTI_and_Moodle
Comment 4: I have two Moodle servers, A and B.  Actually, production server 2017 and production server 2018. Several times a month I download a 2017 course to my desktop and restore it to the 2018 server. It takes just a few minutes. Would that not work?  Unless your teachers do not have rights to download and restore, it should be easy. By the way, the Moodle Association of Japan is making simple Hub plugins to replace the old Hub code that ended in Moodle 3.4. That is while we wait for MoodleNet . Hopefully MoodleNet will come in a year or so.
Comment 5: Still didn't get a solution. I installed hub but I can't find anywhere how to register that from moodle I send resources to another site that is not Moodle. Please help, I really don't know what to do else. LTI currentčly can't have because we are restricted by Moodle version which is 3.4, and for 3.5 I need new Linux distribution and I can't get it because from some restrictions from system IT department. So now I only have a HUB and I want that from moodle teacher come to his course and share this course to a specific site that I want, and this sharing will go every time only to this specific site. This site is a custom site with learning materials, and implementation has to be from Moodle to that specific site. Is it possible with HUB and how? Thank you.
Comment 6: Have responded to your PM to me.   Please see response there. For others ... I used to run a HUB ... matter of fact it was (at one time) the only other public HUB displayed (TCEA).  It was mega administration.  Purpose of HUB is to allow teachers from other Moodle sites to publish a backup of their courses to a HUB.  Other teachers from other sites could then search the HUB and (depending upon settings for the entry) download a no user backup of the course to install in their moodle or sign up for the course on the server where it resides. A HUB didn't really contain courses and did require the setup of a dedicated Moodle instance. I think, from your description, you need to look again at LTI Provider.  That is built into Moodle 3.1 and you say you can't upgrade to that version.   Then run under a version where the plugin is compatible ... but know that means potential security issues ... a non-supported instance of a Moodle or the plugin itself could be the security issue/concern. Please see: https://docs.moodle.org/22/en/LTI_Provider https://moodle.org/plugins/local_ltiprovider Also see: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=193355 I see you desire to publish to an LTI server that is NOT a moodle.   That does present some issues of compatibility. https://www.imsglobal.org/toolcompare.html It might help to know something about that other LTI server you hint at but didn't disclose. External info: https://www.imsglobal.org/learning-tools-interoperability-resources BTW ... am not an LTI expert. ;) 'spirit of sharing', Ken
Comment 7: Follow up question for you ... What does "custom site with learning materials" mean ... specifically. Why it matters ... if it's just resources (audio/video/PDF's/Docs, etc.), one could take advantage (depending upon your situation/classification) of things like Google and Google Drive.   Could get unlimited space or affordable space for many many many Gigs of resources.   This would not be LTI, but a simple link whereby control to the resource is on the Google end. Example: I do admin for a public school in Texas and charge a fee for services.   I setup a spreadsheet in my Google Drive that was really 'billing information' ... what work done and how much the ISD was to expect in fees.   Right on the ISD Moodle instance in a course for System Admins only, had two links to that sheet.   One for me where I could edit and another that was read only for the school staff.  In order to edit, one had to login to Google with the proper credentials. If your entity qualifies, could be a Google for Education domain ... which opens all sorts of possibilities. 'spirit of sharing', Ken
Comment 8: So latest update, I am sorry I am not the admin of this systems. Moodle 3.3, and this another site is Alfresco. What I need is on alfresco custom site have links for materials from Moodle, but I need that these links are uploaded from Moodle, I can't hardcoded links in alfresco or something else.
Comment 9: So these 'resources' already reside in the Alfresco you mention?   Then it sounds like you need to communicate with those that do admin systems - the Alfresco and the Moodle. 'spirit of sharing', Ken

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle 2.4 with Turnitin Direct plugin. Can't submit assignments
Post description: We are having problems get assignments to submit. Turnitin version 2012120404 I have run a Connectivity Test and it connects successfully. When anyone tries to submit assignment it comes up with the following error: You may not submit a paper to this assignment until the assignment start date. CODE: 1001 Start Date: 13 Marh 2013 Due Date: 21 March 2013 Post Date 21 March 2013 Can anyone help?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Alistair At a glance I'd say that either the timezone on your Turnitin account is incorrect or the default timezone in Moodle isn't in sync with it. If you need to have your Turntiin account timezone checked / adjusted you would need to put a ticket into the Turnitin helpdesk and one of our product specialists can take it from there. The way the plug in deals with timezones is by making sure the Moodle default timezone is in sync with the timezone of you Turnitin account. Any individual user accounts that use a different timezone to the default Moodle timezone are adjusted accordingly. The most common reason I see this error is where the timezone is not quite right and Moodle displays the start date in one timezone but Turnitin logs it in another. That can result in a discrepancy where Turnitin beleives the assignment hasn't yet started. Hope that helps.

Post title: Module install problem
Post description: I'm running moodle 1.9 on a Windows 2003/XP server , MySQL 5.0.51, PHP 5.2.5 I want to install the feedback module. I'm relatively new to being a moodle admin, but I have managed to successfully install moodle and I have several courses going for our school district. This is the first time I have attempted to install a module.  The module installation instructions at moodle.org say to " Download the zip file and unzip it to your moodle/mod directory." My moodle root seems to be in C:\Inetpub\ wwwroot . I unzipped and dropped the feedback_19 folder in there. I then logged in as admin and checked my modules and received this message: Module feedback_19: C:\Inetpub\wwwroot/mod/feedback_19/version.php was not readable. Can someone give me a hint as to what the problem might be and how I can solve it? Thanks for your help!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Unusually, the feedback module comes packaged with an optional block; read the file C:\Inetpub\wwwroot/mod/feedback_19/mod/feedback/readme.txt You need to move the content from C:\Inetpub\wwwroot/mod/feedback_19/mod into C:\Inetpub\wwwroot/mod/ and likewise everything in the folder C:\Inetpub\wwwroot/mod/feedback_19/blocks into C:\Inetpub\wwwroot/blocks then delete the folder C:\Inetpub\wwwroot/mod/feedback_19

Post title: Restriction: Teacher-Student and Student-Teacher
Post description: Hi Thank you for this plugin. I am using version 2.7 and I wish to restrict dialogue between students and teachers. I know I can set the following permission to 'Teacher' only. Receive, who can be the recipient when opening a conversation mod/dialogue:receive However this will exclude 'Teacher' from starting a dialogue with 'Students'. I know in the pre-2.5 version there was something called "Legacy Settings" in which this restriction can be properly enforced. How do I do that in version 2.7. Basically I want: the Student to see only the Teacher the Teacher to see other Teachers and Students Any help on this would be much appreciated. Best Regards Faisal
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: We are looking to accomplish this same thing on our site. If we can get this figured out, this plugin will help solve one of our big issues in one of our courses.
Comment 2: Is going to a pre-2.5 version a solution? Would it work with Moodle 2.7?
Comment 3: Dialogue capabilities is the answer. In course, "Dialogue administration" override roles capabilities Open a conversation ( mod/dialogue:open ) Receive, who can be a recipient ( mod/dialogue:receive ) 1. the Student to see only the Teacher Student ( mod/dialogue:open ), teacher( mod/dialogue:receive ) - remove other roles 2.  the Teacher to see other Teachers and Students View any ( mod/dialogue:viewany ) add Teacher role. Regards, Troy
Comment 4: Thank you for the reply. With these capabilities set: 1. the Students can only see the Teachers. 2. the Teachers can see other Teachers. However the Teachers cannot still see Students when opening a conversation. The list only displays the list of other Teachers. Should this not be the case anyway since ( mod/dialogue:receive ) is set to Teacher only? I tried this and it works according to what is described above. This still leaves the question of how the Teachers can see the Students when starting a conversation. Can you please comment on this? Best Regards Faisal
Comment 5: Is there any update on this?
Comment 6: Hi everybody, First of all, thank you Troy Williams for this great plugin, in my opinion the best choice when the task is private communication between teacher-student. This is the only way I have used this plugin since 1.9 version. Before, until 2.3 version we had the option Dialogue type to set teacher-student dialogues. Very wise option. Now this setting is gonne, I cannot imagine why, and it's said that we can get the job done by playing with role capabilities. Well it seems not so easy, as I'm having the same problem as Faisal and Austin. I think would to be very nice to have another answer on this subject, even if it's to say there's no solution and to ask us to open an issue on tracker or something. The lack of answer gives the idea that maybe there is a solution or that we are missing something on the previous posts. TIA Daniel
Comment 7: Hi, I found the bug tracker for this issue. Please vote for it : https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB-5598 TIA Daniel
Comment 8: Well, by now what I'm doing is that I restricted student from creating a new conversation and I'll ask teachers to start a conversation with everybody so that students can communicate with them answering this conversation. Not the best thing, but can't think of something better. Daniel

Forum Post: 
Post title: install plugin acess and Validation
Post description: hi i want install plugin with webserver user,when uploaded zip file on moodle and then install message show cant acess and Validation what permission directory need for install plugin?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Ehsan, It depends on your operating system. On Linux for example, you and your web server need read (r) and write (w) permissions to the files and directories in order to install or delete a plugin. To just use the plugin, your web server just needs read permissions. Some people think that you also need the execute (x) permissions on PHP files however this is not required. PHP files are not executed by the operating system. They read and interpreted by PHP. Therefore, only read permissions are required. However, you do need execute (x) permissions on the directory in order to be able to delete files and directories (i.e. uninstall plugins). These permissions can be configured using ownership (o) or group (g) membership (recommended). You could also do it using other (o) but this is not recommended for security reasons. As for which directory, that depends on the type of plugin you are installing. For example, a module will be installed in /mod, a filter in /filters, a block in /blocks, an enrolment plugin in /enrol, a report in /report, etc.. Unlike some applications like Drupal, there is no separate directory for plugins that you add to Moodle. If you are running your server on Windows, things are similar but a little different. If this is your case, let us know or consult the documentation for your particular platform. Hope you find this helpful.
Comment 2: Small correction to my previous post. Moodle filters are located under /filter (no "s" at the end).

Forum Post: 
Post title: Payment
Post description: I want to start a course in moodle and I'm going to finance it with ads. I also want teachers/students to be able to pay and get rid of the ads. If a teacher pays for the course then all his/hers students shouldn't see the ads either. Is this possible in Moodle? I'm also using Joomla if it's easier to handle this issue in Joomla.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: It is possible in Moodle, but you probably won't make much money from ads, and it is hard to sell courses unless people have a very good reason for enrolling. This is additionally true in a world where free Moocs from well known Universities are widely available.  The main argument against using Joomla is that it was not specifically designed for education purposes.
Comment 2: Thanks for your reply and advice! I've done a market research and people are willing to pay for the course I'm going to offer. My idea for Joomla is to integrate Moodle through Jomdle if it was easier. How do I solve this, is there a plugin for this?
Comment 3: The Joomdle plugin installs on both sides and is a really nice way to integrate both Joomla and Moodle.  You can then also integrate a shopping cart on the Joomla side and sell your Moodle courses.  Joomdle works with Hikashop for one and maybe others (check the documentation).
Comment 4: Thanks a lot! If there is a way to do it in moodle it would be a lot easier, any ideas?
Comment 5: Well, there is a paypal plugin for Moodle, but one thing you may want to look at - depending on how you take the payment, is to show/hide the adverts using roles/capabilities. Most users access your site and your course with one role which has the capability to see the block containing the adverts, once the pay (or their teacher pays) the role gets changed to a very similar one, but without the viewthisblock capability.
Comment 6: Exactly, is there a way to change the roles automatic or do I have to do it manual?
Comment 7: "Thanks for your reply and advice! I've done a market research and people are willing to pay for the course I'm going to offer" I have some experience in this area and it is difficult to sell courses on line, and hard to make much money from advertising. However I hope I am wrong and you are right, the different might be that you are better/more persistent at the business side of such an enterprise than I was. One tip I might offer from my experience arranging and selling face to face commercial courses is don't be afraid to charge, there seem to be many people who think that if something is expensive it must be good.
Comment 8: Marcus, what kind of courses did you offer and what kind of ads did you use? Adsense, affiliate... I also have that experience, as long as it is not to expensive!
Comment 9: It was a long time ago, and it was Java programming/certification courses. At the time I had a high Google ranking so I figured I could get the audience. In fact the terms java programmer certification still rank my page on page one of Google. Down a bit from when it ranked higher than the inventors of Java. If I was still playing that game I would be offering Android development courses. I used adsense (in fact I am the maintainer of the Moodle adsense block which I picked up from another developer though it is a long time since I did anything with it). I figure it is easier to start with a high price and come down/offer a discount than up the price later on.
Comment 10: Thanks for your feedback! So you had a lot of visitors but couldn't get enough money through ads, is that correct? Did you consider other ways to advertise?
Comment 11: I was getting good traffic, but I lacked vigour in promoting the courses. I made much more money by selling subscriptions to an exam quiz database and accompanying PDF book. I did consider other ways to advertise and my advice to you would be go with Ad-Sense as the easy way in but vigorously research alternatives. Also get familiar with Google analytics and/or piwik because much of such work is looking after traffic rather than educating. On balance I am more interested in educating. In the main two years I was selling that I could have only just bought a modest small car with all the money earned (note that there were several years in the production of the material prior to that). The key to that was probably that at the time of launch it was the only book available on that specific version of the exam and I had built a reputation as the go to person on the subject. Sufficient that real world publishers approached me to co-author books on the topic.  The books produced were better for the ego than the bank balance.
Comment 12: Thanks for your input, gave me a little bit more to think about ☺ My original question remains, is there a way to remove ads for paying customers in moodle? Otherwise I will use hikashop in Joomla as suggested earlier.
Comment 13: It depends how you were displaying the ads. There is no ad technology in core Moodle and never will be. You might be able to modify the plugin I mentioned, but that would require programming skills.
Comment 14: Thanks a lot, it seems a bit easier to use a regular payments stem then!
Comment 15: "Thanks for your reply and advice! I've done a market research and people are willing to pay for the course I'm going to offer" I have some experience in this area and it is difficult to sell courses on line, and hard to make much money from advertising. However I hope I am wrong and you are right, the different might be that you are better/more persistent at the business side of such an enterprise than I was. One tip I might offer from my experience arranging and selling face to face commercial courses is don't be afraid to charge, there seem to be many people who think that if something is expensive it must be good.

Post title: Oohoo language Lab iQuery problem
Post description: Hi Everyone, My system currently is Moodle 2.5.1+ (build 20130726) and red5 v0.8.0 on Centos 6.3. Php is 5.3.3 and MySql is 5.1.69. No matter which version of red5 I use (I tried 0.8, 1.0, and 1.0.2RC1) I cannot get the language lab to run. I get the greyed out interface with the message connecting to server and then the following error: Jstree is not correctly loaded! Please check with your administrator! Generally it is when you have jQuery in your theme librairy and it erase the previous include of the Jquery. Please add a condition to not include your theme jQuery for the Language Lab (Example of code condition: "if (typeof jQuery == 'undefined'){//DISPLAY THE JQUERY OF THE THEME}") Any help would be greatly appreciated, AL
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi AL, Which version of the Language Lab do you use? I released a version recently tested on Moodle 2.5 (version 2013072400), so try to update and tell me if this resolves your problem. Thanks, Nicolas
Comment 2: Hi Nicolas, Version 2013072400 is the one I am using. Just updated it yesterday and it is still giving me the same error. Right at the moment, I think my biggest problem is the red5 server itself. There are some conflicting installation guides out there and quite frankly, not having written directions for installation and setup on the red5.org site to me is a problem. Every other source of written directions, has had at least one error that I have had to try an muddle through fixing. One of the things that really bums me out is the videos about red5, none seem to be about installation. My server is running Centos 6.3 with SELinux set to enforcing. I suspect that I may have permission problems and so far, I have not found any installation guide that even mentions red5 server permission settings at all. Oh well, this is just for personal use, so I will keep plugging along between other projects. AL
Comment 3: Hi AL, Yes Red5 is really complex to setup. I only tried with Ubuntu which works pretty good if you follow our guide: http://docs.moodle.org/21/en/Moodle_Language_Lab Concerning the Javascript error: Could you try changing your theme to the standard one and creating a Language Lab with only the default blocks (Navigation, settings). Hope this will help you, Nicolas
Comment 4: I was having the same issue when I updated our Moodle to 2.5.1 and Language Lab to 3.08 Build: 2013072400. I found that going to the Administration Block -> Site Administration -> Appearance -> AJAX and Javascript and unchecking Cache Javascript resolved the issue. I had been using Moodle 2.3.1 and an earlier build of Language Lab without issue on the same server previously.
Comment 5: Hi Alex, Thanks so much for the info. That was just what I needed to be able to start the lab without it failing immediately and giving me the error noted in my first post. I still have an issue with my Red5 sever though. I can run all the sample stuff with no problems when logged in on the server. When I try to access anything from client computers, it keeps trying to run as localhost until I manually type in the IP address...then they will run. So now that I can start the lab without the error, it just sits there with the message, "Connecting to server..." Any ideas on what I need to do next? Thanks again, AL
Comment 6: Hi everyone, I finally got caught up enough to try this again yesterday. I now "sort of" have the language lab working. I have installed the latest version 3.0.9 (Build: 2013093000), but I do have a few problems. When I run the Language Lab configuration checker I get the following: Language Lab configuration checker Site is available -------------------------------------------------------------- Your Apache /PHP server is working, now checking RAP configuration... Congratulations, your RAP configuration is working! -------------------------------------------------------------- Checking the version of the RAP files... The version of the RAP files is not the one expected by the language lab. Please check you have updated the version or your RAP files. -------------------------------------------------------------- The Red5 server is not accessible or not started: Permission denied (13 ) The problem with this result is that: The RAP files are the ones included with the latest version of the lab. I have the RAP files in /var/www/RAP but also HAVE to have a copy in the .../mod/languagelab/RAP folder or I get Warning: require_once(RAP/version.php): failed to open stream: No such file or directory in /var/www/moodle25/moodle/mod/languagelab/raptest.php on line 20 Call Stack: 0.0001 634416 1. {main}() /var/www/moodle25/moodle/mod/languagelab/raptest.php:0 The Red5 server IS running and IS accessible with other stuff on my server. I have tried various permissions and haven't hit one that works, yet. When logged in as a student or teacher, I can make recordings and feedback recordings but the length is always cut to about half of the actual recording length. Anyone have any ideas on what I can do to fix this? Thanks for your help, AL
Comment 7: I had totally forgotten I had posted this question and when googling for something else, happened to run across it again yesterday. Since it might help someone else I'll post what I eventually discovered was the two problems. " The version of the RAP files is not the one expected by the language
lab. Please check you have updated the version or your RAP files." This error was due to inadvertently forgetting to include the RAP version.php file in the root html folder with the rest of the RAP files, that need to be there. The Red5 server is not accessible or not started: Permission denied (13 ). I eventually realized this was due to SELinux. With setenforce 0 the message changes to "The streaming server is running and available." With setenforce 1 you get the aforementioned error message, even though the Language Lab works just fine. Since I would rather have SELinux set to enforcing, I just ignore the error warning.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Search facility in Moodle for support guidance
Post description: Hi there My organisation has a large number of support pages on our platform designed to give guidance on how to work through a variety of courses. These have grown over time and are now large in number, making it difficult for students to find essential information. I wonder if anyone can recommend a plugin that could be a question 'repository' with a search and tag function? I've not been able to find anything comparable in Moodle but would welcome any suggestions. Ideally it would have a search box that you begin to type your query such as 'How do I upload an assignment' and all posts tagged or using the word 'assignment' would either be pulled into a display area and ranked. The aim is to remove the surrounding guidance to enable students to focus more on their studies.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: While not a natural language search, I've used both Moodle's Glossary and Database activities for this kind of purpose in the past. For simplicity, I prefer the Glossary, though the power and flexibility of the database can be useful too. Glossary has both search and browse listing feature, and entries can be tagged, though if you want an Ajax type search result that gets ranked you may be simply looking at ensuring your site has Global Search enabled, though I'm not sure if you could then restrict the results to only the support pages. The Glossary entries themselves could have a summary of the help page with a link to the full page that already exists (or could simply be the link, or if you want to invest the time, the existing pages could be transferred into the Glossary itself, I'd recommend the summary and link to existing though)

Forum Post: 
Post title: Best Virtual Classroom Plug In
Post description: I've been struggling to find a cost-effective virtual classroom solution that integrates with our partner-hosted flavor of Moodle 1.9.  Webex gets really pricey (esp when adding the 1-800 audio options), Adobe Hosted doesn't work with SSO, and their "on-premises" licensing is VERY cost-prohibitive. Elluminate (now owned by Blackboard" is really expensive. I never heard of Amvonet but it SEEMS ok (running a trial). Are there any other well-tested plug ins for other providers I should be looking at?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: big blue button seems to be another option growing in popularity: http://bigbluebutton.org/ Here's a review by a college IT staff person talking about their pilot/experience: http://www.moodlenews.com/2011/go-ahead-push-the-big-blue-button/
Comment 2: There is also WizIQ if you need a external provider.
Comment 3: we use BigBlueButton and have it seamlessly working with both Moodle and Wordpress Blogs in our K-12 district.  We really like the ease of use and look forward to the new release which will include a recording function and improved audio latency. You can run BBB on your own server or pay to have it hosted.  There are a few hosted providers that do a great job!
Comment 4: We ran Elluminate standalone for a year, planning to integrate with Moodle (but not getting around to it).  The recent purchase of Elluminate by Blackboard changed the interface and consequently all our user documentation was made redundant.  I can live with that, but the interface has also become more confusing which has caused problems for our second language learners. The most important feature was remote desktop sharing - allowing the teacher to remotely monitor what students were doing on their computers.  In our case this was monitoring (formally invigilating in fact) their progress on a Moodle Quiz.  This has become much harder and confusing now than before in the old Elluminate.  The licence cost is also a problem and we've suffered some downtime on Blackboard's servers (of course just when you're trying to run a class).  The Java application is also quite a hefty download each time. Now trialling Big Blue Button.  The interface is much cleaner and we have hosted in a RackSpace cloud server running Ubuntu integrated with Moodle 1.9.8.  Pretty straightforward once you get the hang of it and it allows for growth in capacity as you need it.  BBB looks promising for the new year.  We'll run the two side-by-side till our Blackboard product is up for licence renewal in March 2012. I reckon we'll go with BBB partly because once you get it running and integrated with Moodle you can create as many instants of it as you like.  That's right, you can create multiple classrooms for which you'd have to pay separate licences in Blackboard.  That effectively mutliplies the cost savings manyfold.  Breakout rooms doesn't appear to work in version .8 and I'm yet to test the recording function but we can live with these since I can see them on the planned development path. A tip: if you have Moodle running on a server you'll probably need to have BigBlue Button running on a separate server.  It may be technically possible to run the two together but it seems messy as they both operate on port 80 using different webservers.  This is why we went with a low-cost cloud server for our BBB.  Another reason was that the instructions given by BBB work well for Ubuntu, but would be tricky to translate to a different webhost platform.  So the cloud server method with Ubuntu pre-installed and then running (very carefully) through the installation instructions now takes me under 30 minutes.  And if I need to crank up the RAM I can easily do so to cope with higher usage needs. Best of luck! Mike Smith Brisbane, Australia

Forum Post: Post title: Page Breaks in Configurable Reports? Post description: Is it possible to have page breaks in your reports from the Configurable Reports plugin? I'd like my report to be able to print one page per user with the all of the quizzes and their scores in the currently selected course. So far what I have is the following Query (which may need some fine tuning yet to be perfectly honest): ```text SELECT c.shortname, u.id, u.firstname AS 'Firstname' , u.lastname AS 'Lastname', cc.name AS 'Category', ROUND(AVG(ROUND(gg.finalgrade / gg.rawgrademax * 100 ,2)), 2) AS Average, GROUP_CONCAT("
  • ",  gi.itemname, ": ", ROUND(gg.finalgrade / gg.rawgrademax * 100 ,2), "
    • " SEPARATOR "") AS Grades FROM prefix_course AS c JOIN prefix_context AS ctx ON c.id = ctx.instanceid JOIN prefix_role_assignments AS ra ON ra.contextid = ctx.id ``` and also I added the following custom CSS to add page breaks to the report: ```text @media all { .page-break { display : none ; } } @media print { .page-break { display : block ; page-break-before : always ; } } ``` And the following HTML at the bottom of each "page" to add the page break:
    If I click the reports tab and use the Adobe PDF printer, I'm able to generate a pdf that is pretty close to what I need for paper copies except that it does not contain the page breaks!!!  And if I try to print it out it also does not contain the page breaks. Thank you, Andrew J. Leer Comments associated with the post: Comment 1: I determined that this would work perfectly fine if the HTML5 editor or the plugin wasn't stripping out my page-break-after :always; and page-break-before :always attributes. I went into the report, and in the Firefox 45 code editor before printing to the Adobe PDF printer installed on my Windows system, I changed the style attribute of the Div surrounding each record to style="page-break-after: always; page-break-before: always; width: 100%; hieght=500px" for one record; then when I print it out the page break for that record works correctly, and only that record is printed on the page. However , if I place this style in the template when I run the report again, each of the records in the report only appear with the width and height attributes, and thus the page-break-* attributes are being filtered out somewhere by the report generator. P.S. I have also tried to use the pagination feature but it only allows me to print one record at a time. Comment 2: I figured it out, but it's a hack...so maybe it needs to be submitted as a patch... See below From c0a1130764482d85cefe9747ace514ae80704c1b Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001 From: "Andrew J. Leer" Date: Tue, 12 Apr 2016 13:09:12 -0400 Subject: [PATCH 2/2] Added Page Break Support Added .pgbrk class that will cause page breaks when printing a report to Adobe PDF printer. Simply add the .pgbrk class to a
    in your template, and when printing the report to an Adobe PDF printer, it will add page breaks to your report. --- locallib.php | 4 ++-- 1 file changed, 2 insertions(+), 2 deletions(-) diff -- git a/locallib.php b/locallib.php index 6592129..f755c04 100755 --- a/locallib.php +++ b/locallib.php @@ -32,9 +32,9 @@ tmpw = window.open(" ","Print"); tmpw.document.open(); -                tmpw.document.write(''); +                tmpw.document.write(""); tmpw.document.write(cdiv.innerHTML); -                tmpw.document.write(''); +                tmpw.document.write(""); tmpw.document.close(); tmpw.print(); tmpw.close(); -- 1.8.1.msysgit.1 Comment 3: P.S. if you're testing out a report that you intend to print on paper, use the Adobe PDF printer Label:
