Forum Post: 
Post title: AD Hoc Monthly Reports
Post description: Hi All I would like to run a monthly report and automatically email it out to a manager on the 1st of the month. I can't get the report to filter on details from the last 30 days. I've been looking at tutorials for 3 days, none of them seem to work. Versions 3.12 and 4.01
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Can you provide more information?
Comment 2: Thanks Marcus. I want to run a monthly report and send it out automatically on the 1st of the month. I'm using ad hoc database queries. I can't get it to display the last 31 days from todays date.. The code works perfect until I add the date range filters, some codes show a syntax errors as not recognised. This one shows nothing here's the code, it's the last line I cant get to work. SELECT DISTINCT u.firstname AS firstname, u.lastname AS lastname, q.name AS Quiz, ROUND(qg.grade,0) AS Grade, DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(qg.timemodified),'%d-%m-%Y') AS date
Comment 3: Hi James, Perhaps something like this (untested) might work for you (assuming MySQL or MariaDB )... : : ; AND qg.timemodified BETWEEN NOW() - INTERVAL 31 DAY AND NOW() If you want to just compare today's date but ignore hours, minutes and seconds, you can replace both instances of NOW() with CURDATE(). Hope you find this helpful. Best regards, Michael Milette
Comment 4: I suggest testing the date range filters separate from the rest of the code. Also is your database my sql because I think they are specific to MySQL. I was wrangling some dates recently on a Postgres system and it is a whole different world when it comes to dates.
Comment 5: The field qg.timemodified is in Unix Timestamp format not a date format. You will need to convert it into a date format of some kind to use most of the common MySQL date functions which expect a string formatted like a date and time as input. There's a bunch of examples how to do this over in the Ad-hoc contributed reports page including an explanation I wrote about this: https://docs.moodle.org/400/en/ad-hoc_contributed_reports#About_Date_and_Time_Formatting
Comment 6: This is where I'm at. it still returns no results. there's no errors though. AND DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(qg.timemodified),'%d-%m-%Y') BETWEEN CURDATE() - INTERVAL 31 DAY AND CURDATE() I'll have a read up on your recommended page today. Randy Thanks
Comment 7: This part CURDATE() - INTERVAL 31 DAY is not working. Instead look at using a function like DATE_SUB() or DATE_ADD() to do date arithmetic like this. https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/date-and-time-functions.html#function_date-add . Also, your date format needs to be in the proper canonical OSI order: Y-m-d as expected for the MySQL date functions. Inputting d-m-Y is legal because it is three numbers but it will not give you the math you expect ;) See all the examples in that link and how they are formatted.
Comment 8: If you search the Ad-hoc contributed reports page for DATE_SUB or DATEDIFF you will find several examples of how to do this.
Comment 9: Just going through old posts. Thanks for everyone's help. This is the code that I got working with advice from Randy and Michael. SELECT DISTINCT u.firstname AS firstname, u.lastname AS lastname, uid.data AS Manager, uid1.data AS department, q.name AS Quiz, ROUND(qg.grade,0) AS Grade, DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(qg.timemodified),'%d-%m-%Y') AS date FROM prefix_user AS u JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS uid ON uid.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS uid1 ON uid1.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_user_info_field AS uif ON uid.fieldid = uif.id JOIN prefix_quiz_grades AS qg ON u.id = qg.userid JOIN prefix_quiz AS q ON qg.quiz = q.id WHERE uid.fieldid = '1' AND uid1.fieldid = '2' AND q.name LIKE '%course name%' AND uid.data = 'managers email' AND FROM_UNIXTIME(qg.timemodified, '%Y-%m-%d') >= DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 31 DAY)

Forum Post: 
Post title: Credits - Plugin
Post description: Hello, I'm looking for a plugin that gives me the possibility to assign at each course a precise number of credits. Then, each student should have an amount of credits that can spend on my platform to take the course he wants. Is there any plugin that has been already developed that meets my requests? Thanks,
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I'm not sure how you 'credits' model works, but you can setup Enrolment methods in courses that are restricted to a set number of days from first access.  That is an easy way to control the amount of time a user has access to a course. It's also a very flexible approach, because you can have different durations for different courses, and even multiple different durations within the same course.
Comment 2: I'm sorry, but you don't seem to have understood the question. The question is not about "time" restriction, but "Credit" restriction. Credit means (usually), you have to pay for it, or Buy, credits. You then assign a simple amount of needed credit points to a course, event, seminar, etc. and people can use their credits to pay for, and enroll. It's dead simple and common sense. Myself I am looking for days now. But moodle appears to be set up for school like institutions, only, in a form of "intra-learning". In this case, the "student" would have paid already for attending that school/institution, hence, courses are included. In that way, it's not a true enterprise solution for a global market. Even schools organise "outside school" activities , events, workshops, etc., to which a student would need to apply and pay extra. But moodle doesn't seem to have ever thought about that. Am I wrong? Please educate me. I'd be more than happy to learn that I am wrong because that would only mean I can utilise moodle.
Comment 3: https://moodle.org/plugins/availability_paypal https://moodle.org/plugins/enrol_authorizedotnet https://moodle.org/plugins/enrol_bitcoin https://moodle.org/plugins/enrol_classicpay Well having been 'looking for days' perhaps you've already considered and rejected these that I found in a single search that took about 15seconds. But if so, that would be nice to know so we don't waste such huge amounts of time doing such searches for you! There are many places using Moodle with a paid gateway model, but you are quite right it is not its default model and relies on plugins and adaptations to do that. There are several around, along with the ability to adapt, tweak or even write from scratch, your own authentication/enrolment plugins. You could even use a separate pay-to-play kind of database and then use
the built in automatic external database enrolments feature to
enrol/unenrol users as required (which would be my preferred way to
achieve what you seem to want). From my knowledge there are also integrations that work with Wordpress and other systems to allow a 'course catalogue' to be advertised and course enrolments to be bought. Moodle tries hard to provide the options it needs within core for its CORE areas. Other requirements are then handled by plugins, developed by users with needs outside the core and often shared with the community, and by the nature of Moodle as Open Source software, allowing you to develop it to match your specific requirements. You may also want to check out the whole area dedicated to business uses of Moodle https://moodle.org/course/view.php?id=32 to see if anyone there shares your experiences or can offer advice for you.

Forum Post: 
Post title: How to create subsections programatically
Post description: Hi, I'm trying to use Moodle Webservice API to create submodules (Moodle 4.5). As far as I know, there's no existing function to do this, so I was trying to create one as plugin. But couldn't find any reference point to look for. As I'm not PHP dev myself, used this as reference and could add a few functions for my purpose [0], but couldn't figure out how the subsections can be managed programmatically. Put simply, I want a webservice function that can add subsections - at a given position / order, under a given section in a course. [0] What I have right now
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi tanjim, I am not sure what submodule is in your context ; however, if you mean subsections, the same webservices can manage them used in the course editor. I will summarize how they are handled in 4.5. The course in edit mode relies on three webservices to do any editing action: core_courseformat_get_state This webservice returns all the course information about the course structure. It is only a getter so you probably won't need it. core_courseformat_update_course this is the main editing webservice and it can execute a wide range of actions (some of them are common to all formats, other depends on the plugin). The main spec of this webservice is that all actions use the same params: action (string): is a name that identifies which edit action you want to do courseid (int) ids (int[]): an array containing the affected ids. An id may refer to a course module id (used for activities ) or a section id. The interpretation of the id varies based on the action taken. All actions beginning with "cm" indicate a course module, which means the id represents activity one, whereas "section" pertains to sections . targetsectionid: some actions like moving an element require a final destination id targetcmid: same as targetsectionid but for targeting a destination course module id All actions return what is called a state update, a standardized return value to indicate to the frontend how to alter the state data (the data from core_courseformat_get_state). Some of the current actions are: section: section_move_after section_add / section_delete section_shod /seciton_hide section_state (returns a section state data) course module: cm_show / cm_hide / cm_stealth cm_duplicate / cm_delete cm_move / cm_moveright / cm_moveeleft cm_nogroups / cm_visiblegroups / cm_separategroups cm_state (returns the data of a single activity) core_courseformat_create_module (will be deprecated in 5.2) Subsections are managed mainly as modules (they are activities at a dabatase level). You can use this webservice to create a subsection. Since 4.5, some plugins can be created without the creation form (for now, it is only used in subsection, but in the future, it could be more). This webservice can create those kind of activities. Params: courseid (int) modname (string) targetsectionnum (int): targetcmid (int) IMPORTANT : this webservice will be deprecated in 5.2 and replaced by a new one called core_courseformat_new_module, which will use targetsectionid instead of targetsectionnum (that will be the only change). (see MDL-83469 for more information)

Post title: Search by Lesson ?
Post description: Good Morning. I would like to know if there is any way to set the searches by lessons, because I can only search by courses. I have installed version 3.0
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Patricia, I don't really know of a way to search for a particular Lesson , unless you have something like the Ad-hoc database queries add-on installed, or even adminer. There is a way to have Moodle show you every course that has a Lesson in use. Maybe that will help. Go to Administration > Site administration > Plugins > Activity modules > Manage activities . Scan down the Activity module column. If there is any number other than zero in the Activities column, click on it. You will then see a page listing courses that have a Lesson activity in them.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Course Recompletion plugin -display remaining days to retake course
Post description: hi, i am using moodle 3.3.9 i used the recompletion plugin to reassign courses to users after a certain period of time. and i wanted to know if it is possible to display something like -" this course should be re-attempted in ** days" depending on the date the user has completed the course currently??
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello, A custom recompletion email subject may be added as plain text or Moodle-auto format, including HTML tags and multi-lang tags The following placeholders may be included in the message: Course name {$a->coursename} Link to course {$a->link} Link to user's profile page {$a->profileurl} User email {$a->email} User fullname {$a->fullname} The notification placeholders do not include a method to calculate a due date depending on the date the user's completion was reset by the Recompletion plugin.
Comment 2: is it possible to add the required functionality in the existing recompletion plugin ? or create any new plugin to achive the required result??, please suggest the ways that can be done. Shirley Gregorczyk
Comment 3: I would have no ideas about changing a plugin or developing a plugin, I do not code. My site uses a standard training grace period of 30 days. My notification is the same for all courses with an annual retraining period. Hello {$a->fullname}, The {$a->coursename} has a periodic retraining requirement which must be completed within the next thirty (30) days. 1. Complete your course review. 2. Select the link to access the quiz. 3. Select the Re-Attempt quiz button and complete the quiz. IMPORTANT The course will not be set to complete unless you re-attempt the quiz and achieve a passing grade with a current date/time stamp. Kind Regards In general, Moodle does not have the functionality to calculate due dates for most core activities . The notification for the Recomplete plug-in is very basic. You could go to the Recomplete plugin page and submit a request for the functionality. https://moodle.org/plugins/local_recompletion/
Comment 4: thanks Shirley Gregorczyk , may i know which table in the database contains information about the course recompletion??
Comment 5: there are a few tables - each begins with local_recomplete Kind Regards

Post title: Map module add-on: mod.html file - do I need this?
Post description: Great addition with thismodule! Quick question - does the module need a mod.html file for use when creating new map? If so, I cannot find it in the downloads. I thought I would have a go at trying to implement this with an older version of Moodle so maybe that is why my system is asking for this file. I understand it has not been tested on older versions of Moodle but thought I might be able to have a go at adapting it. Any suggestions? Thanks, Nikki
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Nikki, No I don't think that file is needed for Moodle 1.8 or 1.9. This is the documentation I used to start off: http://docs.moodle.org/en/Development:Modules I don't really know anything about developing for earlier versions of Moodle. Maybe someone else who reads this forum might. I think it would be great if you could adapt it. I could make it available on the plugin entry page for earlier versions. What version are you using? Thanks,
Comment 2: Ted, I am using 1.6 - we are going to update but that is not planned until some time next year when we can come up for air on all the other projects we have running! The mod.html file I believe is the file that produces the input form for the module to be added. I have a programmer who could work on adapting code to have it work for 1.6. Are you able to provide a sample of the page that produces the input form for creating the map? Alternatively, I have managed to get Google Maps in 1.6 working on its own without your code - just in a side block. What I have not been abel to figure out is how to do the following: - pick up the students locations and convert a city/state/country into a latitude & longitude - pick up the picture of the student and display it on the map Any tips on how to do this - or just a pointer to the bit of code and an explanation of what is happening here would be much appreciated! I know this would be an incredible tool for my students. We have students in 58 countries and it would really help them to feel connected. Thanks, Nikki

Post title: Filter user list
Post description: Hello, We have our custom plugin which groups users. Each group has 1 or 2 group leaders. These group leaders are also administrator so they can access user list ( Dashboard > Site Administration > Users > Accounts > Browse list of users) What we want is if a group leader accesses Moodle's user list, he can only see the users in his group. I have looked for a way to do this. As I've found out, Moodle has "user_filtering" property in session, it is used in user list, please see user/filters/lib.php. I want to modify this property to add an extra SQL query to filter users. What I need to do now is modifying "user_filtering" before admin/user.php is called, this is where user_filtering is initialized and user list is rendered. However, I can't find any plugin type which can do this. I really appreciate if you have any suggestions to achieve this. In the worst case, we will need to hide Moodle's user list from administrators and create our own one.

Post title: Exercise module add-on: grade average and maximum
Post description: Hallo, this is a dev question: I'm trying to add some sum functionality to exercise module grading scheme. I've managed to create and option to use not only average and maximum, in case multiple submissions are made, but also one that makes a sum of the marks given. However, there's a bit of a problem: instead of summing the grades, there is still something (a function or a hardcoded value) that makes an average of the submitted grades. These are the conditions and functions that seemed to be responsible for using the max. score (and it's similar to those for counting an average): In lib.php: if ($exercisemod->usemaximum) {} and the rest (had to be changed to: if ($exercisemod->usemaximum == 1) {} because the option I've added is called is option no. 2, and is written to the db as such) function exercisemod_get_mean_submission_grades($exercisemod) I've modified the loop in order to accept option 2 (elseif ($exercisemod->usemaximum == 2) ... ) and made a function that does exactly what function exercisemod_get_mean_submission_grades($exercisemod) does, but it's called function exercisemod_get_add_submission_grades($exercisemod) and it should sum grades (via the SUM() fuction) instead of counting an average of them. Now the point of the post: even when option no. 2 is selected when setting up the exercise, instead of a sum being made, there's still something that makes an average of the marks. The Question: Does anyone know if there's another function like this one that counts the average? The only one I have found is in locallib.php, however, it doesn't seem it is used anywhere (I couldn't see it being called in any of the other scripts). Pointing me to a php file that uses it would be useful as well.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: It seems that I've somehow misunderstood the conception of Grading strategy. The usemax.html states: Handling of Multiple Submissions This option determines how the exercise should calculate the
final grades of the students. When there are multiple submissions
the teacher can chose between either using the best grade or the
mean grade from each students' set of submissions. This option
can be changed at any time during the exercise. Any change has an
immediate effect in the Grades page (provided, of course, multiple
submissions are present). I've presumed that this was valid for submissions in case you have more elements in your exercise. However, after translating the moreinfo.html file (the last one), it is now clear that it's only for resubmitted pieces of work that have been reassessed by a teacher. That puts me back to the starting point. So the question now is: Which functions in which file are responsible for calculating the average grade of graded elements when using accumulative grading strategy? I have searched through the source code of the exerice module without any success in finding the piece of code. Moreover, none of the settings in the exercise setup form seem to change this behavior of calculating an average grade of grades of elements to, say, a maximum or something else. Any help on this would be greatly appreciated. Thank You for Your time.

Post description: Hello I'm just istalled moodle at 100%, but i still have some troubles El módulo "exercise" (2004091700) no se puede instalar debido a que requiere una versión más reciente de Moodle (esta versión es la 2004083101, y el módulo requiere la 2004091700). Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Manuel, Yes, the latest version of the Exercise module does require a very recent version of Moodle. The way the student work is submitted has changed very recently. It can now be checked with CLAM anti-virus software. The Exercise module uses that  new mechcanism, thus the reason why it wouldn't install. I'm afraid to use the latest version of exercise you will also have to take the 1.5 dev version of Moodle (something which is not advised if your site is a production site).

Forum Post: 
Post title: User Tours - Issue with Dashboard/Teacher Role
Post description: I've created a User Tour for the Dashboard page `/my/%` and set the tour filter role to teacher (all other filters are set to "all"). When logged in as a teacher, the Dashboard tour does not display and the tour link at the bottom of the page is not present. If the tour filter role is changed to administrator, then the tour does display properly when logged in as an administrator. The Dashboard page is the only page which seems to have this issue. Tours setup for other pages with the filter role set to teacher operate just fine when logged in as a teacher. I'm wondering if this might be a bug with User Tours. Has anybody else experienced this issue? (Running Moodle 3.4+, Build 20171228, User Tours included with Moodle package)
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello. I suspect it is not a bug but the fact that the dashboard is not dependent on a role, so Moodle doesn't know that a person is a teacher or student when the dashboard page is displayed. You could probably get around it by creating a new custom role (eg Dashboard teacher) and giving that role  in the system context to all your teachers and then setting the tour on the dashboard to display for 'Dashboard' teachers... it depends on how important you feel it is that teachers should have their own user tour different from students.
Comment 2: Thank you Mary for your insight into this issue. Your assessment of the issue makes perfect sense and you've provided a good solution.

Post title: Dialogue update for Moodle v1.9
Post description: Greetings all. The University of Waikato in New Zealand recently contracted Catalyst to do some work on the Dialogue module which we'd like to contribute back to the community. I've attached an outline of the changes we've had made to the module to bring it in line with v1.9, highlighting some changes we've made to it to suit our particular use of it. Have a look at the attached document and please provide any feedback in this forum. We're particularly interested in whether the changes we've made are different enough that the community feels this should be a separate module. Many of the changes are around roles/capability-support, and general v1.9 conformance so it shouldn't be a problem hopefully. Please contact me directly if you'd like a copy of the code to test in your own environment. We are currently using the changes on our production Moodle platform but would encourage you to test it locally first. After some testing and approval from the community then I guess If the next step will be for us (or someone with CVS commit access) to add this to the main Contrib CVS repository for the Dialogue module. look FWD to hearing from you,
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Sure thing - please post the mods and I'll be happy to test/comment/help. I'll deal with the cvs too. It's probably best to zip this up and attach here so the maximum number of people can try it??
Comment 2: Howard - Actually what I am trying to encourage as the best thing, is to create an issue in the tracker requesting to add the code to CVS, applying for CVS access, and adding a Modules and Plugins entry. A more detailed description is available at: http://docs.moodle.org/en/Development:Guidelines_for_contributed_code As much as possible I would like to avoid having zip files in the forums because it is hard to determine which one is the latest. By using Modules and Plugins we can link to the auto-generated zip file and assure that folks are getting the latest code from CVS. Please do not hesitate to let me know if there are any questions. Peace - Anthony
Comment 3: New tracker item has been created, and code attached to it... http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB-412
Comment 4: Hi Dean I found a little bug in the new version of Dialogue (downloaded and patched with the code found on Issue Tracker) Some generated SQL code is incompatible with Postgres (and also MsSQL and Oracle AFAIK ) Lines 462 to 475 of dialogue/lib.php should be changed to: -------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<------- return get_records_sql("SELECT l.time, l.url, u.firstname, u.lastname, e.dialogueid, d.name, c.subject, l.userid FROM {$CFG->prefix}log l, {$CFG->prefix}dialogue d, {$CFG->prefix}dialogue_conversations c, {$CFG->prefix}dialogue_entries e, {$CFG->prefix}user u WHERE l.time > $timestart AND l.course = $course->id AND l.module = 'dialogue' AND l.action = 'add entry' AND e.id = " . sql_cast_char2int('l.info') . " AND c.id = e.conversationid AND (c.userid = $USER->id or c.recipientid = $USER->id) AND d.id = e.dialogueid AND u.id = e.userid AND e.userid <> $USER->id"); -------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<-------8<------- (I've just posted this patch on Issue Tracker too

Post title: Manually Modifying Certificate Issue Dates
Post description: Hello, We have a use case where we are migrating users with existing course progress in a separate LMS into our new Moodle system, and our course includes multiple certificates which are rewarded upon passing quizzes. We will be marking older users as complete for those items in our new system so they may continue where they left off, and we want their Moodle certificates to display the original issue dates they had in the older system. For example, if we were to mark a user complete for our course today (Jan 7, 2025) which unlocks their certificate, we'd like to be able to manually change the issue date to their older completion date. We've explored the mod_coursecertificate and tool_certificate plugins from Moodle Workplace as well as mod_customcert but haven't found such a feature. Can someone recommend a certificate plugin which can do this? Thank you in advance.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I think the easiest/fastest way would be to manually update required records directly in DB after migration. This code can potentially give you a clue about DB tables and fields for each certificate type https://github.com/dmitriim/moodle-block_verify_certs/tree/MOODLE_404_STABLE/classes/local/block_verify_certs/certificates

Forum Post: 
Post title: course enrollment date_on certificate
Post description: Hello! can anybody help me? In open courses, where the student can enroll at any time, how do I get the certificate to capture the student enrollment date in the course. Students need the period of completion of the course to be expressed in the certificate. The problem is: how to configure the certificate in order to capture the variable 'course enrollment date'. It is possible? Thanks
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Cleide, If you have the FilterCodes plugin installed, you can use the {courseenrolmentdate} tag to insert the student's enrolment date in the certificate. If you prefer a different date/time format, you can optionally specifyone in the tag. For more information, see the README.md file included with the plugin. Although FilterCodes is available in Moodle.org's plugin repository at https://moodle.org/plugins/filter_filtercodes , please note that this {courseenrolmentdate} tag is new and currently only included in the latest release candidate version available at https://github.com/michael-milette/moodle-filter_filtercodes . Hope you find this useful. Best regards, Michael Milette
Comment 2: Hi Michael! Thank you very much!

Forum Post: 
Post title: Flash module add-on: Saving Flash Files
Post description: Hi, I'm not a programmer so this may seem like a simple question to some, for for some reason it has me stumped.  I've built a Flash video that I'm using in a course.  Not truly integrated because we don't need to grade courses.  (Commercial site)  What I have been doing to show the Flash is to simply adding it as a Resource and letting them click on it to play.  Most of my Flash are just under 16,000 frames, so they are large files for Flash.  Although most of the time they play just fine, my users want to be able to download the file for future reviewing (they paid for the course). So far the only way I can figure out how to do this is to add a projecter to my file but that significantly increases the size and changes it to a .exe file which I would prefer not to do. So how do I set it up so that they can download the actual Flash file if they want to do so?  Am I just missing a setting?  When you right click, I'm only able to Save  Target which is html. I use a 3rd party program called Flair to build my Flash videos.  I use video a lot and prefer it over .wmv because of size and also options.  I can make it interactive.  I'm running Moodle 1.8+ Thanks, LC
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi LC, In most newish browsers, if you provide a link to the .swf, the user can then "save file as" and use a newish browser or stand-alone .swf player to view. Do your .swf files depend on external AS or .flv files, or can they "stand alone"? If Flair uses Flash Com/Media Server or RED5 for video, it may be another story. Tom Cox
Comment 2: For downloadable resources it's generally best practice to put the files in a zipped compressed directory. When a user clicks on that it will automatically trigger a download. "Most of my Flash are just under 16,000 frames, so they are large files for Flash." Judging by this, you've embedded the actual frames of the video into the SWF. This increases the overall file size dramatically and can cause problems with the audio-video synchronisation. You'll get a smaller file size and better playback (the video stream will use less bandwidth) if you use the standard FLVPlayback component in the Flash IDE or a ready made FLV player. You can download ready made FLV players for free from various sites. I don't recommend using .exe files as they present a security risk and a lot of firewalls block them automatically.
Comment 3: I use a program called Flair.  I've never had problems with audio-video synchronisation.  I can import most any type of video file or even Powerpoint, work with it and then export it back out as either a swf or flv and decrease the file size significantly.  (Or I build the project right within the program)  I also have players that I can use with it.  But I think with keeping it in a folder will solve my problem for those using IE. I agree about the .exe file though. I prefer not to use it.  And my users are fairly unsophisticated and would creat a tech support nightmare if I zipped the file.  I'm trying to keep it as simple as possible. Thx LC
Comment 4: Hello Lee, I am trying to add a video file which is in macromedia flash player 7.You said you use a program called Flair.So how is it going with you?
Comment 5: It's still going well for me.  I have instructors who send me their material normally in .avi format or .ppt.   I convert them to flash and usually add a few things via Flair.  I also add their audio which is sent separately.  I've had no problems using this in Moodle.  But my quizes etc are also separate, if even used.  This is a commercial environment so grades aren't used. (yet). Lee
Comment 6: I have just started to play with Captivate for tutorials, but want to put the tutorial into moodle rather than have it as downloadable files. The problem is that when it is rendered, it creates several fash files - the main one and then individuals for each motion shot. Any ideas how to get this in to a web page in moodle to just play it, or am I asking the impossible ?
Comment 7: Hi Richard, No, what you're asking isn't impossible. The easiest and simplest solution is to treat your published Captivate package as an external resource. Upload the entire folder that Captivate publishes, which should contain a number of SWF files, an HTML web page and a short Javascript file that handles the SWF embedding. Put a link to an external resource on your Moodle course page. There are other ways of doing it but if it's just a "show and tell" type presentation without any questions or user feedback, then this technique is perfectly adequate. If you want to keep track of who's watched it, then just put the link to the tutorial on a lesson page. You could also include it in a quiz module with some cloze questions... use your imagination! Please note: If you try to embed the SWF directly in a Moodle page, it most probably won't work because the paths to the other SWFs will be different.

Forum Post: 
Post title: NBC Learn Plugin and Privacy... or Lack thereof
Post description: It appears that NBC Learn has created a plugin to allow students and faculty to embed content from the NBC Universal archives within a moodle course. I believe this is possible without the plugin via copy and paste, but the Moodle plugin obviously places the NBC archive in front of a larger audience. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NBCUniversal_Archives My question is whether or not anyone has implemented the nbclearn plugin and if so, how well has it been received and have concern's over user privacy been addressed? http://nbclearn.com/tools/ From a look at the code it appears that the plugin is mainly an extension for TinyMCE, the built-in text editor. The extension creates an icon within the text editor, that when clicked makes a call to NBC urls to retrieve content. I help run a Moodle instance at a Large North American Public University. And, given that NBC is owned by Comcast,  connecting our most highly utilized web application to this large commercial interest is inherently alarming. A trip through the plugin's code gives me the impression that anyone who clicks on the NBC logo within Moodle's TinyMCE text editor will have his or her Personal Information sent to NBC.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Michael, Thank you for the comments about the NBC Learn plugin for Moodle.    I work for the NBC Learn team and noticed your comments/questions about the plugin.   I'll try to address them here.   Otherwise, please feel free to email me directly at michael.levin@nbclearn.com. The LTI plugin for Moodle was developed based on the demand from the hundreds of K-12 and Higher Ed institutions.   We currently offer a similar plugin for Blackboard, Canvas, Desire2Learn, and OLE.    This plugin is free to install and trial for 30 days.   However, only subscribing institutions can unlock the more than 17,000 multimedia resources for teaching and learning. I would be delighted to put you in touch with any of the campuses currently using the Moodle or LTI plugin to share their feedback relative to the functionality and our protection of user information. This video describes the plugin functionality in regards to how faculty can easily embed our resources into Moodle or provide an external tool link for students to access the resources: While the plugin does collect user details, it does so for (2) reasons. A)  To allow a personalized experience including embedding resources into your course and a playlist feature (under development). B)  To provide utilization metrics back to the institution administrators.   We offer monthly usage stats so that the institution can measure utilization and the value of their investment. NBC Learn does not share personal information with any 3rd parties organizations or advertisers.   This information is made clear in the subscription license agreement signed by each institution. We absolutely welcome any feedback regarding the plugin and I would encourage to email me or submit a comment at the footer of our website. Regards, Michael Levin NBC Learn www.nbclearn.com
Comment 2: Thanks for the information Michael.  I do appreciate the quick response. I was not able to find privacy  information online or in the plugin's documentation, but thank you for clarifying.  I would have liked to see this information posted up-front, rather than having to investigate the code to find out. Based on the type of information the plugin sends (first name, last name, email address, and course name), it appears to me that an educational institutional installing this plugin would be putting itself in potential violation of FERPA. FERPA: http://www2.ed.gov/policy/gen/guid/fpco/ferpa/index.html When the NBC logo is clicked from within the text-editor, the plugin does not allow a student to view that his or her educational information will be shared, or allow a student to opt-in or out of sharing. Users of this plugin would have no idea his or her educational information is being shared. You also mentioned the subscription license agreement, is this something that is publicly available online? Thanks, Mike H.
Comment 3: Hi Michael, We welcome your feedback and already started making changes to the plugin documentation.    If you can email me @ michael.levin@nbclearn.com, I will send you a copy for your review and feedback. We have hundreds of institutions using our LMS plug-ins or have some sort of Single Sign On ( Shibboleth , etc.) but we would be delighted to have an offline discussion to see if we can help you modify the LTI attribute information released to us.    A valid email address is not necessary to provide authentication; we just need a unique identifier in the syntax of an email address. What I'm also hearing you say is that it would beneficial to have the ability for institutions to disable/hide the NBC logo from the text editor for specific roles (e.g. students). When you email me, please provide me your institution name and I can also provide the signed subscription license agreement. Regards, Michael
Comment 4: Hi Michael, I'd rather not recommend a specific fix for the problem, but if your team needs a quick list of suggested "best-practice" development principles, the FTC has a few suggestions. http://www.ftc.gov/news-events/press-releases/2012/03/ftc-issues-final-commission-report-protecting-consumer-privacy Privacy by Design - companies should build in
consumers' privacy protections at every stage in developing their
products. These include reasonable security for consumer data, limited
collection and retention of such data, and reasonable procedures to
promote data accuracy; Simplified Choice for Businesses and Consumers -
companies should give consumers the option to decide what information is
shared about them, and with whom. This should include a Do-Not-Track
mechanism that would provide a simple, easy way for consumers to control
the tracking of their online activities . Greater Transparency - companies should disclose
details about their collection and use of consumers' information, and
provide consumers access to the data collected about them. Thanks for fielding a few of my concerns, and I look forward to seeing any new versions released. - Mike H.
Comment 5: BTW , Thanks for addressing the privacy issues in the latest release of your plugin. I'm looking forward to re-assessing the plugin and potentially installing it in the future. I hope the title wasn't too alarmist, I believe I had just had a rich glass of coffee that morning! - Mike H.

Comment 1: Hi Sourabh, This is a variation of a query we see occasionally on the community forums, and noone has yet demonstrated why they need this or what they hope to achieve. Forum Post: 
Post title: Flash module add-on: Flash & Moodle Questions
Post description: Hi Guys, I am in some major need of some help. I have some questions that I am hoping someone can help me out with. First I will describe my situation and then I will post my questions. So, first off I am trying to create this course as e-learning course for employees of the company to log on and get training. Now I am just picking up where someone else has left off. But originally the course was not going to be like this, but it has manifested into something else. So, because the original person doing this had said Moodle could handle it, everyone now believes it can. Even though though the original creator says he does not think so any more. However was saying something about an application that is coming out that will do this? Problem: I have this Flash presentation I have created and in it it has 20 mins of presentation and then a short quiz. Then another 20 mins of presentation and then another short quiz (so on and so forth). What is wanted from this, is so that the employee logs on and does the whole presentation and all the quizzes, and Moodle stores the quiz results. What I need to know: 1. Can Moodle actually take the quiz scores from Flash and store them?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You can surely put up a flash video, then have another activity for the quiz defined, followed by new video and quiz, etc. That's pretty straight forward, though there are peculiarities with settings, etc. Now then, I don't know much about the variety of things that people actually mean when they use the term "flash", though I've been seeing simple flv files called, that swf files, and then I hear about course authoring suites -- sometimes quite expensive, which would seem to do what you want. If you're being fancy, you want something like a Scorm or IMS package.. there are forums for those. These involve rather complex packages put together outsive of Moodle, but which somehow integrate with Moodle such that your questions get read and stored inside Moodle. I don't know how stable or effective those are. You might find help in forums outside of Moodle where course authors are struggling. One such community might be around the Exe course authoring system which puts files together. Also I've started to look and and have not done much yet with Udutu, which is an online place for building complex packages, and they have provided tools for getting their stand alone flash learning packages a Moodle module for linking tests, etc. You're obviously doing something to get to those 20 minute sound and video and quiz product, so the source might be helpful? Just some quick thoughts.
Comment 2: Hi Steve, Thanks for your post!!!! Well what I mean by Flash is that I have Adobe Flash and have made the presentation, and the quiz right in there. So it would be an .swf file that is loaded up. Steve Says: "You can surely put up a flash video, then have another activity for the quiz defined, followed by new video and quiz, etc. That's pretty straight forward, though there are peculiarities with settings, etc." I know how to do that part, but the thing is, my company does not want that. If you want a straight example of what they want, and then maybe you or someone else can help me: http://norcattraining.com/courses.asp -Click on "Try Demo" under WHMIS (Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System -Then Click "Enter Demo" - Enter UserID: whmis - Enter Password: demo Now I believe that site is running off a database which is not like Moodle, but the only reason why they wanted Moodle is because it was Open Source. I have only read a little on SCORM packages, and I don't understand them a whole lot. I am a web designer, with little programming knowledge. Would this be too complex? Thanks so much guys!!!! This means a lot to me!! Jen
Comment 3: I've wandered over to Udutu and noticed that they have forums and provide support to Moodle users. I can't imagine having the skills to produce what you've produced in Flash, so using the free online Udutu tools should be a piece of cake. What's called for there is instructional design moxie in laying out the logic of branching, SCORM isn't that hard to understand, though it seems to take a great deal to get the various dependencies organized. It's primarily, to my mind, a set of procedures for hooking complex things together in reliable ways. The challenge that's being addressed there is how to produce an integrated product in one location (e.g. your computer) such that you can compress it and move it into a course authoring system where all the links to fields for storing scores, running videos, managing sound and text files, etc. will work. I'm sure you can handle it. I'm not sure what kinds of constraints you'll run into. You might need, for instance, to strip the questions out of your flash and put them into their system, along with the flv resources, such that the zipped file you download will link to the Moodle resources that need hooking. I hope somebody can produce a more reliable response for Jen.

Post title: Add-On That Keeps Cumulative Sums
Post description: Hello-- I'm using the Moodle platform in a class in which the students have to keep track of their hours performing certain required activities in order to graduate. I'm looking for a plug-in that would allow students to check-off activities and put in the number of hours they spent on that activity and the plug-in would keep a cumulative total of their hours that the teachers could access. For example: On Monday, Suzy enters something like: Home Visit: 2 hours Book Chapter: 1 hour The plug in would tell her (and the teachers) that she has a total of 3 hours completed. Then on Tuesday, she enters: Clinic Rotation: 1 hour The plug-in would keep a cumulative total and tell her (and the teachers) that she now has a total of three hours. In other words, I need to be able to see 1.  What activities she completed  2. How long they took her  3.  Her cumulative number of hours. Checklist is a great plug in for half of this, but it won't tally hours. Can anyone help? Thanks-TJM

Post title: Publish Flow Block without using MNET
Post description: I'm attempting to utilize Publish Flow to deploy courses to another moodle site hosted on the same server . My difficulty thus far has been that when I deploy a course, the only option available to me is Local. I do not see my other locally hosted moodle Training sites that also have Publish Flow block installed. I do not want to use MNET / XMLRPC. Has anyone gotten this to work? Scenario: PFHost-->(PUBLISH TO)-->PFClientA, PFClientB, PFClientC, etc.. Jeff
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Couldn't get this to work and moved on to MNET. Still can't get Publish Flow working in Moodle 2.5 though. Employed the workaround from Moodle 1.9 in serverlib.php after line the "NORMAL PLUGIN DISPATCHER" as it still seemed to apply. // BEGIN PUBLISH FLOW HACK } elseif ($callstack[0] == 'blocks') { list($base, $block, $filename, $functionname) = $callstack; $includefile = '/blocks/publishflow/rpclib.php'; $response = mnet_server_invoke_method($includefile, $functionname, $method, $payload); $response = mnet_server_prepare_response($response); echo $response; } elseif ($callstack[0] == 'mod' || 'dangerous' == $CFG->mnet_dispatcher_mode) { list($base, $module, $filename, $functionname) = $callstack; // END PUBLISH FLOW HACK The problem I have now though is that I'm throwing a Payload not Encrypted error. Anyone heard of this?
Comment 2: Noted that 1.9 hack calls mnet_server_invoke_method which does not exist in 2.5. Invoking as dangerous. Still receiving Payload not Encrypted. By printing the contents of $payload I can see that this is the case but I don't particularly care. Is there a way to stop this check?
Comment 3: Okay. So it appears that publish flow does not encrypt its transactions $payload. So, this will need to be fixed..

Post title: Issue with custom local plugin
Post description: Hello, We're developing a custom local plugin for specific functionality on our Moodle website, including custom settings fields to store images at the plugin level. I'm currently facing difficulty retrieving the image URL at the plugin level. Could someone guide me through the steps necessary to achieve this? Thanks in advance Regards Rudraksh
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Rudraksh, The information you need can be found in the File API documentation . One of the keys to figuring out how to get the URL of a stored file is to make sure that you stored it correctly in the first place. The Form API documentation on uploading files in forms may help you with that. If you didn't store it correctly, no amount of trying to get the right URL will work for you. Another place to find relevant examples is to look for a plugin in moodle.org/plugins that stores an image file and retrieves it. The plugin doesn't need to particularly do what you are trying to do, just have that little piece code that features the sought functionality. I hope you find this information helpful. If you have any specific questions, feel free to ask. It would be helpful if you could include a link and point us to relevant sections of the source code. Best regards, Michael Milette

Post title: Exercise module add-on: Trivial FTP-problem (I guess)
Post description: When moving my moodle-installation to a different server , I downloaded the moodledata-folder. Everything came down, except the files of the exercise-module. Only the filename was in the download , the actual files where empty. I got a warning from my ftp -client (no access or file doesn't exist), so I used for that one course with exercises the build-in backupfunction. filepermissions where 600 on the file, 777 on the parent folder(s). It's strange that it has a 600 permission isn't it?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: This is a rather old post, but since I deal with FTP and chmod all the time, I thought I would reply. Yes.  Finding a 600 permission on a file/folder is strange.  Default is almost always 644 or 755; so finding a 600 will almost certainly mean the permissions were manually set.
Comment 2: Yes, that looks odd, on my server the directories are 0750 and the submitted files have 0777. The latter is a bit bizarre but the directory permissions guard against prying eyes.

Forum Post: 
Post title: List of needed plugins?
Post description: Hey there, I'm new to plugins and have been having very slow page loading times. I'm not sure which plugins I can safely uninstall. I'm doing simple topic quizzes and grade reports. could possibly do some video's with quizzes in the future. Does anyone have a list of basic plugins I would need so i could start weeding out some of the baggage? Thanks for your time, Ed Z
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Page loading times are probably not related to the number of plugins you have installed - for example, even if the 'assign' module was very slow (picking a plugin at random - please don't read anything into that mention), but you didn't ever use it, then it wouldn't be able to slow anything down. Even if you were using it, then the only things it would slow down would be the pages within the 'assign' module itself (e.g. the submission page, the grading pages, etc.), not the course page or any of the other pages on your site (the exception to this would be an activity module that added extra, dynamic information into the course page, such as the number of unread forum posts, but again, this is only a problem if you are using that plugin). In theory, blocks could slow a course page down, but, again, only if a particularly slow block was in use on that page. So to sum up - uninstalling plugins is unlikely to help with performance problems. Certainly don't uninstall any of the core plugins, as they will only reappear when you upgrade to the latest core code. Much better performance suggestions can be found here: http://docs.moodle.org/en/Performance_recommendations and here: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/view.php?f=94

I traced it down to the permissions not being set to allow a student to Open a dialogue. I don't know how they were dropped, but once I added the student role back to being allowed to open a dialogue, it worked for all of them. Just something to check. Hope it helps, AL

Post description: This is probably a long shot, but I'll ask.  We began having issues on both our test and production servers with the Blackboard Collaborate plugin (/mod/elluminate).  Our cron.php page is failing with the error below.  It appears to be having trouble getting a proper response from the server .  We can still create and join sessions, but it seems to be problem with retrieving the recordings details.  We haven't made any changes and I'm wondering if other people are having this issue as well. 
```text
Default exception handler: Exception - looks like we got no 
XML
 document Debug: 


Error code: generalexceptionmessage


* line 82 of /mod/elluminate/elluminate/ws/soap/helper.php: Elluminate_Exception thrown


* line 242 of /mod/elluminate/elluminate/ws/sas/implementation.php: call to Elluminate_WS_SOAP_Helper->send_command()


* line 93 of /mod/elluminate/elluminate/ws/sas/implementation.php: call to Elluminate_WS_SAS_Implementation->executeCommand()


* line 155 of /mod/elluminate/elluminate/recordings/statusupdate.php: call to Elluminate_WS_SAS_Implementation->getRecordingPlaybackDetails()


* line 60 of /mod/elluminate/elluminate/recordings/statusupdate.php: call to Elluminate_Recordings_StatusUpdate->executeWebServiceCall()


* line 52 of /mod/elluminate/elluminate/cron/recordingupdateaction.php: call to Elluminate_Recordings_StatusUpdate->doRecordingFileStatusUpdate()


* line 50 of /mod/elluminate/elluminate/cron/runner.php: call to Elluminate_Cron_RecordingUpdateAction->executeCronAction()


* line 67 of /mod/elluminate/lib.php: call to Elluminate_Cron_Runner->executeCronActions()
```

Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: yes Nate, me too.  I've been working with Elluminate support and my elluminate sessions sometimes don't even work when I click join session. My cron both inside server and through web failed.  Inside the server i found two corrupt files which when i replaced them worked fine.  but my web cron at  . . . admin/cron.php still fails to work. Here's what the admin at Elluminate just emailed me and I found your post because I'm trying to see what soap errors means. My workaround for now was to have all students use the guest link which works outside moodle. However the teachers can't be moderators this way so i'm asking elluminate to please give teachers access to their moderator links so we can bypass moodle in cases where it's having issues. Right now we are canceling classes right and left due to this problem. BTW , Elluminate is almost done with an update for the moodle elluminate bridge which will work on moodle 1.7 which you may realize will be supported until 2017 - the longest version ever.  That should be smooth sailing for us for a few years so I plan to upgrade both when I can. *** Problem - when the teacher themself cannot get into Elluminate is there a way for them to see their own Moderator link so they can try to get in without going into Moodle in case that is an issue. This concerns me.  If they can execute the SAS direct guest link, that says that SAS is working fine and this is not related to the SAS issues we've been having. I have created and launched a new session and got same issue.  I can launch from guest link but not from the JOIN link.  Logs showed an error message: 2014-09-24 16:54:33 : DEBUG : [sas : Elluminate_WS_SOAPHelper] : SOAP Error: Failed Sending HTTP SOAP request 2014-09-24 16:54:33 : ERROR : [sas : Elluminate_Exception] : Error Code: 0 - Exception: "Failed Sending HTTP SOAP request" @ Elluminate_WS_SOAP_Helper-> send_command(); This sounds like your server was unable to issue the command.  I'm checking for more information on this error on my end. I think we might want to turn on Moodle debugging to see if there are errors there as well. That I do know how to do: Site Administration>Development> Debugging

Post title: Glossary sorting according to the current language collation rules?
Post description: In Moodle 1.5.2+, i.e. before the general introduction of UTF-8, I wanted to have the glossary entries sorted according to the collation rules of the current language (we have various language departments using Moodle and they like their students to use Moodle in the language they study). So I tried to introduce a little hack into the code of the Glossary module that made it possible. Trying out Moodle 1.6(.1+) I come to the conclusion that I will either have to retain that hack, or throw it into the public space and hope some of the true PHP coders will pick it up and develop further—if other people are interested. What I did was this: in mod/glossary/ sql .php at the very start I inserted // ELFF-mx: start -- determining language for collation $elffcurrlang = ''; $elffcollate = ''; if ($elffcurrlang = current_language()) { switch ($elffcurrlang) { case 'cs_utf': $elffcollate = 'utf8_czech_ci'; break; case 'sv_utf':

Post title: Segfaults during plugin installation
Post description: Dear Moodle Developers, I've been writing a custom local plugin. Unfortunately installation of any plugin, including my own, results in apache segfault: 
```text
[Sat Dec 06 01:06:04 2014] [notice] child pid 6517 exit signal Segmentation fault (11)
```
 Attaching gdb resulted in a stack trace found in the attached file. Looks like php's got a problem with admin/index.php file. It happens both with Moodle 2.6 and 2.7 combined with php 5.5 or 5.6. I'm guessing it might be a php configuration problem. This segfault may have something in common with writing capabilities to the database since quite often (but not always!) one of two capabilities provided by the package turns out to be absent in the database when the server "comes to its senses" later on. Note: the package does not install any database tables, it uses an external database. Please help me if yoh have any guess or were successful in getting rid of the same problem yourself.

Comment 3: Hi Cathy, You probably get the "Moodle Service Connection Failure" problem as the php in your service.php file is not syntactically correct. (The last '{' should be a '}') MoodleService.send_response() (in Flash, on the client) tries to invoke the send_response() function in the service.php (on the server ) which fails to execute. The only thing that flash_save_response() does is to record its given arguments in the database (in the flash_answers table) It is listed in ./mod/flash/movies/library.php. Let Flash work out the score for your Drag & Drop quiz and pass on that score to Moodle using MoodleService.send_response(), as discussed earlier. Rene.
Comment 4: The content of this forum post has been removed and can no longer be accessed.
Comment 5: Hi Cathy, My production server is on PHP 4.4.3 with Zend Engine v1.3, and Moodle 1.7 (2006101007), on linux On my localhost I'm running PHP 5.2.0 with Zend Engine v2.2.0 and Moodle 1.7+ (2006101009), on Windows XP SP2. Rene.

Forum Post: 
Post title: issue on installing benchmarking suite (GSB block & report)
Post description: Hi, I've had an issue when trying to install these items on our moodle. Essentially, it looks like all has gone well, but when you then try to log in/out, you get redirected to a page saying object moved. if you then manually change your url to go back to the front page , you are taken there to find that you have been logged in/out as you were trying to do. Also, files within moodle stop working and give the same error. Purging all caches doesn't change anything, and on its own, uninstalling the reports and block doesn't But if you uninstall both report and block, and then purge all caches, voila, moodle works correctly again. we are running Moodle 2.6.2+ (Build: 20140508) on a windows 2012 server with PHP 5.6.0. the database is on MSSQL on a seperate server. we have a seperate moodle on a box that is a clone from a few weeks ago that we used to upgrade php on which the problem hasn't occured (both boxes now are on php 5.6 with identical settings) Can anybody shed any light on possible causes? Thanks, Graham
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: issue solved. In case anybody else has this problem, who is using IIS and wincache, setting wincache.ocenabled=1  seems to cause an issue when adding new plugins, presumably due to the way it caches.  disable this line in php.ini and the issue shouldn't occur.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Programs Assignment
Post description: I'm developing new module based on the standard module 'Assignment'. It's assignment, but students will send their programs and system will give them marks automatically . Students will have various tasks and for each task there will be a set of tests to test how well program works. I develop it mainly for C++, but I think I'll make it language independent. All messages with ideas or comments on ths topic are welcomed.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Perhaps this is too obvious to be worth mentioning, but security would be a very big concern for such a module. Otherwise some student, or somebody masquerading as a student, could submit some very nasty program to be run by your module. In fact I think that in the generality you propose (language independent), you can't possibly design a secure module for doing this. Perhaps by being very careful with permissions and process uids and gids, you might achieve this on a unix server , but I very much doubt you could do this on a Windows server.
Comment 2: Thanks, I'll be carefull. I understand, there is a big security problem in such systems. Windows isn't good for it, but I'll try. Do you know how to make process run safe in WinXP?
Comment 3: Interesting idea, Andrew ... can you explain to us further about the approach you're planning to take?
Comment 4: This idea came to me when I was devoloping program for ACM Programming Contests .
I thought, if to make the same system, but for students. Such module is very good for courses in programming, but only for tasks that
use console or file input/output (for example: there is array of numbers in
file and student should write a program to sort them). So student's program is tested on some set of tests (tests are different for
each task) test can be: file for input and one(or more) file with correct output program that generates input and checks output file for input and program that checks output Certainly there is a time limit for each task. I already have a prototype of such system and it works but it is not for Moodle,
so I plan to make it work with Moodle.
Comment 5: Did you have any luck with this new module, Andrew?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Ouriginal plugin repository is readonly: what to do now?
Post description: Hi all, We're using the Ouriginal services integrated with the urkund plugin . I've detected just now that the repository, under the Dan Marsden github user, is just readonly from January 2023 and linking to https://www.ouriginal.com/ . The points I would like to remark are: On the official site, there is no news about a repository for this plugin nor any way of asking/contributing. The Moodle plugins directory for this plugin has outdated details (all of that related to the github). We are willing to ask for new configuration possibilities, and I thought about asking opinion to Dan. Now, I do not know how to proceed. Anyone has contacted or knows how to contribute or ask for new functionalities? By the way, thanks Dan for the big efforts on keeping this plugin.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Now that Turnitin own ouriginal they have no longer been interested in funding my time to maintain the plugin. They did have some internal developers who expressed an interest in me transferring the github repo to them but they haven't been able to figure it out so I flagged my repo as archived to better reflect the state and transferred ownership of the plugins db entry to a Turnitin developer from their ouriginal team. Turnitin have previously purchased other competitors in the past and shut their services down, migrating clients to their main product. I've also heard from some ouriginal clients that sales teams have been in touch looking to migrate them to use Turnitin. I would advise you contact your ouriginal support contact and ask them what their plans are for ongoing Moodle support. It may not be worth you investing further in if they plan to shut down. I have no visibility or knowledge that suggests they will shut it down or if they have plans for ongoing development, but as you have a contract with them you will likely be able to get an official answer. I'd be interested to hear what you find out!
Comment 2: Thanks a lot Dan, for your details. We will be contacting to our provider as you suggested. I think that, meanwhile, we should be building the changes we need locally. Thanks, Jordi

Post title: Electronic Laboratory Notebook Activity and related plugins
Post description: Inspired by Mark Muyskens (Calvin College) talk at BCCE on Electronic Laboratory Notebook
(ELN) in which he used a Moodle Wiki as an ELN, I've developed a ELN module based on the ouwiki. Students can work either separately or
as groups on ELN pages.  Instructors can grade the ELN pages, provide
templates of experiment pages and much more.  I've also developed three
Atto plugins and and two filters to be used with the ELN that allow students to
insert chemical structures, timestamps, spectra and spreadsheets. Some changes to the ouwiki include; * extensive language file string changes * Add "New Experiment" tab to navigation tabs for easily creating new experiment pages. * Changed start page to My ELN Index. * Add ability to "Clone experiments" sections into new pages. * Migrated to new events API * Integrated index searching * Added "Search" tab to Details page. Plugins I developed that go well with the ELN activity include; Structure Plugin (moodle-atto_structure) - Allows students to draw
chemical structures and easily insert into ELN or any other pages. 
Requires MarvinJS.

Post title: Error: User Record Not found
Post description: We have 52 courses running on our Moodle (version 1.9.2). Each of them has 1 instance of the dialogue module that we are using as a journal. In one of the courses the teacher can no longer see the list of journal entries. She can add a new entry, and the students will see it, but she cannot. It say's "User's record not found". As the site admin, I cannot see the list of entries either. We had an issue with our server a couple weeks ago and this was happening to everybody. It turns out there was a repair needed in the database . Once I did that it was working fine. This time, the database does not appear to need to be repaired. Has this happened to anybody else? Or does anybody have any suggestions as to what the problem might be?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I don't know if you found an answer to your problem, but I was having the same issue. Most of my teachers would see their list of Current Dialogues just fine, but one teacher just got the message "User's record not found". I tracked it down to incorrect data in my database. In the mdl_dialogue_conversations table I found an entry with a recipientid and lastrecipientid of 0. Since I don't have a user with an ID of 0 I knew this was wrong. I changed the two fields to the ID of a valid user and the error went away. Note that since I didn't actually know who this dialogue should have been for (since the value was 0), I ended up just finding the dialogue and asking the student to re-enter it. Hope this helps.

Currently we are trying to, as much as possible, automate mangement of these enviroments. In this process ofcourse comes management of plugins and I am trying to easily access all versions of plugins. It should be apperently but both my short attention spam and google-fu is failing me. :\ - I have tried to use moosh to list all plugins but, as I do it, I dont get the version of the plugin. The idea is to hold a static file with all plugins and versions that should correspond from dev => qa => prod. Then ansible goes into the enviorment and validates all these versions. if the version is correct it ignores it, but if it is wrong we install it using: moosh plugin-install -d <plugin> <version>, purging cache and so on... f.e. moosh plugin-install -d someplugin 2019100100 This version is stored in the plugins version.php but I find the plugin structure a bit tricky. But are there some other way of obtaining this version number in an easy fashion, preferably from moosh. An alternative is to try to ape after the php script that list them in the WUI or even just parse it out from the version.php files? As we have multiple nodes per enviroment I might not get around synchronizing the entire webdir from one node to all others(but simply making sure to run moosh plugin-install -d someplugin should solve this on all nodes ) Any tips or tricks would be greatly appreciated. And I am so sorry if the question is stupid. edit: Sorry, quick on the question. I can ofcourse use the database and get mdl_config to get the value where name = 'version' and plugin is the plugin but still. Any other ideas? Cheers'

Post title: Updating Record in database not working
Post description: G'day, I'm having issues with updating a database based on an event trigger in moodle. This event trigger is a particular quiz and upon the student passing their custom field will be updated from 'pending' to 'approved'. This however, doesn't always update the database for some reason, even though I know for sure that the if statement below is triggering with a true statement. $courseid = $search->course; $grading_info = grade_get_grades($courseid, 'mod', 'quiz', $quizid, $user); $gradepass = $grading_info->items[0]->gradepass; $grade = $grading_info->items[0]->grades[$user]->grade; //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- if ($grade == $gradepass) { //-------------------------- SQL QUERY---------------------------------------------------------------------------- //Finds the 'id' of the user relative to the table 'user_info_data' - requirement for update_record feature $params = ['userid' => $user]; $return = 'id'; $select = 'userid = :userid AND fieldid = 1'; $table = 'user_info_data'; $id = $DB->get_field_select($table, $return, $select, $params, $strictness=IGNORE_MISSING); //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //Defining variables for updating record of user to "approved" $dataobject = (object)[]; $dataobject->id = $id; $dataobject->data = "approved"; //Updating database $table = 'user_info_data'; $DB->update_record($table, $dataobject, $bulk=false); I believe there may be an issue with updating the table 'user_info_data', not too sure why, because it does update the required value sometimes but not all the time. Any help is appreciated!

Comment 4: @Marco - defer to Davo! My only excuse for attempting to answer, posted in 'General Plugins' and not in 'Developers' ('senior moment'?)  I see now that General Plugins is really for Developers as well. :\ My bad! Moderator ... please remove my responses from this thread so as not to confuse anyone! 'SoS', Ken
Comment 5: Well, an obvious issue would be that you don't handle the case where a user doesn't have an existing value for fieldid 1 (and hard-coding field values like that is also pretty bad - much better to use a DB query to get the id from the 'shortname' value). Users don't automatically get a value for each custom field when the custom field is created, so it is entirely possible that the value in $id will be 'false' (because there is no existing record), which won't work when you try to call $DB->update_record(). You need to handle the case of $id being false, by preparing the required data and calling $DB->insert_record() instead. There may be other issues with your code, but that's the one that stands out to me.
Comment 6: Hi Davo, I can see the mistake that the DB query may yield nothing if the fieldid doesn't exist. Could you please elaborate on "DB query to get the id from the 'shortname' value"? I guess the most appropriate way would be to use a record_exists() for the id DB query followed by a logic check which would lead to an update_record() or insert_record() call. Appreciate the response.
Comment 7: You should not, generally, assume that the custom user profile field with id '1' on your dev server is exactly the same field as the custom profile field with id '1' on your production server (if they were created in a different order, or you created a field and then deleted it, you would end up with different ids). So, assuming you have defined a field with the 'short name' value of 'myfield', then you can write: $fieldid = $DB->get_field('user_info_field', 'id', ['shortname' => 'myfield']); You can then use that $fieldid value in your later queries to get the correct record from table 'user_info_data' (or you can create a slightly more complex SQL query that gets both bits of data at the same time). You could use 'record_exists()', but if that returned true, then you'd need to do another query to get the id of the record (and extra DB queries add an overhead that you don't want). Far better to still do your original $DB->get_field_select() query, then, if that returns false (which it will do, if the record is not found), do the insert. It is best to save record_exists() for situations where you don't need any information about the record other than the fact that it exists.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Updated release of Marginalia annotation for Moodle forums
Post description: I have updated the Marginalia annotation feature for Moodle. It adds the capability for users of forums to highlight passages of text and create associate annotations in a margin beside each post. The annotations can be searched and shared with others. Code and installation instructions are available at www.geof.net/code/annotation/ . Since I previously announced the feature on the Moodle forums, I have made a number of improvements: Marginalia now supports Internet Explorer in addition to Firefox users can view each others' highlights and annotations directly on forum pages, not just in the searchable summary the search capability has been enhanced numerous bug fixes, optimizations, and better documentation support for Moodle 1.6 The system is currently in use at Malaspina University College and Simon Fraser University in BC, Canada. I would like to thank BC Campus for funding this effort, and for allowing its release under the GNU General Public License, and to Simon Fraser University for their support of the project through Dr. Andrew Feenberg's Applied Communication and Technology Lab in the School of Communication and through the Learning and Instructional Development Centre.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: This looks great but I am having a hard time following the install instructions. Most mods I download just involve dragging and dropping files into the appropriately folder. Is there an easy way to install Marginalia? Thanks Rob
Comment 2: I missed this at the time, but it's worth answering. The short answer is "no". Most Moodle plug-ins are units of functionality independent of each other. Marginalia, however, adds functionality to an existing plug in: it adds an annotation margin and other UI elements to the forum module. This is something Moodle doesn't anticipate, so there's no simple way to do it. Marginalia therefore has to directly modify the forum code with a patch. The longer answer is that although there is no way around patching the forum, I have just released a version of Marginalia that is easier to install. It uses the hooks Moodle provides to automatically set up the database , and it consolidates its language files into a block plug-in. The latest release has numerous bug fixes and UI refinements. It also features a quote button that makes it easy to quote passages from forum posts (highlight a passage and hit quote: it will automatically paste the quote into any post you might be editing, or start a new post if necessary). The quote feature can also be used to effectively convert annotations to forum posts. Users had been trying to conduct discussions in the margin, which was rather impractical, especially since discussion is what the forum itself is for. You can get the latest at code.google.com/p/marginalia .

Post title: Search by teacher
Post description: Here at our dept each teacher has many courses. Studends usually know their teachers but not the exact name of each course, wich changes every year and is generally not easy to remember. AFAIK the standard course search box searches within course name, short name and description. Is it possible to search courses by teacher? My workaround is the QuickFind plugin since the profile page of each teacher has that teachers's course list. Of course it would be much better a plugin giving directly a course list as a result. A SQL query for such a search is easy but I've zero knowledge of Moodle APIs. Any clue? In alternative, could a block such as QuickFind be placed at the bottom of the home page together with the standard course search box?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: The block QuickFind can be placed anywhere a block can be placed.  However, you will need to give students rights to use and also give them access to all the users in the site which is probably not the best idea. Why not just add the teacher name to the summary of each course and then they can search for the teacher name in  the search courses box.  It will search the summary as well as the course title.
Comment 2: The problem is that our director has decided that any teacher can create his/her own courses. All teachers are also course-creators. Of course I can ask them to add their name to the description but I'm quite sure that the will eventually forget to do it. On the other hand I can set QuickFind to only search among teachers. Comment 4: Hi, you should enable authenticated users (or even guests) to use that block and to add that block to their home page. Then you can add the block to the default dashboard . G.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Etherpad and sharing
Post description: Hi, I use etherpad version 1.8.5 and the Moodle plugin 2019013100. So far everything works, only if I want to use the share feature in etherpad, the generated addresses can't be called. I get the message that I don't have the right rights. It does not matter if I allow guests in the plugin settings or not. Is there a solution for this? Does etherpad need another activated plugin? Or is the activation for guests not intended at all? Many greetings Jörg
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Jörg, unfortunately there is a conceptual problem. Pads created in Moodle using the API are called "group pads". You can see this by the pad name. Example: g.dlXEnw4MpnBKF1Mt$mymoodlepads These pads cannot be shared and can only be accessed with a valid session that was also created by the API. Bottom line: there doesn't seem to be a way to share your pads. Best regards Andreas
Comment 2: thanx a lot ;)! that saves me the search for possible errors.
