Post title: Anyone hear about/know of a company called Epsilen?
Post description: Has recently been awarded a contract to provide a portal ("does it all") for the State of Texas (where I live/work) called "Project Share". Am wondering if anyone from Epsilen has been in contact with anyone involved in the Moodle Project. Some info: Epsilen Announces Single Sign-On Integration with Moodle Course ... Sep 1, 2009 ... Moodle users can now automatically create an Epsilen account from within the Moodle course management system and seamlessly log in to ... www.prweb.com/releases/2009/09/prweb2815834.htm Epsilen : News "We are excited to provide institutions using Moodle with single sign-on access and integration services to the Epsilen suite of advanced eLearning tools," ... www. epsilen .com/LandingSite/ContentPage.aspx?...tab=3 Thanks, in advance, for anything you can share! Ken
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Ken, I have just had a quick look at it. From my point it is a PR from end for the net with $$ attached. I am at a loss to see just how it and Moodle fit together. Mahara it is NOT.
Comment 2: It appears this mostly PR announcement is related to their core product which is an e-portfolio. Single-sign-on (SSO) is no big deal; Moodle supports this feature and many systems have taken advantage of it. What's more interesting about your post is that Texas is looking at the technology. That's very cool! Mahara, an open source e-portfolio, contends with the best of what's out there right now in proprietary commercial software and has long been integrated with Moodle with an SSO.

Post title: CMS integrations: Drupal and Moodle - more than SSO?
Post description: Does anyone know if there are any integrations between Moodle and Drupal as far as profile, content, assignment, calendar events going into Drupal? I jsut realized that Joomla can do this http://docs.moodle.org/21/en/Integrations#Joomla . I thought it was just SSO but apparantly it transfers over content too. Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Melissa, AFAIK there are only a handful of Drupal modules for Moodle integration ( http://drupalmodules.com/search/node/moodle ). Integration FAQ might give you some more pointers. However, as both Moodle (1.9 > 2.x) and Drupal (6 > 7) undergo major upgrades at the moment there might not be a lot of modules available for each combination of versions. See also these discussions in the Drupal in Education user group: * Drupal-Moodle Integration: Still used, desired? * Drupal 6 and Moodle hth Frank

The applications are great, but I was thinking, it would be wonderful for my school if I could use one of these apps for the students to study and then the techers use them to test the students.  The apps have tousands of vocabulary words, their definations and word usage, and there is an audio feature, so the words are pronounced for the student, then he/she spells them out and the app then grades them. I want to removed as must manual grading from my teachers are possible.  This would be an awesome feature and would endure this application to more elementary, middle and high schools.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Category Activity Report
Post description: Is anyone using this plugin ( Admin Report: Category Activity Report ) successfully?  I cannot get it to work.  For example, it's listing level 3 categories as top level. I don't want to add it to the Tracker until I know if this is just me experiencing this problem.  I've added several comments to the bottom of the plugin page, but there's no response.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I've been looking at this carefully for a few hours now, and I think the problem is in this code of the lib.php file: REPLACE(substring(cats.path, 2, 2),\'/\',\'\') As categoryid This seems to work well if the categoryid is below 100, but when you get into the 3 digits, as we do, it no longer works.  I *think* I need this changed to something that will extract the digits between the first '/' and the second '/' of the path, regardless of the length.  I don't know how to do that, but I'll give it a look tomorrow if nobody else has an answer! Thanks!
Comment 2: Although I don't really know what I'm doing, I made the following changes to my lib.php file: /* in the following case, replaced this code: REPLACE(substring(cats.path, 2, 2),\'/\',\'\') with this code: REPLACE(substring_index(cats.path, \'/\',2),\'/\',\'\') in the following case structure: */ case STATS_REPORT_ACTIVE_CATEGORIES_TOP; $param-> sql = 'SELECT cats.path, REPLACE(substring_index(cats.path, \'/\',2),\'/\',\'\') AS categoryid, cats.name, SUM(COALESCE(mergedstats.line1,0)) AS line1' .' FROM '.$CFG->prefix.'course_categories cats LEFT JOIN' .' (SELECT course.category, sum(stat1+stat2) AS line1' .' FROM '.$CFG->prefix.'stats_'.$param->table.' stats' .' JOIN '.$CFG->prefix.'course course ON course.id = stats.courseid' This has resulted in the category IDs being correct and thus the hyperlinks pointing to the correct location on the final report.  However, the labels of the Top Level report are from the most active sub-category of each Top Level, rather than from the Top Level! I'm kind of stuck here and will probably give up unless someone reads this and can point me in the right direction.
